comment: horrible professor. his class is extremely unorganized, he has no slides or unit organization, and he has a horrible attitude. gets offended easily and is extremely rude sometimes
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He rambles about nothing. He puts no effort into figuring out how to be efficient and a portion of the class is him fumbling around. Emails arent answered or are answered very late. He offers very little feedback. When asked for some he was very rude, as if I had insulted him. Grading is based almost entirely on tests, so dont mess up.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He literally just rambles. Does not make the class interesting. Gets off topic a lot.

Professor Trevithick is a really nice man, but his class is difficult because it's very lecture-heavy, graded by only a handful of assignments, and he's a really tough grader. However, he does give a grading curve, which is helpful.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: best professor at fordham
Professor T is really understanding towards his students! would definitely take another class with him

Prof T is super nice and really knows a lot of stuff. He does tend to ramble, but writes down all the notes you need on the board, takes pictures, and then posts them on BB. Tests are somewhat difficult, and the readings can be long, but he does go over the main points you need to know in class. Go to class, take notes, and you'll be fine.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved Alan! He is extremely caring and allows for a lot of extra credit. His lectures are a little boring, but his kindness makes up for it. Easy class, but there's a lot of reading and he tends to be a tough grader. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

Do yourself a favor and don't take his class. He has a good intent, but taking this class made me hate the subject. Interesting articles but he's insanely disorganized and the lectures consist of him somewhat incoherently rambling. Tests aren't easy but he does scale them. Also much harsher of a grader than you'd expect.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: A double edged sword. He is smart and enjoys the topics he teaches, but often forgets to show up for class and schedules tests to then not administer them. Sounds like a cool thing, when a professor forgets a test, but when he didn't show up to the final that my class spent a decent amount of time studying for it was.... less than ideal.
overall an extremely confusing class
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Professor T for ANTH 2500. At first I thought the class would be an easy A because he just rambles and doesn't take attendance, however the final grade of the class depends on 2 take home exams and his grading makes zero sense. If you need extra help, he NEVER replies to emails so don't even bother. Would not take again.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I have no idea how this man has a 2.2 rating. He made all of our quizzes and exams take-home!!! It's a really easy A if you show up to class, copy down the notes, and have a basic understanding of the readings. Not very difficult. Very interesting topics as well. Also, he's a generous grader. You can't go wrong with taking his class.

Prof. Trevithick is a nice guy, but his class is honestly just SO boring. The readings are so long and dense, and his lectures are just a bunch of rambling on about the readings. He does give a heavy curve on tests, though. Not that hard of a class just very boring.

Professor Trevithick's class is an easy A if you're willing to put in the work. Show up, take notes, and you're good to go -- it's all on the test. He's very friendly and funny, but the class is 75 minutes of straight lecturing, so just be prepared and ready to pay attention. Two tests and some quizzes, although they're take-home, which helps!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He doesn't have clear criteria for tests and the questions are extremely random and specific. Most of the quizzes are take home which is nice. His lectures are long and scattered, but he takes test questions from his notes on the board so you have to pay attention.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The worst professor I've ever had. I was so excited to take Human Sexuality but I feel like I know less about it AFTER taking this class than before. He had no clear structure to the course, just gave us obscure readings the night before that were not related to each other. However the final was take home which was nice. Easy class, but hated it.

Really knows the subject matter, but classes are lectures instead of discussions, so kind of boring. Nice person, but the most disorganized and unfair professor I have taken. Didn't grade tests for half the class and the tests were based off specific details from the readings rather than the ideas he discussed in class. Would not take again.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures were really boring, but you have to pay attention because he writes tests questions directly from class lectures. Make sure you do the reading because he does give pop quizes, although sometimes he gives you a warning. The readings are boring, but if you do them, you'll get an A pretty easily. He gives lots of extra points on tests too
His lectures are very confusing, and he does not give clear-cut notes or instruction for tests and quizzes. He is just teaching whatever is on his mind without a specific plan. Don't take him!

Take him if you just need to fulfill a requirement.  Attendance was not mandatory.  We had two tests and he would drop the lowest grade and count the highest twice - and one of the tests was open note. Totally saved my GPA

Dr. Trevithick's Human Sexuality class was so entertaining. Wasn't sure what to expect but honestly learned a lot. Attendance is NOT mandatory, he stopped taking it after 3rd class. If you don't show up get the notes from someone, it can be hard to do well on the tests. Overall a little nutty but entertaining and interesting. Would recommend.

It's clear he cares so much about the subject matter, but if you don't also care about it, his long lectures won't help. It's a great class if you're actually into it, but if you just want to fill some requirement, pick another class.

One of the worst professors I've had in college. Has the most boring and unclear lectures. Do not take this class if you do not want to read an immense amount every class. He is no assistance to anyone. Drop it while you can.

He's a nice guy he really is, but do not take this class if you won't be able to listen to him talk for the full hour and 15 minutes. He does write notes on the board but they barely help. The readings are pretty lengthy but in order to do well in this class I highly suggest skimming through them. The good thing about him is that he does curving.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Worst professor I had at Fordham. He is very unorganized. He barely answers your emails. The class is boring and pointless. He gives articles that are random and long and hard to read

Dr. Trevithick is nice and he knows his stuff. However, the time of the class, his monotonous tone and his disorganization make the class very boring. The class is not geared toward IPE students at all. That being said, it's overall painless. If you ask him for help, he's great. Otherwise, you can be totally confused. Show interest and ask for help
Extremely nice guy, but very boring. I could barely keep my eyes open during all of his rambling. I would avoid his classes

Okay, almost everything I have read on this website about Professor Trevithick is flat-out inaccurate. He is highly knowledgeable about his subject area and he is clearly dedicated to his job. Also, you have near-total freedom in picking the paper you want. Seriously. Comparative Cultures was an enjoyable class and I would recommend it to anyone.

Might have been more interesting not at 8:30am, but he wasn't that bad...mostly it was the rambling...He likes specifics from lectures/readings so even if you have no idea what he's talking about regurgitate what he says and he'll love it.

really easy class he doesn't even consider attendance half the students only showed up for important dates. it's a very boring class because he doesn't teach with excitement and his tests are structured weird but he gives curves to enhance your grade. his assignments are really easy it's an easy class just do your work and you'll be fine

I liked professor Trevithick, but his class was honestly pointless. For the midterm/test he gave us a list of terms and I just googled them and somehow ended up with an A- in the class, even thought i got a C- on the midterm. If you can get away with skipping every class--you should

Overall a stress-free class. minimal amount of work. What counts toward your grade are 1 paper, a presentation, a final, and a midterm. If you mess up on these things you're screwed which is why many considered the class to be frustrating. Lectures may be boring but you need to TAKE GOOD NOTES for the midterm and final. I cannot stress this enough.

Class has no direction. Lectures are boring and confusing. Need to read articles for each class that are long and esoteric. Frustrating class. midterm, final, paper, and presentation. all confusing as to what they are about and what's on them...

AVOID AT ALL COST!!! his lectures are horrible, and the readings are completely useless. COMPLETELY DISORGANIZED AND THE WORST TEACHER ENCOUNTERED AT FORDHAM! NO EXAGERATION!SHOULD RETIRE ASAP!!! GPA KILLER!

I love Professor Trevithick! I took him for Comparative Cultures and then again for Human Sexuality.  He doesn't use a textbook, only scholarly articles which are usually really interesting.  He's really helpful and knowledgeable if you talk to him after class.  1 10-12 page paper and a midterm and final.  TAKE HIM!

Let's cut to the chase here: the guy is DULL!!! He mumbles throughout the entire lecture, from 8:30 to 9:45. The material is somewhat brutal. Some people will enjoy certain articles, others won't. My advice is to stick with an easy paper topic, listen as carefully as you can in class, and read the articles he assigns ACTIVELY...only way to do well.

One of the most useless professors I've ever had.  Classes are disorganized and the notes he goes over in class do not help you at all.  Extremely hard grader, and it looks like he hasn't changed his required readings since 2005.  It is truly sad that he is considered the better professor to take for Comparative Cultures.

Take this class! (Eros and Ethics). he will assign very interesting movies, shows, and books each week, no textbook required. Very light work due. Discussion based lectures. 2 major essays. I gained so much from this class, like stuff you should know for everyday life and outlook on it. I'm definitely more cultured because of this course.

Took for texts and contexts. readings were fun, classes were just interesting discussions. a really nice and chill person, would highly recommend for core and otherwise. a few short papers, midterm and final are super straightforward. can't go wrong.

I had prof Romagnoli for Murder, Mayhem, and Madness. 25% midterm, 25% for take-home final, 2 major essays (5-7 pages each) worth 25% total, and participation & short reaction papers (1-2 pages each) count for the remaining 25%. Read interesting books and discussed in contexts with philosophers. Clear grading criteria + interesting course. TAKE!!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I had Professor Walker for Comp II, and I can say without a doubt he significantly improved my writing capabilities. He gives frequent papers and written assignments, but all can be revised for a better grade. Papers did take long to come back, but his feedback was thorough, and you could tell he carefully read your work. Excellent choice!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Walker was a really good choice for a virtual English class. He was the first one I've had at Fordham and as long as you participate in class discussions and turn in his papers (following his guidelines) then you should be good. 3 (4 page) papers and 1 (10 page) paper. I would recommend him if you want an easy A in english!

Professor Walker is really great. His class is really easy. I had him for composition II and I got an easy A. The papers are graded mostly on completion, which makes them really easy. The final paper was also very easy and we got to choose about what we wanted to write. Really amazing guy. Take him if you want an easy A

I had him for justice and literature, and it was one of the most eye-opening courses I've had. Walker definitely pushed me and has an eye for a BS response -- he makes you actively think. His personality might be a bit pretentious but that's actually why I loved him -- he has a keen sense of humor. You MUST read all the texts or you'll barely pass
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Walker is a great guy. He really cares about his students and wants you to do well. If you show interest and participate you should do well. Two short papers and one research paper, which is the minimum for the required work for this class. He's a little disorganized but he's incredibly smart. Take him!!

Professor Walker rambles a lot. His class wasn't too bad, but it was definitely boring. I zone out and fall asleep in his class, but surprisingly, I still managed to get an A. He gives extra credit, and chances for you to revise your papers, but there weren't many to begin with. Nonetheless, I would still take him because he isn't a tough grader.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Frustrating is the best word to describe his class. He rarely has a lesson plan. He takes weeks at a time to grade. He grades pretty tough considering the minimal effort he puts into teaching. However, if you use his feedback when you revise, you can get an easy A. Also, there aren't as many essays to write as there are in the other CompII classes.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Walker was by far one of the worst professors i've ever taken. he seems like he's in another world during lectures and barely gets through lessons. Not to mention, you're pretty much clueless as to where you fall in the class. Grades are handed back last minute (he took two months to grade our papers).

Professor Walker is  extremely disorganized but insightful. We had really interesting class discussions and he really wants to hear your thoughts on novels etc. I took him for my EP2 and we only ended up writing two essays and a written final. That being said, you need to participate if you want to do well. Overall a caring guy.

A little haphazard and disorganized, but overall great professor.  Interesting class discussions, and listens to what you have to say.  Asks thought-provoking questions.  No quizzes, tests, midterm, or final - only four papers.
Take him!!! he is an easy A, no tests, does not take attendance,  can revise every assignment. Great professor!!!

Great guy, no exams, just papers! If you can write well, then you're in for an easy A. If you aren't building a relationship with him during office hours and he can easy help you get your papers in the A area. No complaints
Pretty chill professor. He can be boring at times but his class is pretty straight forward and he likes to go in depth with the literary works.

Fantastic. He is simply fantastic. His classes are a good mix of lecture of discussion, including some very interesting readings from writers like Emerson and Hemmingway. Certain classes are entirely devoted to improving our skill and I have to say there was a marked improvement in my own writing. Gives great feedback and interesting essays.

Overall, good professor. He knows what he's talking about, but is boring at times, and randomly picks on kids to talk. Four papers, no final and he allows re-writes. He is very fair grader, and I would definitely take is class again!

Really great guy and fairly easy as well. I wouldn't necessarily say that he isn't clear, but he asks pretty bizarre questions sometimes and really tries to challenge you in class. He'd definitely pretty passionate about what he does too. Awesome professor.
Sometimes hard to follow what we have to do and classes usually run long and get really boring with a lot of people zoning out. At the same time, pretty easy and nice guy.

We read Obama's Dreams of my Father the entire semester. He teaches you writing style very well.  The class is fairly easy, he assigns 4 or 5 papers, no final, and allows you to revise all your papers.   Somtimes he goes on and on, but overall he is a very smart man.

There aren't enough good things I can say about Prof. Schrier. I'm now taking her again for French2600. Her classes focus on the current day issues I wanted to talk about in French for as long as I've taken French. Her curriculum is engaging, thought-provoking, and oftentimes moving. I would recommend her to anyone truly passionate about French.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: I can't speak highly enough of Prof Schreier - her classes are consistently impactful, she cares about her students (will actually listen if enough people need extensions/less work), and she's super clear about her grading criteria & expectations. Definitely need to read and participate (!!) but very worth it.

The most caring prof I have ever had. She genuinely cares about her students so much and wants you to succeed. Kind of a lot of reading but you can skim it and still pay attention. She is so clear about her expectations and just wants everyone to do well. If you have the chance take her I can't recommend enough

Professor Schreier is one of the best professors I've had in the French department so far. She is super accessible, organized, and she really cares about her students. Her classes are not an easy A, she assigns (lots of reading and you should be ready to participate in class), but if you put in the work it will be very rewarding! 10/10 recommend!!

She is truly amazing and made me want to major in French. She cares about each student and is very accessible outside of class. There is a lot of homework and she expects you to be well prepared but she picks interesting readings and some are in english. The class is 100% in French, she almost never speaks English. Definitely take her class.

Dr. Schreier is truly a gem. It's clear she knows what she's talking about and is super passionate about not only her work, but teaching too. She works with you to bring out your confidence and make you feel valued. She's a figure that commands respect, but doesn't forget about the human side of college. She's extraordinary - take her!

Professor Schreier is one of the most incredible professors I've had at Fordham. She gives a syllabus which is very clear & easy to follow. No textbook, but you do *need* to print the readings for each class. Moderately difficult Midterm and final, and 6, 300 word essays. She is very accessible in office hours and I would take anything she taught.

Prof. Schreier is a phenomenal French professor. She is a genuinely kind person and is always happy to help you succeed in her class. In terms of grades, do the readings and you'll do well. Would definitely recommend taking her.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Schreier is the best French professor I've had. She is helpful, clear, and encourages her students to do well. I felt more comfortable speaking in her class than in any course before. She is serious about her expectations from the class but her course is manageable if you put the effort in.

As a french student, I thought that class would be something that I would take in France.  The level was below my expectation but was still interesting.  She refused to review my final paper and later failed me for it.  Accused of plagiarism, I asked to edit the paper in the next hour and she refused as well. Disappointed and a bad experience.
exceptionnelle

I really enjoyed  North African France, but get ready to read a lot and write a weekly paper. She is clear on what she expects, and is very french bc she does NOT like absences, tardiness, cell phones, etc. She is good at helping youanswering emails and really cares about students. Class material is super interesting but lots of work & readings.

I worship the ground this woman walks on. She's incredibly smart and talented, and a  great professor. She's very clear and her lectures are SO interesting. Though this class isn't a cake-walk, make sure to do the readings and participate actively and you will probably get a good grade.

There's not much to say about Schreier except that she is simply one of the best professors I have known. She is extremely kind, helpful, and takes genuine interest in her students. It's a ton of work, but it's all significant and relates to real-world issues. If you're in it for the grade, I would recommend another professor.

Schrier is very helpful, kind and crystal clear in her teaching.  You will stress out over her papers, but there are only two of them.  She is very explicit on the final and midterm exams.  Other than that you will do a some reading, but my understanding of French has improved greatly!

probably learned the most about french in one semester with her than the previous 6 years. VERY difficult grader on grammar so use the tutors. Giant essay at the end but she really cares about her students and if you talk to her she'll do whatever she can to get you the grade you want. participation counts for a TON

Prof. Schreier is my favorite french professor ever--she is extremely helpful, and even though she runs a very tight ship (no late work accepted, no english in class, etc), she is very kind. Her class discussions are always wonderful, and her explanations of the readings are always enlightening. Take her!!!!

The class is tough, but Prof. Schreier is more than willing to help if you ask. The workload is pretty heavy, there are a lot of readings on blackboard. If you're passionate about French you'll do very well - if you're not, like I was, then just go to her office hours frequently and it'll help.

A lot of readings on Blackboard and handed out in class.  Two major essays, one presentation, midterm, and final.  Not bad for a required course and she'll help you if you ask for it.  No English speaking allowed in class ever.  Not my favorite professor, but if you put in the work and time you'll do fine.
Professor Shreier is the best French professor I've ever had. The woman loves the French language in the same way that an English professor loves the English language. TAKE HER!

Schreier is by far the most amazing professor I've had over the course of my education ANYWHERE. She is inspiring, helpful, funny, understanding, and most of all truly wants you to take something away from her class. I will take her again just for fun, even though I no longer need to take French classes. She's incredible.

Lise is kind, caring, and understanding. She's beautiful. Her curriculum is incredibly engaging. The texts are diverse, enjoyable, and enlightening, and she provides a translation. One must read every night and write often, but the workload is not overwhelming. Lise is an AWESOME professor.
Dr. Schreier is the best foreign language teacher that I've had at Fordham.  She is so friendly and knowledgable.  If you take notes in her class, you'll be totally fine.  Take her!

dr. schreier is one of the most challenging profs you will encounter at fordham. but i'm grateful to her for making mea much better student. you're an idiot if you don't take her. she teaches a REAL college class.

Very understanding, very kind. Excellent teacher. The class is much more interesting than my past french classes--she really likes group activities. Her grading isn't particularly easy but that's how college should be. If you work hard, you'll get what you deserve.
lise is great. she gives you english translations of everything! it's amazing if ou don't have time to read the french. highly recommended.
THE ABSOLUTE WORST PROFESSOR IVE EVER HAD. He's rude and doesn't teach. Much anxiety over this class. SOOOOO lazy.

Dr. Beer knows Chemistry, but has no clue how to actually teach. Perhaps he should stick to Administrative dean work as he didnt teach or review topics core class (with many non science majors). Most assignments were graded based on completion but exams were super difficult with no direction. When you speak to him, he barely cares. Not worth it

Despite this being an honors class, Prof. Beer is very laid-back.  Homework and labs are all graded on completion, but weekly quizzes are tough if you don't take homework/labs seriously.  He's very open to student suggestions, including moving exam dates.  Midterm and final exams based on the quizzes.  Class is curved, though the amount varies.

I hate to give him a bad review based upon numbers but unfortunately the class isn't easy, he's also the dean of science so he's busy as hell. This class is probably hardest course in the chem sequence. (in terms of grade and material difficulty) Yes, worse than quant. I did learn if you smoke pot and don't care about grades, you can go to MIT.

The class material was interesting, but unfortunately presented in a boring way. Straight lectures, mini quizzes were helpful grade boosters. Has a good sense of humor, just get the feeling he doesn't like teaching forensic science.

i cant believe i waited so long to take this awful class. 2 exams, 8 or so quizzes, cumulative final. lecture was often disorganized, unclear, and boring. typically doesnt send study guides for quizzes/tests till the night before. impersonal. hes pretty chill and can be funny, but the negatives outweigh the positives. the curve saved me.
worst teacher I've ever had, if you aren't pre-med you will not pass this course. avoid at all costs if you don't want an F ruining your GPA
Took him for a few classes before dropping him.  Moves too fast and was kinda of rude to me when i talked to him one on one.

A very nice man. Multiple Choice on tests is a bit tough. Essay Sections not so much. It's not CSI, but then again, it's the real world; The Who isn't gonna come out and sing a song before every class and you're not gonna use lasers to plot ballistic trajectories. Sorry!
No Comments

I loved forensics before i took this class, please do ureself the favor and look for easier professors dont listen to everyone else, remeber they are pre-med studnets they think organic chem is easy..DROP IT IMMEDIATELY!

Helpful and nice. Its a lab, so there isn't much interaction between teacher and students, but when we do he's really good. The prelab lecture is really boring, but everything is covered well. I would suggest him and Dr. Shoja.
Cool guy
confusing, dont even bother remembering. just listen to bray in lecture.  heard he was good in lab tho. cool name, funny guy. nice down to earth man
Sometimes disorginized, but MASSIVE FORKING CURVE!  GO CURVE!
Hard class but nice curve
No Comments
SMART and EASY TO UNDERSTAND.  He makes chemistry interesting.

Beer is a nice guy.  But I think his teaching is disorganized - some of the things he explains half-way.  Very nice though.  Tests are kind of difficult especially since most in the class are science haters.

Beer is pretty cool. He makes a chem lecture about as interesting as it can be. Some time you just want to say shut up beer because you just dont want to deal with chem, but its not a bad class. He gets kinda lazy and will change things if you complain.

i had him for both chem lab and recitation... so helpful in lab.. clear and helpful.. also he said he would forget ab an inconsistent grade or two OR if i did well on the final, hed take that grade instead... BLOWS in recitation though.. not helpful @ all
Really helpful in chem lab, tells jokes and makes you feel at ease...helps with review questions and post-lab questions. Really great guy.

Professor Montes is one of my favorite professors I have ever had at Fordham. If you come to class and really try, he will love you and be happy to help you understand the material and succeed. I missed a class once and he reached out to me and offered to have a meeting so I could get caught up. Really interesting material and he has great stories.

Professor Montes is wonderful. He is an effective lecturer with a background as a lawyer and in the NYPD, so you always get interesting and varied perspectives. He is very clear and uses real-life examples in lectures. He has very high expectations for his students, but that pushed me to work harder to understand the content. Highly recommend!

Professor Montes is a great professor of sociology, especially of Criminal Justice, which I took. He is an ex-cop and detective, and has great personal experience stories that actually enhance the class. He is a great professor and in general we know what we're graded on.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! He has 300+ slides and expects you to be able to memorize all of them because the tests can be on any thing. He also does not supply a study guide or sheet so it makes it even harder to be prepared for his tests. He never gives back graded work to see where you can improve and his nice guy persona is a facade. Dont get fooled

This class is the most unorganized class I have taken in my life. He gives you all the materials to study 2 days before the final, not to mention the material is about 500 powerpoint slides. No clarification at all on papers, tests, etc. Doesn't hand back tests or papers either. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.. Worst professor I've ever had.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good professor with real experience in the field. midterm final and 2 essays the essays are easy and can hep boost grade. He can be a little vague on the midterm and final material but if you study the slides you should be alright. Definitely not too hard to get an A/A- if you study the right material

3 tests & 2 papers Sometimes a little unclear but if you ask him questions he is willing to help Study the powerpoints &think through the questions It's not an impossible class but you need to really understand the material to apply it to the tests and assignments. Great prof overall and a really great guy retired NYPD which is a plus great stories
The class is very lecture heavy and there are a lot of slides. He is a tough grader but he gave the opportunity for people to fix their papers which was helpful. Participation does matter

Bro, he told us hat the final was going to be based on 3 powerpoints. We get to class on test day and find out that it was 4 powerpoints. Mind you, each powerpoint consist of 60-120 slides. . . And he swears that he told us it was 4 powerpoints. His defense was that it was IMPLIED on Blackboard.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: It's not that the content is hard and lectures are difficult to grasp. It's him. He is not clear about his grading and has the audacity to posit himself as a cool professor who "isn't trying to make our lives miserable." He is a PETTY grader and takes off points for everything. You try super hard and still fail.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Horrible professor and highly unclear. Lectures are all extremely heavy, non-specific all the time. PowerPoints are all over the place and never in order. His grading criteria is terrible, do not take if you want to try hard and end up getting a low grade. Only perks is rarely takes attendance.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Montes is great. His classes are lecture heavy but he mixes it up with stories and examples. Took him for intro to criminal justice. Three tests that weren't too bad and two papers that he grades easy. Would definitely recommend. He is very chill with attendance and making up tests and a lot of classes get out early. Retired NYPD detective.
ratingTags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Montes is unclear. He wants to make you think that he's cool and that he doesn't care, but he does. He never says anything about his grading criteria in class, so you really don't know how well you do until you start getting the grades back, which, btw, he takes FOREVER to do. Everyone, stay away from him. Don't take his classes.

He wants to carry a nonchalant attitude and make it seem like hes cool and for the students. He told us that he wasnt trying to make our lives impossible, and yet he did. He takes forever grading things, so midway through the semester, we discovered that we were not doing wellat all. Hes an extremely difficult, arbitrary grader. STAW AWAY!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Make sure you manage your time well as she will pile incredibly long homeworks on top of each other due on the same date. Also, her lecture style is unclear and forces you to basically teach yourself. Lastly, is unapproachable and unwilling to help work with students schedule in the face of a pandemic.

Lectures are pretty boring, but Prof. Li is very nice. Attendance is taken and mandatory but most people just mess around on their computers during class. Overall only like five homework assignments, and a final project. You do learn the material and not to hard, just not that interesting.

Dr Li's classes follow a lecture from ppt format, so they aren't the most interesting, but she certainly provides all the info you need to succeed on her website. 2 tests, 4 HW assignments, final project. Don't underestimate HW - it makes up your grade! It is very straightforward, and ultimately, if you attend class and do well on HW, you're set.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Can be a tough grader at times. The homework is critical, counts for 65% of course, and the rest goes to the final, which is basically all the homework's combined. Try to stay focused in class as it gets really boring. Working with other classmates can help by a letter grade.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you paid attention to her class, studied her code online and looked over the powerpoint, this class is honestly an easy A. She's pretty nice and she'll respond to your emails within 24 hours. It might not be the most interesting or exciting class since she goes over powerpoint slides, but she drills the concepts in your head pretty well.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Lectures are not code heavy although the bulk of the grade is coding assignments. Two tests, four coding assignments, and a final project. Tests are very hard. Difficult to understand.

Her lecture contained little to no coding insight while all of the assignments were coding only. 4 Labs made up 60% of the grade. No "final" was nice, final grade was made up of 2 subject tests throughout the year. Students were encouraged to build their labs using resources she wrote, which could be confusing come time to add your own code.
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She needs to learn computer science herself.

Took her for Data Mining. Her classes tend to be pretty boring. No midterm or final exams. 7 straight-forward assignments form the bulk of the grade. Final group project is worth 35% but is handed out about a month before the deadline and is pretty engaging and interesting.

Dr. Li is a very smart woman who treats her Intro to CompSci class very simply. The subject matter is not hard and her tests and labs were extremely straightforward. There was always plenty of time to see her if something was confusing. Do not listen to the other posters who are negative. She may have an accent but that in no way made her horrible!
Her voice is very loud in teaching, but you can't understand her.

Professor Li does have an accent, but that in no way hinders her ability to teach. Her lectures are clear and the labs are really easy and quick. She is always open to help you and she grades very fairly on the exams. The TA grades the labs so that is subjective by TA, but the prompts are fairly simple and you build upon them. Would take again.
She is absolutely impossible to understand. I you have trouble understanding accents do not take her because you will not understand one word she says.

Easy teacher as long as you can understand math. If not, just find a math kid who can give you some tips. Her accent can sometimes get in the way of her point, but it's easy to figure out. Her lectures seem rly simple which can make it kinda boring. She gives small little hw assignments that aren't due for a week. 2 midterms and a final.

I took Dr. Li for both CS 1600 and CS 2000.  C++ isn't exactly the easiest subject, especially if you have no interest in learning it.  But if you put forth the effort to do well on all the labs, you shouldn't have a problem getting a good grade.  Overall, she's been a very helpful professor whom I'd recommend if you're required to take a CS class.

Easy teacher and grader, but should be doing Data Mining (her expertise). She gives invalid code and does not know web programming well enough to teach the course. Use w3schools to supplement and use that to one-up her and you will get an A.

Take someone else if you have the option. Professor Micale does not promote healthy learning, is noticeably passive aggressive and condescending, and gives lectures that include lengthy PowerPoints that do not engage the class. While you may leave this class with a better understanding of audit, it will be at the expense of your mental health.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I have to say that theology is the hardest thing that I've ever learned. However, professor Natalie is amazing. She's caring and always wants to make sure that you understand all the materials. You can only understand her lecture when you finish the readings. So read them and take notes carefully. Your notes will be very helpful for the midterm.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Reynoso seems intimidating at first but she is truly a sweetheart and cares for all her students. There is a lot of reading but she does a great job to go over all the material. Office hours are extremely helpful when going over papers so take advantage!! Overall an amazing professor who even gave snacks on test days. Highly recommend!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Reynoso was amazing. She is so understanding and really cares about her students. Class content was very interesting and she was always sure to make sure we were all ok. One of the best professors I have had.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Reynoso is so sweet. She truly cares about her students and tries to make theology as light as possible. There are a lot of readings involved, three writing assignments (two short, one long) plus a midterm. As long as you study from her review sheets , you should be fine. She gives great feedback and buys us munchkins occasionally. Love her!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Prof. Reynoso is very passionate about her class and is very caring. There is a lot of reading and sometimes it gets hard but she always goes over it and loves to hear your opinions. She is always working with her students to make the course fun and light without being too simple. I highly suggest taking her class!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He expects students to write about exactly what he wants to hear but fails to teach the adequate material. Unrealistic expectations for an elective and does not teach any useful finance information . The only topic we talked about all semester was disconnected youth in black communities. DO not take.
This class is so. Much. Work. Especially the lab. She doesnt teach the lab but the instructions for lab could be clearer. A lot of homework but its interesting and pays off.
Dr. Hoyt is very nice and would probably be great if we were in person. However, she assigns an insane amount of async work without teaching much on zoom. Not the education I'm paying $75k for.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She gives extra credit for every exam, so you always have the chance to increase your score by up to 3 points. Her lectures are very clear and posted online afterwards. The quizzes are open note online, and the lowest quiz grade will be dropped at the end of the semester. She is open to giving points back on the test if you argue your answer.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Hoyt is an incredibly knowledgeable and fun professor who genuinely cares about the material and values what her students bring to the table. 10/10, would recommend.
Dr. Hoyt is one of the best professors at Fordham. She is very knowledgeable, kind, funny, and caring. If you have the opportunity to take her Health Psychology course, do it!

Professor Hoyt is amazing. If you are unclear about anything on her exam, ask her; she will point you in the right direction. She's not out to get anyone! Go to her office hour, and ask to see your exam. If you feel as though there could be another correct answer, explain it to her, and if she agrees with you, she'll give you the point. Take her!

Professor Hoyt is a seriously great teacher. Her lectures are engaging and interesting and she really encourages you to share your ideas and participate as much as you want in the class. She has a great attitude, with a very bubbly personality, and is both nice and helpful to talk to outside of class. Definitely recommend taking her again!

Good professor, but would not recommend taking her unless you're serious about psychology. Tests are insane and you won't get higher than a B if you don't study absolutely everything. The TA is also not that great and has a really unclear standard for grading lab reports.

Pretty solid as a new professor at Fordham. Got to appreciate the energy she brings during lecture. Downside is the amount of busy work assigned especially for the lab portion. Be prepared to write 5 ridic papers for lab. Got to go to office hours before exams to see what she might test you on the written part.
Were given 2 free pass absences. Didn't like the lab, but that was because of the TA who taught it

Professor Hoyt is amazing. She is one of my favorite professors at Fordham. She is a fantastic lecturer and she makes the textbook material entertaining, She encourages class discussion, gets to know all her students, and truly cares about the course.  4 noncumulative tests, online quizzes, and lab. Lab sucks but it is taught by a TA not her.

Professor Hoyt is such a chill teacher. She's hilarious during lectures and uses examples that helps you learn the material clearly (one time she used a clip from Friends). Sometimes her tests can be difficult, but I recommend going to office hours beforehand -- she really appreciates that. Lab is not the best, but it is taught by a TA.

The class is really easy, just take a few notes and you'll do fine. However, when Fordham shut down due to the pandemic, Shafer just disappeared and didnt respond to any of our emails. It took the class dean to eventually contact him and see if he was even giving us a final. The whole class seemed out of order, but take him if you want an easy A.

Not accessible outside of class at all. Very hard grader. I have him during quarantine and we are supposed to have our final in 12 hours... havent heard from him in three weeks. Isnt responding to anyones emails.
No one in the class is engaged as his lectures are really, really boring. However, you can go to class, not pay attention, and still get an A.

Andrew Shafer's lectures are very repetitive, and he paces his class way too slow. I feel like half of every lecture is just him reviewing the material from last class, and he never talks about anything beyond the base material. Take this class if you want an easy A, but not if you're trying to have an engaging class.

Shafer was a mediocre at best professor with bizarrely difficult grading criteria. He lectures every single day and each lecture feels like they last forever. His grading is bizarrely critical and there are only a few assignments to try and fix it.

He deserves a a score waYYYY higher than this page dictates. Dude is a serious gem. Class is mad easy. He gives out readings but you don't really have to do them because he goes over everything in the next class. Just pay attention and take notes in class for the journals due every couple of weeks. Midterm was the study guide exactly.

I took Professor Shafer for Phil 1000. As a premed student who isn't really a huge fan of the humanities Shafer made his class easy and accessible. Yes, he has a learning disability and can't spell properly but please don't judge him based on just that. He's truly a genius. His office hours are helpful and he is flexible with testing accommodation.

Shafer is a great guy and prof, very engaging lectures. No hw except readings (which he fully explains in class), barely any participation required but does appreciate/recognize if you try. Answers any question until you get it, avail outside class and just wants you to engage with the material. 2 papers, midterm, final, weekly journal. super easy
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Shafer is a nice guy, but I felt that there was no structure at all to his class. It was almost like he didn't know what his next move was. Sitting in his class got awkward because he wasn't engaging, and no one really answered his questions. He is also really dyslexic, not that this was the problem, but he can be very confusing at times.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is probably a nice guy. But he shouldn't be teaching. Can't spell for his life, can't even spell "chair" correctly. All over the place. No idea what he's doing at all.

He is a terrible teacher, but also a hard grader. This is the worst combination you can have. He never really knows how to explain things. He is very smart, but just can't teach and is not engaging at all.

His lectures are kind of disorganized; you have to work to make sense of them. Since he posted lecture recordings this semester it's not too hard to try to understand it. The midterm was exactly like what he discussed in class; so if you study his lectures and homework, you'll be fine. I suggest watching YouTube videos to pass.

I'm not 100% sure, but it really seems like this dude has left reviews on his own page a couple times. He's very difficult to understand through his accent, doesn't take enough time on each topic, and makes his exams unnecessarily difficult. Said that the exam would be similar to hw, proceeded to make it completely different. Don't take.
I like Professor. Wei, during his lecture, he always asked if you have any questions. Also, I can understand his accent. If you do the homework by yourself, you will be fine.

If you care at all about your education and you have another option, avoid this guy at all costs. However, if youre looking for someone who you can barely understand at all and who flies through topics regardless of whether or not anyone knows whats going on, hes the one for you. Worst prof at Fordham, no contest.

You cannot understand anything he says. His lectures as a whole are grossly disorganized, not to mention the class was four hours long and he did not give us breaks. He also refused to answer student questions, always directing us to the three TAs, who were largely unresponsive. With no help, our class was forced to teach the material to ourselves.

DO. NOT. TAKE. He can barely speak English, all of the learning was basically self-taught, and he is SUPREMELY uncooperative when you're trying to communicate with him. Quite possibly one of the worst CS professors at Fordham, and that's saying something.

Look at those comments who 'attack' his accent, that's really funny and rude. His lecture is clear, and if you think he never response have you ever asked help from TA? You need to put effort to pass every class.

I am not discriminating in any way regarding his Chinese accent, but it is clearly a problem in a classroom lecture setting. To be honest, you cannot understand him half the time. Students in his class have to learn the material by themselves as prof. Wei is so hard to understand. Class itself is not bad, but do not recommend this specific prof.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Wei is clear and explains well when needed. His test are based on homework type questions. The students below mention accent, and Chinese. One even mentions that the test are based on homework, yet doesn't do well on exams. Clearly these comments are left by ignorant and not very bright individuals.
A nice man but I couldn't understand a word he said. The class itself isn't impossible if you're decent at math but I wouldn't recommend if you're able to get a better professor.

If you decide to take this class, you will have to do a lot of self-studying (youtube videos, textbook practice, etc). His lectures are useless and unorganized. He doesn't fully explain why or how you're doing a problem, it's like he expects you to already know how to do the basics when most of us haven't taken CompSci before.

Networks: Wei's accent makes him hard to understand. You can't use the book completely because he teaches things differently than the book does. HW is due once in a while. Midterm & Final. Make sure you do the hw because those are the questions on the exams. It takes a long time to give back graded assignments so don't wait for them.

This class was a real joke. Do not take his class unless your major is in Chinese. I did not understand anything he said. He never answered any of my e-mails for help. He would speed through classes without clear explanations of the problems. I actually tried to learn the material by studing the text book, but still got a poor grade. BE CAREFUL!

someone deleted my comment.  This professor is the worst professor I have had yet at fordham.  I did well in his class, simply because it was easy IF you went to the help center (he taught nothing).  He cancelled 6 or 7 classes, never answered emails.  No one understands the material. Class was a complete joke, doesn't know how to answer questions.
Very helpful although the accent is hard to comprehend sometime. The tests are Very fair. The people who complain are just dumb or lazy.
Very interesting class. Just do the work and he is reasonable.

Wei is a great teacher. He knows how to teach and knows his material well. Some people think he doens't know what hes talking about simply because he has an accent. If u just ask him for help, he'll really take the time with you.  Then u realize damn, this guy really is making sense. Just see him after class. He'll surprise u.
great teacher
Very fair teacher. sparks interest in the subject
extremely hard to understand with his accent.  jumps around alot when teaching.  he assumes you know alot about computers.  doesnt take attendance and exams are open book, but not easy.

Aside from his accent which may be tough to understand (but by no means a deterrant), he does not grade homework he assigns, and does not grade tests he gives. He relied too much on grad students throughout the course. He maintained no flow.
I had him for 2 classes.  You can't understand him.  He doesn't teach what was in the book.  He does not explain himself well, and he guess relative easy tests.  You won't learn anything with him

Doesn't speak english well, hard to understand.  Does not explain himself well or answer specific questions asked of him.  Assigns homework that he has neither taught nor is in the book.  Wanders off on tangent frequently.  Tests are relatively easy.

He's a super nice guy but his class is incredibly boring and his exams are near impossible. They're all multiple choice but even when you search for the answers online and find them, he says they're incorrect. He's like in his own world with philosophy, don't take this class unless you really understand philosophy

Really easy class if you take good notes and understand the basic concepts (his tests are all open book/ open laptop). But overall just a pretty boring class. He tells you to buy a textbook that he wrote but we were only assigned like 30 pages of the book- so you don't really need it. Get it from the library to save yourself the $50
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Klima is the absolute worst. His lectures are incredibly boring and super unclear so it's difficult to take notes. The only assignments are three exams which are 10 multiple choice questions and it's open notes so it sounds like a dream but in reality the tests are still incredibly difficult and everyone averaged around a C- on each exam.
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took him for logic and absolutely hated the class for all the reasons mentioned. But i took his class on medieval philosophy and i loved it. Medieval philosophy is his specialty so take him for this class. As long as you take good notes and read, you'll be fine. Also helps to have a friend in class to help you on tests since its open anything
ratingTags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Klima is a very difficult teacher. He seems like a very intelligent and kind man but his tests are some of the most difficult I've had to take in college. They are open internet and open note but the questions are so cryptic and specific that the internet helps you on maybe only a few. I would not recommend his class or retake it.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Not great, but not totally awful. His tests are all open-book so listen in class, do the readings, and make sure you have good notes and you'll do well. He does ramble and go off on tangents a lot. A pretty mediocre class.

Prof. Klima is an expert in his field & really cares about the subject matter he teaches. He can be a little awkward, but he's kind & presents material in a way that is conducive to taking notes. Tests are MC only & open internet/open note & he provides summaries of the readings on his website. However, test q's are cryptic & the final50% of grade

Your grades in this class are mainly dependent on the tests he gives.  You will have to read the books if you want to participate in class and better understand the class that follows the reading. However, you will not be completely lost on the exams if you don't read. He explains everything and even sends you links. Everything is open book!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's kind of hard to understand and rambles a lot. I usually just skim through the readings he assigns, read a summary, and answer the questions that he asks (and wait for next class where he tries to explain the answers as well). His test are open-everything and you'll be fine as long as you pay attention and write down stuff he says in class.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Klima is intimidating at first, but is an incredible professor. If you do the readings and can participate in class, he will love you and be very helpful. Hardest multiple choice tests ever, even though they are open note/internet but you can retake them and get 100% easily. Don't skip because his tests cover exactly what he says in class.

He provides summaries of all the readings on his website. You can use the internet during tests. The questions are directly answered in the summaries. Ten mult. choice Qs per test. He has a hungarian accent, but you'll understand if you have ears. Attend class for good grade. Lectures are enlightening if you enjoy philosophy. Google him for pics.

Klima is a boss. The man knows his philosophy and his tests are open-internet. If you show up, pay attention, and do the readings , you're going to get an A. Very straightforward, always helpful, and humorous.

He speaks with a thick accent, so he's difficult to understand. Laptops are allowed in class and all tests are open note and open laptop, so they're easy. He'll appreciate class participation, but it's not a must. You do have to show up for class though, because he'll call you out if you skip.
Rude and unclear.  His tests are impossible even if you study, completely based on his opinion

Hard to understand and approach.  This is the only teacher that I recommend you drop without trying.  It is not worth it.  His tests are based on his interpretation of the material instead of what we read, so even if you are prepared it is hard to do well.

Even if you understand the material, his tests are impossible. Philosophy simply isn't the type of subject in which multiple choice/true false tests work. Whenever he allowed a test retake with short answers or an extra credit paper, it became much easier. Until he changes his testing style, avoid.

Prof. Klima is great! I found the subject to be somewhat difficult but he answered my questions clearly in class and even in more depth over email. Participate in class, even if you are unsure of the answer--he will guide you in the right direction and will appreciate your participation in the long run!

Has an accent as well as being soft-spoken, so he's very difficult to understand. I wouldn't recommend him if you're just trying to fill a requirement. He expects a lot of students and tends to get angry or even mocking when these expectations aren't met.

open notebook/smart phone tests. all lecture, mostly ranting. little discussion. DO NOT BUY HIS BOOK. you read 30 pages of it and it is not even on the test. He's an alright guy and wants you to do well.

Very passionate about philosophy but very boring to most of us who are just fulfilling a requirement. Tests can be difficult, so you should do the reading. He appreciates kids who speak up in class. Attendance is mandatory--he'll call you out if you don't show up without emailing him why. No papers though, just multiple choice so that's a plus.

Honestly, I don't understand how this guy has so many good comments. You have no clue what he is saying, it's painfully boring to sit in class, and his tests are impossible. My entire class was frustrated with the guy about half way through the semester. He is smart and knows what he is talking about but he just does not know how to teach it.

Klima is the personification of brillance! He writes beautifully, he's crazy-smart, and he randomly says the funniest things. I'll stop before I start sounding like a groupie but it would be well-worth your time to take a class with this man. It won't be easy but it'll def be interesting!
Wonderful guy! He is very helpful both in his office hours and emails. His class is open book, and if you take good notes and listen to him the quizzes are easy. Look forward to taking him again

Klima is the man when it comes to philosophy, he really knows his stuff. there are 4 quizzes (multiple choice) and no essays. He introduces himself by saying "google my name" which comesup with a million results for all of his accomplishments. just read the e-mails, print them, and take good notes. everything is open book and notes which makes thin

Professor Klima is great. He's a really nice guy, very helpful. You don't need to buy any books even because he explains philosophy really well. Good notes are crucial. His tests are kind of tricky--make sure you know your stuff beforehand. Not an easy class, but if you work, you'll be fine. He loves philosophy and he helped me like it too!

I had no interest in Philosophy going in, and I still don't plan to pursue the subject beyond the core. That said, it was fairly interesting. GK clearly knows his stuff and is used to teaching this class. However, it's very boring. You don't need to read, just take notes and look at all of his emails. He sends like three a day, all with good notes.

Extremely hard class for those not interested in philosophy.  He likes it when you participate, but the content and tests are super confusing.  The final was about 20 multiple choice questions and it was 50% of our grade.  Wonderful and nice man, but really hard class.

He's really confusing. The only people who seem to do well are the ones who already know it. His tests are multiple choice and they are confusing. He sometimes allows re-takes which are short answer questions, in my opinion they are easier than the multiple choice.

Klima is absolutely amaaazzing. i took his class in the summer and the more your participate the better you do in his class.. class is entertaining only if students raise discussions- if you're not the type to participate. dont bother
Ok...Gyula is my hero...he is crazy...but hes a reallly nice guy. He wants you to do good. He will do anything for you to raise your grade. He wants you to understand it.

ok, im going to set the record straight. klima is a nice guy, but his lectures are extremely unclear. taking notes wont work because he barely writes on the board, and his handwriting is horrible. If you go to his office hours, he does his best to help you. However, if you're not good with philosophy, this class will not be easy
No Comments
Unclear, confusing, unhelpful.  He does not know how to teach.
A great professor, the best I've had at Fordham.  Very exciting lectures, very helpful and very kind.  Also, extremely good looking (a bonus!!!!)
THE SEXIEST MAN ALIVE!!! THE HOTTEST MOST BRILLIANT MAN IVE EVER MET OR EVER SEEN!!!!!!!!  RICH STUFF HERE!!!!!!!!

To quote a grad student, "He's brilliant and extremely personable...but sometimes you have no idea what the hell he's saying." Klima is MAD smart, but sometimes he's unclear. However, he always gives opportunities to improve your grade, and is a genuinely nice guy.

A useless class, go to him for extra help, youll need it. I've heard students complain about him alot to the head of the dept, but some do well. His tests are way more difficult than his handouts so you have to really study. Take him if you are willing to put in effort, but its a pointless class

I want to start off saying that I get at least 8 hours of sleep a day, yet I consistently fell asleep in this class. If you think this class will improve your chances on the LSAT I would suggest another route. However, if you do take this class be prepared to work your tail off.
cant understand a word he says. unclear, not helpful, unfriendly. going to his office doesnt help. dont take him. waste of time.
He means well, and is a nice guy... but cannot teach and when he does - he is so boring you fall asleep.  Plus... the guy spends 30 minutes on ONE problem!  How can one learn that way?!
I really enjoy the class, but it seems that the majority of the other students don't. It's final next week and I'm getting a solid A.
Aweful, everyone in his class is going to fail
Very confusing. Very scatterbrained. Never seems to know where he's trying to go when he starts talking about things.  Not too harsh of a grader but boring as all hell.

Brilliant. Participate in class. Do not take if you are unwilling to question God. Quizzes are easy as hell. I tutored students in the class because they couldn't understand him. Look at his website first before taking him.  Google him.
AWFUL...this guy was the biggest waste of time.  He gave 10 questions for the final review and then threw a few things we didn't discuss on the final.  Avoid this guy!!
HE IS BEING CLOSE MINDED WITH HIS OPENMINDEDNESS!  JUST AGREE WITH HIM -  HE SPEAKS AS IF HE IS SHAKESPEARE ---  HE SPEAKS OLD ENGLISH AND HIS HANDOUTS ARE HARD TO UNDERSTAND!

Very smart man. One of the smartest and fordham. It is REALLY REALLY EaSY TO GET A B, but hard to get an A, even though he helps you alot. The papers are easy, the exams tough and the final was not to bad. If you work hard you can get in the A range

HORRIBLE... everything everyone else said is true, long boring lectures, really smart guy, hard as hell to follow, except now he doesn't give open note exams, they are multiple choice and IMPOSSIBLE.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Bad teacher. Didn't understand one word he said. I got a like b because I ****ed the final. He gave out all the questions before hand and used only a few on the open notebook final. Take him. It'll suck, but you'll get a decent grade.
Very easy class. Even if you dont understand whats going on you can still get a good grade.

I HATED this class. He's a nice man but he lets his the student/teacher grade your stuff and this guy sucks! gyula has a BAD hungarian accent which makes him hard to understand. open book tests++ summaries, questions to the tests b4 hand.
The course is a piece of cake.  One brief paper, open-book tests with the questions provided before.  I didn't understand anything he was talking about

Give questions to tests in review. All tests open book and notes. Very nice. Sometimes hard to understand but gives summaries of text on his website so its not so confusing. One 5-7 page paper. I would recommend him.

Excellent teacher. Extremely easy. GIves the questions to every test and grades easy also everything is open notebook. This class can't be any easier Plus he is a great person and is very nice! Highly Recommended teacher.
Class isn't hard. Open note tests. He is very difficult to understand and I'm never sure what he's talking about.

DIFFICULT CLASS.  THE SUBJECT OF PHILOSOPHY IS HORRIBLE TO BEGIN WITH.  HE IS A BRILLIANT MAN, BUT THAT IS NOT NECESSARILY A GOOD THING.  HE KNOWS WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT, BUT HAS A TENDENCY TO LOSE YOU.  ALSO HAS AN ACCENT, MAKING THINGS TOUGH.
its easy. open notebook exams and he gave us the questions on the midterm.  he's great. the tests are writing short essays but he grades good. just take notes and u'll be ok
Very good teacher.
Tough class...Prof. Klima is very smart, which might make the class more difficult for anyone taking it.  Take notes for the open note tests and quizzes.
he is a very bright professor, and he knows what he is talking about, it is just that YOU might not...besides that, open note tests, open note MIDTERMS, and 5-8 page papers once in a while
hard to understand sometimes, but philosphy is boring to begin with.
Absolutely terrible.  His tests are impossible.  I didn't understand a thing he said all semester, and he doesn't lend any help.  I'm sure he's brilliant, but he's an awful teacher.

Very confusing. It may make sense to him as he is teaching, but it will not to you. He is a nice guy, and he means very well. Some people are well qualified, and very bright, but just do not make good teachers. (The theme of Fordham adademics?)
Superbright and enthused but what is he talking about?  Perpetual fog.
No Comments
No Comments
open book and open note exams.  hard to understand at times due to accent.
Not good, have fun if you take her!
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I'm sorry to say, but the fact Fordhmam has this professor enrolled in the math department is sooo bad. I had struggled with another professor in statistics last semester. I thought she was bad, BUT NO, THIS PROFESSOR ...... ZOINKS, Pray to god or whoever and enjoy the ride. Don't get me wrong, she's such a sweet professor, but teaching... -_-
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Shes giving us wrong answers, doesnt know how to do a problem step by step if we ask her. Yikes

The first week she asked the class for feedback but ended up starting arguments. She cannot teach on an online platform, the tests are extremely difficult, and the homework is excessive. Her lectures are unproductive, and when you ask for help she refers you to the textbook. I was better off not attending the lectures and teaching myself instead.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: WORST TEACHER EVER!! I wouldn't recommend her to my worst enemy. She changes her syllabus almost on the daily and contradicts herself. She's always unprepared and does not know how to teach whatsoever. She continuously fights with her students. She does not take advice from other people and gets mad when you correct her. Would NOT recommend!!!!!!!!

She will make you depressed! She does not even know stats. She is learning the concepts with us and she is not prepared for her lectures. She is so contradicting and constantly changes the syllabus. She is not open to feedback on the student's preference. She teaches by talking without any clear visuals placed in her online classes. Good luck!
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Sinem Sonmez is the worst professor I have ever experienced at Fordham University. I hesitate to even refer to her as a professor because of her lack of preparation for class and her terrible lectures. She picks fights with students and you will have to teach yourself everything to do well in her class which comprises of 2 tests and a final.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Gives off wholesome vibes. Took the time to teach us how to use excel. His slides arent that helpful so you 100% have to read the textbook chapters. Homework is hard if you dont pay attention in class.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Good teacher, gotta pay attention to the lectures and do the homework, but he makes the lectures interesting. Class is graded on a scale that makes it really hard to do bad or fail.

WORST CLASS EVER. The class average for the midterm was a 61. The entire class really struggled and he doesn't do much to help. The only reason I managed to get a B- was because he grades: 40% , 30%, 20% and 10% for best score combos for homework, midterm, final, and participation/quizzes
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hardest class I've ever taken. He takes attendance every class and makes powerpoints that are no help at all. His lectures confused me even more and his grading scale is so strange I never knew how I was doing until midterms and final grades came out. Avoid at all costs.

I barely understood anything in Batemarco's class. He prepares powerpoints for every class but does not do a good job in explaining. Instead of getting to the simplest explanation of the topic, he makes it more complicated. The homework he gives is difficult but manageable. However, tiny mistakes can affect your grade a lot. Avoid taking him!!
Hardest class I have ever taken. Nearly half the class had dropped the course by the end of semester. Avoid him at all costs.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Hardest class I've ever taken, grades super hard and has confusing lectures where he goes off on random math tangents no one can follow. Voice is also super monotone, never had difficulty paying attention when I really wanted too until this class.

He is a nice dude but a poor professor. He has a very monotone voice which makes you want to fall asleep and he goes off on nerd tangents unrelated to the material. He grades homework very tough. The major issue is that his homework is done on excel but tests are on paper. Also one of the hardest final exams I have taken
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He cannot teach clearly. He goes off on random tangents. We learn extra unnecessary stuff other econ classes are not learning. Oh, and he docked 13 points off my homework b/c I accidentally switched an answer and a question.  Although the answers were in front of his face, I got an 87 because I got the wrong thing wrong. STAY AWAY. HE'S HORRIBLE

He sure can ramble during his lectures about nothing for a while, and class can be boring at times, but you learn a lot. He is tough in his grading, but also very fair. He does his best to make sure the work you put into the class is accurately reflected in your grade.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE. She is the worst professor I have ever had. She is rude, mean, and down right nasty to all of her students. Avoid this professor at all costs. If you disagree with her, your going to fail.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Professor Bibaway was a great professor! Regular blackboard discussion submissions, but he doesn't grade them he just checks if you did it. Readings are lengthy, but he's super nice and grades easy. This is not an overwhelming class. Two papers and one presentation. I'm not religious or a theology major, but I enjoyed this class a lot!

If you're not super Christian, you won't like him. Everything learned was Christian based, even though it was a faith and critical reasoning class. Takes attendance every day and assigns lots of readings. Exams were based off everything we discussed in class and the readings, but the questions asked could be confusing or worded weirdly

Seems like a nice guy, but he is one of the worst profs I've ever had in my life. Routinely demeans students if they volunteer the wrong information when asked but laments that no one participates. Shouts a lot during his lecture and is almost impossible to follow. Class is unorganized and he more or less abuses his TAs, labor-wise.

The professor himself was kind and caring. This does not mean he can teach. His lectures are so heavy and he goes so fast when it's all new material. I was extremely frustrated in this class. I had to study and put in a lot of work to teach myself to pass his tests and lab homework!

Such a sweet man and really cares about his students, the most passionate person about math Ive ever met lol. It's easier to get to him by asking questions during class rather than after, so don't be shy. He will also remember your face, and lets you have a cheat sheet for every test. Content is confusing but not his fault, he is engaging
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: He is an amazing professor who cares a lot about his students. I thought I almost failed the class, but he bumped up my grade because of participation so be sure to always raise your hand and participate! Go to him during office hours! There are three tests, and he allows for one cheat sheet. He's also very animated and funny in class.
Dr. Kim cares a lot about his students. He wants you to attend lecture. If you put in the effort, he will do his best to help you succeed. However, he does have high expectations.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: The class could have been better. Luckily, this class was the only requirement and I won't need it in the future.

His lectures aren't the easiest to follow, but he's hilarious, and he posts all the slides online anyways, so you can essentially teach yourself.  Tests are multiple choice and he allows cheat sheets occasionally.  He really wants his students to succeed and he's a caring and relatively laid-back professor.

Dr. Kim is adorable and tries to make stats interesting with his jokes. I had him for the summer session, two tests, midterm and final. If you take good notes you will do well, his tests are based on his lectures. He tries to be fair and help students do well. I would take him again!

Im warning you now, DO NOT TAKE HIM. His lecture are super boring and super hard to keep up with. He gives quizzes before every class , expect when we have an exam. Then every exam covers 4 chapters (sometimes 5), now this really wouldnt be a problem if each powerpoint didn't have about 80-90 slides lol. I have no idea why he thinks this is doable.

Worst professor I have ever had at this school. I went to ask questions outside of class and he did not help at all, gave basic answers and showed very little interest. Exams are from a test bank that have little to do with what was presented in lecture. Made me hate biology. Please do not take this professor.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Really good professor, actually cares about how students are doing and is able to meet whenever he can. This class was really tough but he's willing to work with students if you make the effort. Class is very Lecture heavy but in my experience all bio classes are. Tests are pretty hard.
Prof Cheng is an awesome guy I've had the pleasure of having him for 2 classes and hopefully another. Very nice and understanding, will always help if you have a question. Highly recommend!
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is literally the GOAT! So understanding, assignments won't be graded till end of the semester but he is an easy grader. What you take out of the class is up to you but if you have a choice pick him

Professor Chiang is literally the homie. He makes class as interesting as possible and he knows because Systems Analysis is a pretty dry class. He is fair on exams and assignments and cares about his students (and wants them to succeed). Not going to lie, things might be graded late but he always tries to help his students out.
This class was a horrible waste of time. Learned absolutely nothing and he didn't even grade most of the assignments
The final is so hard I read the book and fail the final. Don't take this class with him take with other prof Other prof give easy a  His exam hard  Class average very low

you should study for the tests by reading his powerpoints. he wants you to succeed and will break things down. he gave us extensions and helped us take the exam early. study guide was helpful. pay attention to him. he is really a nice man who is brilliant. take esp in you are in info systems.

I had Chiang for his graduate level course at Fordham GBA. He was a great professor. Information systems is not a subject that I thought I would enjoy, but he made it interesting and did his best to eliminate the dry subject matter. Subject matter is NOT easy, but its a required course. He made it interesting. On a grad or undergrad level, take him
Chiang is awesome. He is a great professor and has a sense of humor. Take him if you have the opportunity.

CHIANG IS THE MAN. take this class. He gives a lot of quizzes but the material is so simple to learn. Midterm and Final are an easy A if you go through his notes and powerpoints on blackboard and read the opening chapter stories in the textbook.

He is generally a good guy. Trys to make the class interesting but info systems is just plain boring. Doesn't take attendence. Teaches with use of PowerPoints which you can find thru Blackboard. The group project is easy once you get it flowing.
