honeslty, don't take chiang. very disorganized, very unapproachable. the class is very easy, just know that for the midterm and final the questinos come straight out of the book, don't even bother looking at the powerpoints. they rest of the class is a joke but going to him twice a week was really awful, unlike any class i've ever taken.

This prof is a good teacher. His whole class is pp point slides.At first u think its an easy A but u have to read the book for his test or follow his class lessons which are kinda boring. He is great when it comes to hw. And extra credit! not bad. Just read and do the hw and u will get that A. Totally take him for info systems.!!!

I'm in his class typing this right now! ANYWAYS, i LOVE chiang. He is SUCH an understanding professor! He is funny and just a really cool guy. We have this assignment due but he just said "let's not do it and i'll give you guys the full credit.. it's because i know you guys have other classes and i dont wanna overload you guys" DEF take CHIANG!
Best professor. Easy A. Just do the assignments that he posts on blackboard. Gives many extensions on assignments if you need them. Take him if you get the chance! You will not regret it!

Professor Chiang is by far the most reasonable teacher I've had. He is very reasonable and understanding when it comes to assignments. As long as you do the very few homeworks you'll be fine. He gives plenty of extra points for just submitting work on time or early!
He is very helpful.  Grades lightly,just do the homework and you'll do fine.  REASONABLE!!! SUper cool .  Definately pick him.  GPA booster !!Luv him

I had Chiang for system analysis. He is an awesome professor and extremely helpful. He really gets to know his students. However, this is because the class was centered around a semester long group project that required lots of time out of class. It was a big commitment but it is really useful for every IS major. Otherwise, he is an awesome guy
very good teacher. energetic and friendly and understanding about the stress of being a college student. very helpful on project

The reviews on here are really hard for this guy. I thought his class wasn't too bad. He is willing to help prep for exams and is fairly easy. The class was graded by 10 quizzes (2 dropped) and 3 bigger tests. The final isn't cumulative so its pretty easy to study for and the quizzes were problems right from the video he posted.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor is very good. As long as you constantly pay attention in class, you will do fine. Although the tests can be different from the practice exams, they are easy to do if you also read the book. If you have concerns, definitely ask him during office hours or go through the book. it helps!
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor tries to help students in many ways: weighs grading fairly, light weekly homework, self-made formula sheet allowed on every test. Stats is just a very uninteresting and difficult subject! Simons works on real-world projects and is very interesting when you go to him for extra help.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This prof. doesnt explain things well. The tests he gave are not easy, and he cannot even solve some of the problems quickly.  If anyone wants to ruin the GPA, Simons is an ideal prof you.

Professor Simons is an incredibly smart man who is simply not meant to be a teacher. He has an interesting backstory but struggling to convey challenging information/topics to students. His test reviews are not representative of actual test questions and he leaves students to teach themselves most of the info. Look elsewhere if you value your GPA.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: class examples and homework are extremely easy and unrepresentative of the actual test. Teaching is extremely confusing and he doesn't want to help you (cherish top kids and neglect the rest 80% of the class). Be prepared to spend a lot of time to study by yourself, since he doesn't know the material very well either.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Do yourself a favor and take anyone else. This class is a mess and so is he. The first 20 minutes of class are spent talking about cookstoves from his trip to Uganda or arguing about the value of stats. His practice exam will not prepare you for the tests and if you don't teach yourself youll fail. Takes no responsibility for his horrible teaching

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Gives study guides that are simple and easy and then the exams he gives do not reflect the material learned in class or practiced on the study guide. He is very argumentative with the class when everyone expresses concern for their grades and the material. Would never take again

one of my favorite professors at Fordham! took him last semester for campaigns and elections, he has a background in politics which is really cool. Very nice guy, really cares about students it seems. Didn't seem to grade tough but sometimes instructions are a little vague, midterms and finals are all papers. Great class, cool guy, loved it!

I'm really disappointed in him. What he says, and what he does are very different things. When it comes to exams he is so vague, and grades tough. He told me don't worry about my grades after a B on my midterm and when he gave me a B- at the end he told me "don't worry" meant show more effort. I'm an A student and he destroyed my GPA. BEWARE!

Not sure how anyone gave him a bad review, he's so easy and funny. Took him for Campaigns & Elections and also Interest Group Politics. One book that you can read the conclusion of each chapter and get enough info to answer his broad midterm and final questions. His 10 page paper could be written in a weekend he's such a lenient grader.

Great teacher, hilarious guy. Fare grader too. Class is not too tough if you have a general base of knowledge like I had. However, I did A work but he gave me a B+. Why? I think he figured out I did very little reading, and my attendance was infrequent. So I deserved it. Took him three times. Have a sense of humor about self. Will poke fun at you.
worst professor at fordham. gives no notes, is unclear, and forgets what he says in previous lectures, and repeats himself.

I have him for American Political Parties. I don't know why he has gotten good reviews. He doesn't give notes and asks extremely vague essay questions on exams. Makes it seem like it's easy to do well, but a lot of people did poorly on the midterm. Didn't learn much, just endless BS debates. Also, he plays favorites, so don't get on his bad side.
I wouldn't say he is "an easy A." I studied hard and got a B+. His exams are all essays. Likes it when students engage in classroom debates. Funny and nice guy.
two thumbs up!! easy A. His stories will make you pee in your pants laughing

This guy knows his stuff. Knows Campaigns and the American political process like the back of his hand. Easy-going and hysterically funny too. He cares about the success and well-being of his students. Wants you to enjoy and love Campaigns & Elections as much as he does. Don't skip class-exams are based on a big chunk of class lectures/discussions

Prof Rubio is very kind. His class is a pretty standard Spanish class, but there is a decent amount of work each week (but keep in mind this was for a fully asynchronous class) and a lot of My Spanish Lab. He does speak in Spanish during class, but he is very understanding and accommodating. A few quizzes and tests, nothing crazy.

I absolutely love Professor Rubio. He's extremely caring about his students and loves participation. He's also very generous with grading. You'll always get 100s on homework. We had like 4 tests throughout the class (one for each finished chapter) and the class was super organized, especially in unfortunate times like these.

Professor Rubio is an awesome Professor. He definitely has a passion for what he is teaching. He was great with connecting what we were learning in class with what was going on currently. He is super caring, and wants his students to succeed. He was especially great during the Coronavirus Pandemic, and always cared about we were doing.

He is all-around a good professor. He was very caring and nice especially during the coronavirus which I feel says a lot about a professor. If your Spanish skills are not strong, I would recommend taking this professor as he is not harsh and only wants you to learn. Nothing really to complain about. A decent amount of homework.

Professor Rubio has been extremely caring towards his students during coronavirus. He has taken the time to let us talk about our concerns and is not burdening us with work, and this cant be said about most professors. He is truly a compassionate man and his students are lucky to have him during difficult this time. Thank you Professor Rubio!

He always had stains on his shirt, but he was a pretty good teacher! There were a lot of trivial homework assignments on MySpanishLab that I totally forgot about that brought my grade down which totally sucked bc they didn't help! An awesome dive into modern latino culture. Doesn't emphasize grammar yet grades kinda hard on it. Allows revisions.

Take Prof. Rubio's class! Rubio is a super sweet and caring guy and really wants you to do well. He gets it if you're just trying to fill the requirement. Participate as much as you can. He speaks in Spanish but will switch to English if the class doesn't get it. Not that much homework. Reach out to him for office hours (they help!)

Prof is good at giving enough assignments so that the grade you receive is fair. Not the best teacher, but good enough if you study. Very willing to help. Class is not too difficult. Class is a bit hard to stay engaged in because it can get repetitive and boring.

Pretty easy. Sometimes unclear when he explains new topics, but he uses the textbook for everything so you can teach yourself. A lot of online assigned homework and written homework. All orals were with groups. If you take some time to do the work you will do extremely well.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: While I don't think that this class was that hard, I do think that prof. rubio was not a good teacher. He barely taught and would just read examples from the book without any further explanation. Just a really average prof.

Professor Rubio is really nice guy who knows that a lot of his students are fulfilling their language requirements. He uses a lot of group activities to get people to participate in class too. Class entirely in Spanish, but doesn't fault you for using English once in a while to understand the material. Lots of projects and a midterm and final.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Vicente was great!  I took him over the summer at Lincoln Center three times a week for three hours.  He helps you so much and makes the time go by quickly.  Gives extra credit if you don't do great on a test and gives easy assignments and projects to help boost low test scores.  He even gave a take home test!  Definitely take!

I love his class. He's an amazing professor and he meets your needs. He is such a sweetheart and there is no way you can fail his class. He is just awesome. If its anybody's rating you should take, believe mine. Class wasn't boring but it isn't super engaging either. He talks in a moderate pace so that you will be able to understand him.

Vicente is really great as a person, but not an amazing professor. Most students are only taking this to get the Spanish requirement over with, and he realizes this. If you misspeak it is fine, he just likes students to speak in class. Being silent and in the back (or absent) is the only way to do poorly.
Easy course. He's approachable and willing to help his students outside of class.
Fairly easy professor, friendly, but boring class. There really isn't a sense of direction in the course, but if you're ok with that Prof. Rubio isn't a bad choice.

I have absolutely enjoyed my time in Professor Patriarca's class. I'm in a graduate level class with her and she's a great professor who is very knowledgeable about this history (I'm in a class on fascism). I had originally shied away from a prior class of hers after seeing the poor reviews on here but now I'm regretting that because she's great.
ratingTags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: What makes this class so difficult is that Silvana assumes that everybody has her encyclopedic knowledge of Mediterranean history. The class would greatly benefit from a deeper exploration of the history in lectures and readings, She's a VERY strict grader on papers but is always ready to meet with you outside of class to discuss the content.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Patriarca is the harshest grader I've ever come across at Fordham. She expects grad-level work out of sophomores/juniors. Her grading is not fair at all, but she is accessible outside of class and she's willing to help. Required 4 books to purchase ($200) and a lot of reading per week. Midterm, take-home final, 5-6 page paper on your choice.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Personally, I love history so I enjoyed her class and they were easy A's. The quizzes are fairly simple and straightforward, but if history is not your thing then probably don't take this class. Her accent is only slightly hard to understand but she is nice

Never take this class ever. If you are not a history major, the subject matter will bore you to death. The exams and quizzes aren't overly complex, but the study guides are 2 and 3 pages for short assessments. I wanted to transfer and never step foot on Fordham campus again right after meeting her. The worst. Run. Now

Dr Patriarca is very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject material. I can't help but feel that there is a disconnection between her and the students however. Something in her personality or character creates a distance from herself. A rather strict grader when it comes to papers but only one exam all semester, midterm, which is very easy.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Yes, Silvana is a hard professor, but her class is very enjoyable and her accent isn't that hard to understand. It's college, theres plenty of foreign professors and you'll never be able to avoid getting one in a college experience. She's very knowledgeable and passionate about coursework, and midterm and final are easy. Highly recommend her class.

Great professor. Obviously cares about the topic and tries to tie it into modern day issues. You can get by with a B without any major effort. If you do the readings and take notes then you have an A. Final and Midterm are a few multiple choice questions and short essays. Not an easy class but with the right effort you can get an A. I recommend.

HIST 1000: Mod Europe. A great teacher. Her lectures are interesting and knows what she is talking about. Taking notes is important as her power-points are really just her talking points. Easy work load, several quizzes (vocab based mainly), a midterm, final, and only two short papers. Should definitively keep up with the textbook readings though.

Modern European History centers around the French Revolution. She has a VERY thick accent and loves class discussion. There are a few group presentations, tests, and a final paper. She actually told our class that she expects grad-level work. Overall, don't recommend unless you love the French Revolution and are looking for a challenge.
Terrible, she grades very hard and you can barely understand her. Do not take her class there are plenty of other History classes that you can take. You will dread going to her class
Very thick accent. Huge fan of in-class discussions; she remembers who has participated and who hasn't. Lots of group presentations, and a hard grader. Nice, but definitely a hard class.

Please avoid this professor at all cost, your gpa will for a fact get ruined. You can't understand her, she is boring and useless. I don't know why i'm paying 40,000 for a professor like this. She makes you want to drop out of college due to her grading. She grades like were in grad school for a highschool course

Not as bad as the ratings let on. Midterm, final, term paper, and a few quizzes. Lecture is boring but the material really is interesting and you can tell she enjoys the subject. Somewhat of a hard grader, so an A is hard to come by, but A- and B+ is completely achievable.

She's a really sweet teacer, and completely understanding when you have any issues you need to discuss with her. She tries her best to allow you to do well, and her quizzes/exams are quite easy. It's true her ppts aren't the most helpful, but if you keep up with readingss, there shouldn't be any problems.

She does teach primarily from Powerpoint presentations, and she sometimes includes video clips/movies to help you grasp ideas. She doesn't use class time for details and facts, but instead she covers broad themes and ideas about the Enlightenment. She is a very nice professor, and although her grading isn't the easiest, she will help you. Take it!

She uses PowerPoints that do not give facts, but the concepts and points of discussion, which makes you do the reading (which I was able to get by without doing). She really tries to make it a course in a Jesuit school by really encouraging in-class discussion. If you want to develop cohesive and creative ideas, take this class.

She teaches from Powerpoints which can make the class extremely boring. Just assigned reading for most of the semester with a midterm, final, and a final paper. Avoid this class though. She's very nice but her class is very mundane.
RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN! Bored me to tears and you can't understand her!

Brilliant professor who really knows her stuff. However, unless your a history manjor or have strong interest in taking this class, it is not worth it. The work load it very light, but what you do get is weighted so heavily that it doesn't give you any leeway. She is a very nice lady, but should not be teaching a core requirement. BEWARE.

I took me a while to get over her accent. But I thought she was extreamly intellectual and she knows what shes talking about. She gives extensions and lets you rewrite papers as long as you discussed it with her during office hours. She grades fairly. ALOT of reading, but you can get away with not doing it. I would defiantly recommend her.
No Comments
No Comments
Fordham should not give her tenure.  She is the most aweful teacher I have ever encounterd.  Take anyone besides her.

I found her class boring but i did learn a lot.  Her accent is sometimes hard to understand but if your like me and love any kind of history then u could take her and not worry about a bad grade cuz u'll understand whats going on.
very boring, lectures not very helpful,LOTS OF PAPER HARD GRADER THINKS SHE'S A ENGLISH TEACHER.sHE KNOWS HER STUFF JUST CAN'T EXPLIAN MAYBE BETTER IN DIFF. HISTORY COURSE,NICE LADY JUST BAD TEACHER!

Nice lady, not a bad accent, but booooring. I sat in the front row and slept anyway. A lot of reading assigments that no one reads. And only the 2 people that read it will gladly carry the discussions. Not hard, but be prepare to study for midterm + Final

She is a good college teacher stuck in a required high-school like Fordham class that no one likes. She has a cool accent, is really friendly, and likes when people want to talk about stuff. I would recommend her as best possible option for West. Civ.
hARD GRADER, lOTS OF READING, BORING, BUT TRYES TO MAKE CLASS INTERRESTING, ACCENT BUT NOT THAT BAD, NICE LADY, IF YOU DO THE WORK U CAN PASS

soooo boring!! however, only a midterm, paper, & final. she assigns a lot of reading, that u dont even need to read! not a hard class, smart lady, but doenst really know how to teach, especially in a lecture hall.

Can't get to sleep cause you were partying all night? If so, then this is your class. Talks nonstop with a bad accent about things you will never care to write down. Don't take her unless you're an insomniac. Sweey dreams.

Ms. Patriarca is a nice person, but she can't teach. I have never ever been so sleepy in a class before in my life! You can seriously get 10 hours of sleep the night before and your eyes will STILL BE HEAVY in her class! Heavy accent...hard to understand!
Big accent, useless tangents, boring AND useless lectures, way too much reading...do not take under any circumstances unless you thrive under bad professors.
Unclear, jumps around, doesn't answer questions clearly. TOO much too read.
ANGEL. Truly cares about her students and intersectional education. Deeply cares about the Bronx community. I cannot stress this enough--she's an angel. 10/10

prof combs is great. she made ethics and econ this class bearable by including very interesting topics! the debates are annoying to coordinate with groups but ended up being fun in class. a couple of essays, a written in class midterm, and the final is a midlength paper. do the readings and take notes in class and you'll be fine.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Prof Combs is a great teacher. Her tests can be challenging, but if you do the homework and read the textbook you'll be fine. The test questions are similar to the homeworks. She's really willing to help you during her office hours. She's clear and knows what to focus on. Would definitely recommend.

Took her class for Basic Macro, really good teacher and her exams are easy if you do the homework questions and pay attention in class. She also grades tests fairly easy and is super nice if you go to her during her office hours!!
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I took Prof. Combs for the honors class Ethical Dimensions, and even though I hate economics, she made this class fun and enjoyable! She's so kind and very funny, and she genuinely cares about students. She did assign 3 very long books (which I only skimmed), and the final essay was too long for the prompt, but as a whole, she's a great prof!
She cares whether students learn the material and she connects the book to what is going on in the news. I learned a great deal about macroeconomics and economic policy.
Would not recommend. She's extremely hard and expects you to know an enormous amount of material for an introductory level class. Many students struggled to pass her class, I wouldn't take her again.
ratingTags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Combs is the best! She makes her lectures as straight forward as possible, and does a recap of the previous class at the beginning of each class. The online book is very helpful to have, because the exams are straight from the homework assignments, online practice, and notes examples. Very clear, would definitely take her again.
ratingTags: Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: Professor Combs cares a lot about her students. Her lectures are interesting and engaging. She uses class experiments to make the material more accessible. Tests are not hard if you study from the homework and multiple choice practice. Very fair and clear professor. I hope I have the opportunity to take her again.
The homework and review far exceed what you actually learn in class. Its hard. Wouldn't want to take again.

Professor Combs is an amazing Macroeconomics professor. I learned so much during the class. While the information can sometimes be difficult to understand, the notes that she presented in class were very helpful for studying purposes. The tests and the homework are usually very straightforward.

Great professor, definitely cares about her students. Class is never just her reading from textbook, she always gives cool examples and does interactive activities. Homework not too bad, and tests can be tricky but if you study you should be fine. Take her!
ratingTags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She goes over each chapter in class. So if you do the readings, her lectures will only help to better understand the material. Textbook is online and you can also buy a hardcopy. Only homework is to answer 5-10 questions after reading each chapter. She writes everything down on the board. Great teacher and I would take her again.
Great class.  Learned a lot about macro and about economic policy.  She cares whether students learn about the economy.

Prof Combs is great. I learned so much about macro and econ in general in her class. Tests are tough but if you do the homework and read the textbook you'll be fine. She's also really willing to work through things you don't understand if you go to her office hours. she's clear and knows what to focus on. Would definitely recommend.

Prof Combs is great. I learned so much about macro and econ in general in her class. Tests are tough but if you do the homework and read the textbook you'll be fine. She's also really willing to work through things you don't understand if you go to her office hours. She's knowledgable and passionate. Would definitely recommend.

She is a very sweet woman. She is very clear cut about what's on the tests and although the homework could be difficult, the tests, and especially the final were very easy. Do what she says and you will get an A
Awesome professor, I learned so much about the economy and did not dread class at all. Tough tests if you don't read and use the textbook as your aid. Smart, kind, funny woman.

Mary Beth is fairly good at explaining the basic concepts. But she doesn't go through how to solve most types of problems, so you end up teaching yourself a lot. The class was really interesting, though, and Prof. Combs is the nicest woman on campus.

She does a great job of including students in a conversation rather than a typical lecture.   She taught very clearly, did not get sidetracked unless it was extremely relevant and interesting, and was a fair grader. She was very positive and enthusiastic, and she made herself available, even when inconvenient for her.

Professor Combs is a great teacher. Very nice lady, knowledgeable and passionate. She knows exactly what she is talking about and can field any question. Learned a whole lot in her class. Finished with a better understanding on the economy. Class defiantly requires a lot of independent work and effort to understand the complicated concepts.

Professor. Combs is really nice, her tests are manageable if you do the homeworks. She's very straightforward and most of the questions on the tests are exactly from the homework questions. Would take her again!

Dr. Combs is a very interactive professor. She has a genuine concern for her students and wants them to learn the material. She knows what students struggle with the most, what they need to get out of the class, and she engages the students in such a way that econometrics becomes an enjoyable subject!
Learned alot about economics.  Tests are tough, but she was always willing to help me when I went to her office hours for extra help with the problems.  Would take again.

The average grade on our midterm was a 72. Took a ton of notes writing definitions. Rarely went over how to solve problems, which is on the test. The homework assigned is where you learned how to solve problems or work the graphs, but that means I mostly taught myself how to do it. Also, no calculators for the tests. She was nice though.

Very clear, I was able to understand the concepts the first time she explained them.  Tough grader on the exams, but practice problems did help.  Would definitely take her for another course, I became more interested in Economics after taking this class

Professor Combs is a very friendly and laid back professor, at least for this Service Learning course: Ethical Dimensions & Contemporary Social Problems. She has a very intense syllabus, but the class itself requires mainly attendance and discussion, which was actually fun and interesting- would definitely recommend for the Honors course.
She cares whether students learn.  Tests on problems from class and problems assigned from book (different numbers).  No calculators allwed on exams but math is easy.
She cares whether students learn the material and she connects the book to what is going on in the news.  I learned alot.

Professor Combs is a great professor! She is very clear when teaching material and assigns optional HW that is very beneficial (same questions, different numbers on test!). Reading and outlining the book before class is very helpful to understanding material easily in class. Do the HW and practice multiple choice questions on the app to get an A.
She genuinely cares about whether the students understand and learn the material.

Class was extremely boring. Did not learn much. She teaches SAS and code. On quizzes and exams, she is very picky about the wording of answers. She doesn't answer email and does not accept any emailed papers or submissions.

She is a really nice lady and one of the best teacher in the department. A lot of note taking in the class, but there are almost no homework. Always very helpful.  Cares the students and hopes they do well. As long as you read the book, take good notes, and do the practices in the book, you will be fine. Recommended.

Assigned a lot of random reading assignments.  Exams are hard but manageable. Homework assignments help boost grade. Also  if you show improvement, higher test scores will weigh more.  Overall, interesting class and as long as you pay attention in class and understand the homework you will get a good grade.

Pretty boring class, doesnt really explain the material all that well. Uses a lot of graphs that she doesnt explain. Tests are hard because you barely know any of the material that are going to be on them because she barely teaches anything
Liked this class and the connections made between econ, the real world, and literature. Fair teacher.  Learned a lot.
Harsh Grader.  Does not use text book.  A lot of note taking.  Plays favorites.
thought this professor was fair and the readings were interesting.

She has no idea what she's doing; she can't answer anyone's questions and her reasoning for things changes everyday. The class was also very boring and it was obvious she got her whole class plan out of a book. She also plays favorites and strongly pushes an incredibly left agenda through her lectures.
Loved econ and lit!  The tests were hard, but fair.  She really tries to help you learn the material and connect the stories to economic ideas.

She plays favorites. Her final and midterm are impossible. She barely covers the material that was on the two tests.  She grades papers incredibly unfairly.  When she picks out who she likes and who she doesn't the class will either be hard or easy for you. DONT TAKE HER. spends way to much time drawing graphs and no time explaining them.
loved this class and learned a lot.  Hard but good readings.
Difficult Tests and Prof Pushes a tired leftist spin on economics. Plays favorates
Had her for econometrics. Miserable, miserable, miserable. I know the class is automatically a bore, but she sure didn't go out of her way to help.
what a dreg. A ton of material, papers, exams, tests, quizes etc total overload. pushes left wing political idology at the students with materials from liberal blowhards.

Cutest teacher in the Econ department. She seems tough at first,but explains the material VERY well. You will most likely retain much of what you learn in her class. The readings are long, but interesting. Make sure you take notes on the readings..they will help when it comes to the midterm & final

Choose the service learning option! Take this professor, reading may seem a bit much, but the few short papers are easy to complete. The tricky parts are the in-class exams. Just because they're open book does not mean that they are easy. Prepare for those the most. In sum, a pretty fair teacher.
She's A1 in my book!
wow, sounds like all the good recs are written by the teacher herself...because she really is not good. whether you read or not, she's not helpful when you go to office hours.

Yeah, she does want you to read up on the material--so what?  She demands a lot from her students but she gives soo much of her time to help us learn!  Def. take this class--you'll learn a lot even if it is hard.

one of the best teachers i've ever had.  loved her! makes sure everyone understands material.  tests were challenging, but you learn a lot. if you study you'll do well. makes stats interesting, which is very difficult to do. def take her. i got a lot out of the course

Okay, she comes off really cool, and then you take the test--ouch!  She is a tough grader, and sometimes she's not in a good mood when you go to her office.  If you want help, be sure to READ UP on everything before going in.
this is the worst class ever. boring and doesn't seem to know what she's talking about at all.
best class ever
not a good class at all.

By far the best teacher i've had at FU.  Very smart and helpful.  Is concerned with each student Although her tests are tough she makes sure everyone's prepared.  There is a review session for every quiz/test and a review sheet w/ last year's exam.

Best stats teacher I've ever taken.  She explains things so well that you don't even need the textbook, all you have to do is copy what she writes on the board.  The only problem is that her grading is a bit harsh.
She is the best of the best of the best stats teacher on the planet
If you want a more liberal approach to economics, take her!
course is challenging but prof is great!
take for any economics class.  excellent professor and easy.
I took Prof. Ramirez for Environmental Politics and I really enjoyed the class. Not a tough grader at all and very understanding. BB posts and Essay Midterm and Final.

Honestly, some of these other reviews really surprise me. I have taken Professor Ramirez twice, and I have loved every second of her class. She is clearly intelligent and excited to share. She is great about creating productive class discussions and her lectures are very interesting. She is not a tough grader at all. Be prepared to read, though!

Professor Ramirez's class is super light work. There was weekly discussion posts and one final paper. The professor is very understanding and a pretty easy grader. Take this class if you want an easy A, but if you want to be challenged, I would say to look somewhere else.

Really nice person but a bad professor. She's super disorganized (students were more prepared for class than her) and you never really know where the course is going because it changes all the time. She's ridiculously harsh with grades which would be fair except her assignments are so poorly planned that it can't only be our fault if we miss things
Class is always cancelled, and such a lack of professionalism. The worst class I have ever taken at Fordham- I learned nothing new and the readings are heavy and dense

A lovely person, however, not a good educator. Her lesson plans are poorly planned and cancels class for illegitimate reasons. By far, one of the worst professors at Fordham. Her lack of commitment to the course and poor delivery of the material is appalling. Do not take this professor if you want to learn. I learned more from the students.

Sometimes I feel he forgets this is an intro class. When we got to the first quiz and Midterm, I felt there wasn't enough time to complete the assignments and you really need know the material to get full credit. A little difficult but not impossible. He's also kinda passive agressive.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I hate this man. If I could trade my A- for a D and never have to see him again, I would. He is pretentious, arrogant, talks down to students, and is generally hostile towards critiques or mistakes. He pushes this persona of the "cool professor" who understands his students when he is part of the problem he tries to set himself apart from. Lacking.

Dr. Kindervater is one of my favorite professors at Fordham. He is incredibly passionate about what he teaches and it shows in his lectures. While it was a very discussion based class, he provides great insight and helped me learn a lot. However, the class is pretty writing/reading heavy for homework & he encourages class participation.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: i would 1000% take this professor again, this class totally changed my perspective on so many things and i learned A LOT. there is a lot of reading and also attendance is SUPER SUPER SUPER important, but it's all worth it
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of my favorite classes to date at Fordham. He makes the material very accessible and easy to understand. Changes your way of thinking about the concepts of Peace and Justice and the society we live in in general. Very approachable and funny professor. His monologues are the best! Assessments were straightforward and graded extremely fairly.

Incredible Professor. The perfect combination of funny, engaging, and dedicated to the subject. He'll push you outside your comfort zone with ideas you've never considered and help you laugh about the process. I don't usually take to Professors so quickly, but there's something so authentic that deserves to be said for this guy. Take this class.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Evanson is so sweet and really does a good job at explaining the material.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Kari Evanson is such an angel. I had her as we switched from in-person learning to online in March and she was incredibly organized, made class bearable, and even enjoyable, even during such a horrible time. I kept good communication with her, attending office hours several times, and got an A in the end which I never thought I could do in French.

Prof. Evanson is the best professor in the French department. So, so sweet and willing to help you with any and everything. Do the reading and be prepared to talk in class, but she's very easygoing and just wants to see you succeed. We did fun projects and she makes reading in French fun. A true gem.
Prof Evanson is like a mom. There is a lot of homework and it can get overwhelming sometimes, but she is always there to help and prepares you well for other french profs.

I loved Prof. Evanson! I had her for an online summer course and she was great. There is definitely a ton of homework and outside work to do, but it's all there so you really understand the language. I really feel like I got somewhere with French, despite never having taken the language before! Prof. Evanson is great- be prepared to put in work!:)

Evanson is hype. She's fun to be in class with and I'm currently intending to take as much of my language requirement with her as I can fit. She makes you work, homework every night, but it's manageable. Offers corrections for partial credit on all tests and compositions. She also has a better nose for students zoning out than anyone I've met.

If you are just trying to pass the language requirement and dont know french , dont take her. She makes you work HARD for it and there is so much to do outside of class also. just take a language you know or another teacher

I love this so much! She's so amazing. She's extremely helpful, and extremely understanding to any situation. She's extremely gifted as well as I'm quite  pleasantly surprised at how eloquently she speaks in french considering she's not a native! She made it to my favorite professors list really fast!
Professor Evanson is fantastic.  She really wants her students to do well.  She's very helpful and understanding.
My favorite french teacher. I've never met someone as sweet and as caring as her. Such a good teacher, always willing to help. She makes learning French enjoyable! Love her.
Always willing to help, and is super nice and understanding. She knows what she's doing and makes French a lot easier and more enjoyable.

She is a great teacher! If you go to her office hours, she will be more than willing to help you. You'll improve your french so much with her. Easy, entertaining, and helpful class. I would definitely take her again.

Professor Evanson is great. I'm terrible at French but her classes are definitely passable, and she really tries to make things engaging for students. She genuinely cares about students and is very reasonable about extensions/late work (within reason). Definitely recommend.
Genuinely nice person, there for you and wants you to succeed. I look forward to taking her again! Understandable about personal issues!
She's so sweet! Really understandable about late work. you have to go to class though.
Love her! She is a complete sweetheart and makes learning French very easy. I definitely recommend her if you want to take an introductory French class.
Prof. Evanson is the bomb! She is awesome, I will definitely retake her in the future. I really got a lot out of her class, and she's just an all-around great person.

She is one of the sweetest person I have ever met, as well as an awesome professor. Highly would recommend her. You do get homework everyday but it is easy. She made me want to minor in French. Very fun class.

She is AWESOME! Would highly recommend. Came in with some background French but still think she is a great teacher and anyone can learn a lot. An A is very possible if you do your homework and study for tests. You get homework every night but its easy stuff. Classes are fun too. I highly, highly recommend.

Great professor.  Explains things clearly thoroughly answers questions.  Homework for every class, but very manageable workload.  Grading is also very fair; if you pay attention and study a bit getting an A is very possible.  Very nice person and cares about students.  Would absolutely take again.

Cris Poor is an excellent choice for a math professor. His quizzes, tests, and homework are challenging, but reasonable and he is willing to help you understand the material. He is very sweet and his lectures are well-paced and engaging. I do not know if I would recommend Dr. Poor for someone not heavily into math, but as a math major, he is great.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Poor is well versed in the subject matter and always has interesting tidbits to share about what we're learning. He will answer any questions and is accessible outside of class too. Some HW questions may seem daunting at first, but he always provides you with the necessary solving skills. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Poor gives detailed and interesting lectures. Completing all HW's is necessary to grasp the material and receive an A. He sometimes struggles to simplify ideas enough to make them palatable for students hearing those ideas for the first time. Overall a very smart, well-organized Prof. who will expand your math skills if you put the effort in.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: prof poor is an amazing teacher who explains concepts in depth, always open to questions and happy to answer any, and always available outside of class because of his heavy involvement in the department textbook was not mandatory but definitely helped and same with attendance is also very flexible with deadlines

VERY specific on homework. The homework that he gave us was on topics that we did not even cover in class and ultimately had to teach ourselves. He says that he does not want to trick us on our final exam/quizzes but while some of the questions came from homework, the other questions came out of nowhere. If you want to do well, teach yourself.
I had Professor Poor for recitation, so it was only once a week, but he was always nice and went through several examples which were almost always clear and helpful.

Professor Poor is a really sweet man and funny teacher, but the subject of this class was bad. I don't like Geometry to begin with, so ANCIENT Geometry was brutal. For future Honors students, try to take a different class! Professor Poor is nice, but the class is not.

So Calculus I doesn't come easily; You definitely have to work to understand it.  But Dr. Poor does the best job at making sure you understand difficult concepts in simplest terms.  He's an absolute genius.  Answers all your questions and doesn't mind repeating! Best in Department! Pay attention in class Classwork Reflects Exams!
Even if he is in his office hour, he kinds of useless- to that extent, didn't help at all, he always seems like he want to rush and so it is not helpful. Look nice= not academically

Hardest class at Fordham, but he is extremely available. Explains topics very well, oftentimes lets you make up homework assignments. Takes improvement into account with final grade. I did not earn my B but because I asked him for help in office hours, he gave me one. Very reasonable if you take time to meet with him.

i agree, recently he had gotten harder with students, if you don't do well in his tests, your grades will be negatively affect, just to warn people that never took Calculus before or have no interest in it at all.

Teaches very fast, and no help at all, for all math genius- you all know who you are- don't try defending him-blah, blah - he is for math genius that enjoys a professor that teaches fast.period. Worst math professor i ever had in my life!!!!

A professor that gives a decent amount of homework every week, he gives about 2 midterms and a final. So far he does not pity your mistakes on tests- BEWARE- if he gives curve, he doesn't anymore- guess professor changed over the years. Plus if you didn't want a teacher that go fast, do not take him!!!!

Took him for math in biz. II (calculus). Never took calculus in my life. Beginning topics were easy, then it got harder, but that's the subject in itself. He tried his best at explaining everything clearly and reviewed all hw...plus he has a huge curve which helped me a lot!!

Such a bad class. I dreaded going to class every time, but had to because it was the only chance I got to try and get some of this stuff. He means well, but he's just so boring. He also gives alot of homework due once a week. I guess if you're good at calc/taken it before this class will be kinda easy, but if you haven't then good luck!

I never took calc in high school, so I was extremely lost in his class. He gives a decent amnt alot of hw due once a week, so if you're already good at calc, this class will be a breeze for you. But if you kinda suck at math or the concepts are alien to you, you will find it very hard. I think its more of a review than it is learning class
Attendance isn't mandatory, but you won't get a good grade if you don't show up because most of the test questions are based on what he teaches in class.  Really nice but really boring man.

Multi2 is a difficult class to begin with but Poor is a very clear professor and you will be surprised with how much you learn. Weekly hw is really hard and very important,30% of grade. Quizzes are okay, also 30%, and final is 40%. Gives extra credit, and is willing to help. Attendance to class not mandatory, but it is to recitation.

This class was very boring and I absolutly hated it. I did well in the class (mostly As and B+s) and then I didn't do that great on the final. The final is worth 40% of your grade and it is cummulative. If you mess up on the final (which I did) forget about your other good grades. I do not recommend if you are not willing to study extra hard.

typical quirky math prof. nicest guy ever. moves at a pace so that everyone can understand what is going on and has no problems helping you if you need even more explanation. actually does examples in class. does not take attendance, but does collect hw once a week.
Best math teacher ever! NICEST MAN EVER! Goes very slowly so everyone understands. Attendance is not mandatory. I'm TERRIBLE at math and I got a B+. He is the absolute best. TAKE HIM!!!

nicest guy in the universe, i think is appropriate. THE classic math professor. doesn't make class interesting. isn't the easiest on tests/quizzes. but if he sees you in class a lot (attendance not mandatory) you'll be on his good side. if you raise your hand now and then, he'll adore you. he's an AWESOME guy, i really respect him and recommend him

I'm awful at math and just took Poor's class to fill the requirement and had NO problem at all - he goes really slow, almost to the point of boredom, but his tests come from the notes - pay attention and go to classes and you'll get a good grade
This is a hard, boring subject and Poor doesn't make it any better. Good news is he's a nice guy and passed me out of pity. Good class if your a math major. Stay away if you're mathematically slow.

I absolutely love him. Get on his good side by showing him you care (doesnt check emails often, but go to him during office hours, and speak to him after class for help). No attendance but stuff he grades you on is based on what he covers in class so i suggest you go. Only like 7 hw or so, midterm, final, and a few quizes.

Doesn't take attendance, but tests/quizes based on what he does in class.  Homework and quizes fairly easy, but the tests, which comprize a large portion of your grade, are a ****.  Most Finite Math classes suck, but Chris makes the suckiness not suck as much as other professors.

The best thing about Poor is that the mid term and final are composed of questions that were on the tests. He has no surprises and he is quite enjoyable. His teaching style is a little awkward and he tends to zone out at times for a few min. but overall he makes a subject that alot of people dont like into something no one minds. Hes a good choice.

Very nice guy, a little hard to understand, but always willing to help. I would recommend this class, but only if you are a math person. If it is core, he is a great professor to take. Go see him though when you have trouble.

Go to him for help! There is ALOT of probability, but his tests are basically from the notes he gives in class and the homework. But really, go see him for help. It'll help your grade and your favor with him.

As long as you go to class, do your homework, and take good notes you should be fine. It also really helps to go see him for help cuz that will def. help you. He's not the hottest professor, hence the "not hot" on appearance, but who cares about appearance if they're a good teacher?
wonderful wonderful man...so sweet and funny.  look out for his little jokes, theyre easy to miss. love him
No Comments
I thought he was helpful and a nice man. He has his favorites though. Go to his office hours to get on his good side.

The course is very tough and at times I do feel lost.  He is always willing to help and he does make the material somewhat clear.  For a math teacher, I would say he's very good.  He's also a very nice man.
No Comments
such a nice guy. if you show him you care, he'll take care of you. gives a nice curve, and i would definately take him again

I know nothing about math and bombed everything on a consistent basis. But I tried so hard in the class and dr. poor recognized that. he's such a sweet guy and genuinely cares... go to him for help, whatever. he will take care of you if you show him you are willing to try
Very unclear..moves fast for non-math people...will answer any questions happily...homework is very difficult and graded!!!

So good, so so good. Chris Poor is darling. He's also helpful, patient and clear-cut about his expectations. Although a few people have somehow mistaken his genuine, friendly nature for sarcasm/condescension (& despite a certain facebook hate club in his name), he's an all-around great guy. Love him

POOR IS THE MAN.  HE IS VERY HELPFUL AND A GREAT TEACHER. HIS EXAMS ARE JUST LIKE THE HW PROBLEMS.  HE WILL GIVE U A GOOD GRADE IF  HE SEE'S THAT YOU ARE TRYING TO SUCCEED.  HIS CLASS IS PRETTY EASY, JUST A FEW HW PROBLEMS A WEEK AND A MIDTERM AND A FINAL
All these people must be math geniuses...for all of us mediocre math students, Poor is impossible.  Hurts to think about his class.

If you look beyond the chalk stains on his ass, you'll find an extremely caring professor in Mr. Poor. Always available for questions, easy going, and patient with struggling students. If you have to take Finite Math, do yourself a favor and take Poor.

I got lucky on the midterm. I did very well and everyone else did horribly on it. He curved it so I pulled out a big winner. Overall I got like a b-and i suck at math. if you're good at math you should get a B.
He is very clear and is willing to help you if you are having trouble. go to his office hours if you are having trouble. too bad the book is so expensive. that's the only downside
Goes fast and skips around the book, but tries to help if you need it.
Poor is a very good teacher.  He is very smart but can be boring. Never gets mad, always smiling and helpful. Often lets class out early.  Gives hard tests but grades on a VERY generous curve.

very nice man and humorous. boring class but hey its finite. material was not difficult and he will always go over problems that you dont understand and explain them. very straight forward class. no surprises. study for quizzes, midterm, final& do hw well
good teacher. he can be very funny and tries to help anyone who has a question. Pay attention in class and do the hw and you'll do fine.
I hated this class and ended up failing this EASY math class because he was no help to me at all. He's so out there...he'd write a problem on the board for 20 min, then realize it was wrong.

Poor is wonderful.  He gives a fair amount of work.  He really is encouraging and welcoming.  He will always be willing to help you learn - he will never just give out the answer.  I have learned more from him than any other professor I have ever had.

Dr. Poor is my absolute favorite professor at Fordham.  The material may be challenging at times; however, he is extremely helpful with explaining concepts.  His funny sense of humor and big smile makes the course enjoyable.
pretty easy going, helpful, reasonable amount of work

Best math professor I've ever had.  Able to lead students beyond rote calculuation and into genuine mathematical thinking.  Does justice to a fourth semester course in calculus.  He should teach a course in real analysis.

I was a bit stunned since he is kinda fast paced, but you eventuallly get used to it. Great prof., definitely in a league all his own. Corny humor, funny little man with his hat hair and huge pants. Not an easy class if you're not into math.
Best teacher I've had in college. Very funny. Math Genius. Definitely in a world of his own.  Laid back.  Always willing to answer your questions.
No Comments
chris poor is a great teacher, and provides entertainment for the class with his fun elastic waistband pants

Dr. Brakalova was an excellent professor for me. She did assign lots of homework which could be challenging, but I felt that she was very fair with grading and test difficulty. Her lectures can become somewhat boring, but she is very sweet and willing to help you with anything if asked. I would recommend her if you are into math.

As a person returning to upper education I was nervous to jump back into math. The key to doing well in Dr. Brakalova's course is by asking good questions from the get-go. If you put in the effort (as a class), Brakalova is extremely fair and will have a better understanding of how to help you succeed. Tests are long, but relevant. Very kind lady.

I took APcalc in high school and got an A. Thought Calc 1 would be easy since I already knew most of it. She was so unorganized, weekly quizzes were pretty easy, but then she makes the tests and exams sooo difficult. Plus there was SO MUCH HOMEWORK both written and online. I did not enjoy this class for a second.

Professor Brakalova is not that great of a professor. She is very nice but that does NOT make up for the fact that she's EXTREMELY disorganized. She expects you to become a literal mathematician by just reading the textbook. I think that she really does care for her students but the class is waaayy too much work. Take at your own risk.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: She is a very nice woman and wants to see you do well. However, her teaching skills aren't the best. She is available for office hours which are helpful, but that won't fix your grades. Only take her if you are very good at math. If you don't like math, she won't be the prof for you.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: She is very nice and willing to help you, but doesn't know how to teach. You have to dedicate a lot of time outside of class teaching yourself the material otherwise you will not do well. Test heavy and inconsistent grading criteria. Avoid if possible because she will make the class more complicated than it needs to be.
ratingTags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Melkana is a very sweet, kind and understanding professor I've met at Fordham. She understands the situation of other people and is very cooperative towards her students. While some do criticize her teaching methods, I think she does her best to improve the knowledge of every student and help them grow into a better individual.

She's not a great teacher, but she's very nice. Definitely teach yourself before each class, otherwise you'll be completely lost. She takes pretty simple concepts and finds a way to make them way more complicated than necessary. Homeworks are fair, the tests were hard (class avg on midterm was a 66 with the curve), but there's lots of extra credit.

I knew all of the material before taking this class, so I found the lectures interesting and stimulating. If I didn't know the material, the material would overwhelm me. If you're taking Calc 2, make sure to review the material before class. The lectures will make sense. No one did this and that's why the reviews are bad. The accent is no problem.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Brakalova is great. She likes to explain the theories behind certain concepts in class which isn't necessarily helpful to everyone, but she is really accessible outside of class and offers a lot of extra credit. She gives a few tests throughout the semester and lots of homework assignments, but the work is manageable and recitation is helpful.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She has a very confusing teaching structure, there is a decent amount of homework, online and textbook, but is necessary to pass quizzes/tests because they are exactly like homework. Gives points for partial credit and offers extra credit. She just makes the class a little difficult but it is very manageable.

Confusing with the way she teaches but she means well. She's a nice person overall and I have never been to office hours but apparently they are helpful. She teaches with proofs and tries to make you understand why math is the way it is, which isn't bad, but it tends to confuse people.

This professor is not clear when teaching. She focuses on proof mainly rather than giving examples and making the class work on problems. She gives homework on topics that were not discussed in class. It is just difficult to understand and follow along. The main issue I found most students having is that the methods she teach is different.
Had Her For Rec. Didn't Understand Anything She Said. She Never Really Went Over Anything
Great person, terrible teacher. Pace of the course was slow, and she didn't command the knowledge necessary to teach the subject.

She's very difficult.  If you're a gifted calculus student, you'll do fine because you'll do fine with anyone. If you're taking this course because it meets a requirement in your major and you're not majoring in Math, take someone else. Her tests are harder than the classwork. I work very hard, always,and I'll consider myself lucky to get a C.

Okay. These reviews are hard. These people most likely skipped class and didn't give a damn about the work. Well, guess what, Calculus requires effort. She's not bad. She's so sweet and helpful. I got an A with this woman. I would recommend. If you're a slacker, like these slackers who wrote this reviews for her are, don't take.
Terrible. Stay away. No lesson plans or structured notes.

The worst. Does not teach. Hands worksheets out to work with a group while she sits and does nothing all class. Funny thing is the worksheet is nothing we've learned before and have to teach it to ourselves.

She is extremely nice. One homework assignment is due per week, so you have a lot of time to do it. It can really help your grade. Her tests are only a few questions, and one or two you need to memorize a definition or proof, but she tells you what to know before hand so it's free points if you put time in. Easy class if you put in time and effort
Want understanding get it work it shut about hard-she know it you don't get it don't get it you don't know- hang around stay around  get lost show respect your shot.

Some people aren't meant to be students either. In calc she's been helpful and she knows what she's talking about though she gets carried away now and then by some tangent only she understands. I think that's because shes always in Finland or Hungary or somewhere doing research stuff. Anyway, if you ask her she'll be really helpful you'll do well.

Honestly, this teacher isn't all that bad. Sure, she can be considered incomprehensible due to her accent but if you are willing to do the homework and to read the textbook, this class is easy. By the way, she basically gives you her tests before the actual test date.

This is calculus, not basic Algebra. She is a fine professor. While the hw's may consist of definitions and seem long, it is worthwhile to do them. If you do your h.w and go over the review sheet before the exams then you will be fine for the exams. This is math, the more work you put in, the better grade you will get in the end.
Took her for calc. She doesn't know how to explain. Some people are just not meant to be teachers. Try taking someone else.

i had professor bakalova for summer session finite math. this is the easiest class offered at fordham. easy A no matter who your teacher is. the homeworks she gives are pointless-more than half of the assignment is definitions. the other half is coping examples from the text. the only thing is  copying 5-6 pages of material is very time consuming.
Is that Walsh right below me? I think so. Brakalova is fine, just pay attention in class, do the homework, study, go see her if you don't know something. She'll give you the grade you deserve

shes not as bad as everyone says. there were times when i got extremely angry in class because she barely EVER does examples and when she does, their extremely difficult and she goes wayy too fast. but shes fair, very nice, and if you study you'll get a good grade like i did. taking notes is pretty pointless do the homework and the review sheets

She's a total space shot.  She really doesn't know what she's talking about - well she might, but she never communicates it clearly.  If you understand math, finite is ridiculously easy.  But, if math isn't your thing, she's wicked frusterating and rather unhelpful.  Teaches STRAIGHT from text, ?s from review shts are same as on tests with dif #s
i thought she was greatttt
Two thumbs down.
didnt think she was that bad. but she was nt that good either.  kind of confusing but good because always willing to help outside class.  hard tests, i agree wit that.

Worst teacher I've had at Fordham.  Her teaching methods and test preps will not prepare you at all for the impossibles tests she gives.  You really have to have a brain set for higher level mathematics to pass this class.  I mean, I got a 780 on the math SAT and I get a C- in her class??  There must be some kind of problem there.

Space Cadet.  No person below me, she is not a pleasure to learn from, because she is always on cloud 9.  Class is totally spontaneous and sometimes completely unhelpful.  Tests will come as a huge shock because the examples are 20 times harder than anything she does in her completely pointless lectures.
i failed every test and ended up with B-, not bad.

Dr. Brakalova is one of the most intelligent and creative people I have ever had the pleasure to learn from. She's the precise opposite of the stereotypical math professor who just teaches you a method or rule, which you must memorize and replicate. Instead, math with Dr. Brakalova is both subjective and elegant.
Professor is clear sometimes, sometimes not, but maybe Linear Algebra is just hard. She is very helpful if you go to see her but you have to work really hard anyway.
Way too unclear and expects way too much.  I was just shell shocked when I took her tests.

She is a pretty easy teacher. She collects homework once a week, which is easy and helps your grade out. There's no reason not to hand in homework. The quizzes and exams are very simple and follow a structure and question types she tells you before each quiz or exam.
she is a good teacher, but confusing at times, she is much better one on one.. she skips around alot, but do your hw it will help out in the end
i have never been so confused in my life.. HORRIBLE!! stay away!!!
took her in the summer, posts the class notes, quiz preps online. Did better than i had expected. take her!

One of my best teachers thus far at Fordham.  She is very helpful and welcomes students during office hours.  She even posts all lectures online to allow students to fully understand the class material.  An "A" if you follow lectures and attend class regularly.

Her class was extremely boring. Her quizzes were extremely fair but her "tests" were much harder. She always had something for the class to do, but it never much got past the basics. Thought I could have been challenged more. Nice personality. Puts notes on the internet, so if you miss a class, it's easy to catch up.
dont TAKE HER! this teacher is the worse ever.

if you don't understand math don't take this class. her way of explaining is so horrible its not even funny.  lucky for me I took AP Calculus because if not I would not have passed the class.  and she collects hw and gives test often.  so again if u don't like math and don't understand stay away.
Have fun teaching yourself Calc. for the entire semester.  If you didn't take Calc. in high school, you will be in trouble like I am now.

She knows her stuff and basically teaches herself. To me she seems as though she shows off that she knows what she's doing and we dont. Is very unclear with explanations and lectures. Goes too fast and once you are lost, you are lost for the semester. STAY AWAY!!
Wow! Is this lady serious? She is by far the worst teacher I've ever seen or heard of!!

Shes really helpful..if you go out of your way to get help. Meet her during her office hours--she'll go over things. Go to class! Its hard to keep up if you cut too many times. She gives enough homework...but doesnt collect it right away. Lots of quizzes--which is good to balance out the grade.

Her class is actually really easy.  As long as you actually show up and pay attention, it's hard not to do well.  She drops two of your lowest quiz grades and offers extra help if you don't understand the topics.  Give her a chance.
No Comments

Once u get past the thick Bulgarian accent, she's actually not bad-my advice to u is give her a chance-don't bash her right off the bat like we did cause she's actually really smart and knows her stuff-it just might take her a while to communicate it. She's nice too and will help u whenever she can.
Best Math teach i ever had here at Fordham as well as in HS.  You must be a real tool to say anything negative about her.
Worst teacher I've ever had!!!!!

Jasun Gong is a very smart professor and wishes the best for his students. His lecture can go quite fast and cover lots of material, but his office hours are helpful. His tests are extremely challenging and he does not give breaks on grading. His courses are quite hard to succeed in, but with effort and office hours, it is possible to do well.
ratingTags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lectures can be hard to understand but mostly because I never read textbook beforehand. Fair grading on midterm quizzes as I thought I failed the first 3 only to find out I got way above class average. Only took regular Cal before this class. Not that much work tbh, but can be in part because of the class being online.

His lectures are really great. He really knows Mathematics inside out. However, his quizzes are crazy hard. Absolutely no extra credit. His class is fun but difficult to do well. I would not recommend him for non math majors.

At the beginning of the semester the delivery was choppy and the content of the class rather opaque. As we moved online, the content's delivery became crisper. Overall, the content was harder than expected and Dr Gong often assigned non textbook problems as HW. Dr Gong made himself available and promptly answered questions. Overall positive.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Gong is so caring and he wants his students to succeed: lots of office hours, extra opportunities for credit, and curves grades at the end. This course was difficult because it was the first advanced mathematics class I took. Seek individual help from him. He will help you make the leap from a student in a math class to a math student.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Gong is a great mathematician. However, the teaching skill just is not there. he goes too fast in class, there is too much homework (brutally graded on correctness), quizzes every week, exams are very different from examples done in class. He tries to be helpful though. If you want to do well in this class be prepared to drop everything else.

Really smart guy, but awful at lectures. The material just didn't make sense. Got an A in the class only after full days in the library during finals week and about 10 mental breakdowns. Go to his office hours and leave even more confused than before.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Very challenging professor who has tests and quizzes that will leave you lost if you do not prepare for them. You will spend hours on homework on endless proof problems. Lectures are okay, but sometimes makes his examples too complicated and makes mistakes and then messes up the whole thing. If you are not a super strong math student, avoid him.

Jasun is an incredible mathematician, but doesn't know how to translate his knowledge to students. Lectures do not correlate with quizzes and exams, so you must read the textbook in order to do well. Very robotic, and makes a few computational mistakes in lecture, so always pay attention. If you don't have a math background, I don't recommend him
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I would not recommend Prof. Gong for the casual math student. He is a harsh grader, and tests contain problems that challenge your critical thinking skills. Weekly HW contains 15+ probs graded on correctness. Lectures are robotic. Be prepared to learn everything from the textbook. He is a good mathematician, bad professor.
tough professor that gives lectures based on textbook and classroom versions. you must pay attention in class for 1 hour and read the text book and go to office hours to receive a decent grade
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Gong is really tough. His lectures are robotic and often go in depth about unnecessary topics, so you spend the semester playing catch up, BUT on top of that, you get a quiz every week. Homework is graded strictly and for credit. 2 midterms and a final, both not impossible. You can get the A if you really, really work for it.

talks like a robot, midterm had 5 questions on it, tests had 2, and got 40/100 on HOMEWORKS. don't take this class unless you're prepared to spend hours on homework only to be tested on something 50x harder. you have to teach yourself half of the content.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He's cool. If you take him for a hard class and you do bad cause you're dumb or don't study that's on you. Easy if you do the homeworks and make sure everything is clear lecture by lecture. He's willing to help outside of class but he won't spoon feed you.

This guy gives Ds left and right. Took him for math and I'm forever scarred by his lectures and his exams. So many ppl dropped his class and I wish I had done the same too. He is very emotionless and robotic, if you're into that, take him lol
Goes way too in depth with his work and explanations.
He makes his tests incredibly complicated, and gives hours of homework

I took Gong for Linear Algebra. It was terrible. His lectures were painfully boring and over complicated. He is also so robotic and emotionless that speaking to him during office hours was a struggle. Overall, Gong taught me nothing about Linear and my fail grade reflects how well I taught myself the subject. Do not take him.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His lectures are too wordy and talks in a boring, robotic fashion.   Tests are also tough even if you study.  He was pretty helpful in office hours though.

his class is impossible. he is very robotic, goes so fast during lecture, and doesn't really give you a chance to practice the concepts in class. the homework takes forever, is graded on correctness, ISNT CURVED, AND only certain problems are graded. the tests are also extremely difficult. i'm barely scraping by & would recommend switching out asap

Dr. Gong is very helpful, polite, and informative. However, if you take his class, you must really advocate for yourself and seek help outside of class with the homework and with the concepts presented in class. The tests are also difficult and quickly paced, so make sure you know your stuff before going in. Great teacher, but very difficult.
Had him fro multi, explains material in a robotic fashion but if you talk to him one on one he clarifies the material well. Tests are very difficult and be prepared to look for tricks.

Had him for Real Analysis, Linear Algebra I, Numerical Analysis, and Complex Analysis.  He is an excellent professor.  His lectures are extremely clear, so clear that you can understand the concept right away.  That being said, his homework and tests are tough ( he challenges your thinking skills).  Take him if you want to become a mathematician.
Some of his lectures are confusing, but if you do the homework you'll get it.

Dr. Morrison is very smart and knows the field extremely well. Despite this, his ability in teaching can be quite harsh. There were mandatory weekly meetings where he would assess your semester-long paper. These were brutal: he gave contradictory advice and berated me despite my constant effort in this paper. Very challenging person to deal with.

I took Professor Morrison's Linear Algebra class as a freshman and loved him. Super tough class, but I felt like he really prepared me well for college level math. I could not recommend him enough if you're serious about math.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Despite being a bit hard to understand sometimes, Morrison genuinely wants you to do well and is a smart dude. The class is pretty test/quiz heavy but you'll do fine as long as you go to office hours (which is easy since he makes them mandatory anyways). Biggest tip is to not fall behind it'll be hard to catch up bc the class is really fast-paced.

Prof M was pretty clear about what he wanted in his exams; 2 midterms and a final. His exams are pretty straightforward and weekly quizzes are a recap of things done during the week, usually only two questions. He tries to makes things clearer and easier for us to understand

This guy ruined my gpa. I've loved math my entire life and I took calc in highschool and did well. But unless you're like actually amazing at calculus, save yourself the pains of this class and choose anyone but him. 2 assignments due each week, each one takes at like 2-3 hours to do. its horrible. exams are impossible. stay away. very boring too.

The beginning and end of the semester are much easier to follow than the middle of the material. He doesn't do enough example problems, often it was just more of an explanation of how to go things, which was no use when I had to do it on my own so I taught myself. Some online homework is very difficult and involves things not covered well in class.

Dr. Morrison is super nice, and I cannot understand why so many people hate him. This course is super easy,and if you want to get good grades, just prepare for the  practice exam he gave you before class.

I don't understand all this hate. Im not a math guru by any means, and I found his class pretty basic. He posts review tests with answers before the exams that are very similar to the actual tests. You also get a note card to write whatever u want on and bring into the test. Very helpful at office hours. If you really want an A you can get it
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He does not take the time to get to know his students, and he does not really care if you show up to class or not. His classes are awkward and feel like they last forever. He gives two midterms and a final, and weekly take home quizzes, which are actually hard. However, he allows you to use an index card with notes on it for tests which is helpful.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: While a fairly nice man with a love for math, his methods of helping prepare students for his overly difficult exams are very poor. All other sections of Statstics are open note short exams, but his require hours of studying just to get a solid B on an exam. Avoid his class if possible.
Run as fast as you can towards the exit. WORST professor ever!

Despite his reviews I would really recommend taking him for calc I. He is an extremely fair grader when it comes to exams which aren't hard at all. As long as you do the homework and understand it and actually read the textbook (it's essential because he doesn't cover topics in too much depth in class) then the exams are easy and you'll get an A.

Wasn't doing so well in the class the beginning of the semester but I started paying more attention, taking more notes and went to office hours.
