He noticed that I put more effort into the class and it paid off. I jumped from a D to an A from the first to the second midterm and I ended the class with a good grade

Quote "if you know it [calc material] by December, I don't care if you didn't know it in October". He said this in class. If you do much better on the final, he makes it worth 60% of your grade. Also, he got us refunds for webassign for its glitches and gave extra credit to whoever still did the online homework. He cares about his students.

He fails to explain anything clearly and his midterm was nothing like the practice exam. Nearly half the class failed his midterm, according to him. His scale is 96-100 = A-. DO NOT TAKE HIM! I had to drop out to save my GPA.

I had Morrison for Math for Business: Finite and he's not as awful as these ratings. His problem sets are extremely beneficial and will help you ace his exams. His lectures aren't the best but stop by his office hours and you'll be fine. His class consist of two midterms and a final project.

Prof Morrison isn't a terrible teacher. He really wants his students to succeed so he gives them a lot of options to bring up their grades. The homeworks are hard but as long as you do them, you'll be fine. You won't fail as long as you do all the homework and study for the midterms and final. He also tells you exactly what he is putting on tests.
You should probably not even bother applying to Fordham simply because there is a chance that you can have Morrison as a professor.

Possibly one of the worst professors ever. Honestly, I have no clue what goes on in recitation (thank God I don't have him for regular class) and that's probably because I am ready to fall asleep from how boring he is.. And what I do pay attention to makes absolutely zero sense. No one even shows up anymore. Do not take him if you can avoid it.
This man should be avoided at all costs. He will ruin your GPA and life and you will regret not dropping the class.

This is the worst class at Fordham. I got an A in calculus in high school and taking his calculus as a freshman I had to withdraw because it was so hard. Everyone I know in that class either struggles or withdraws. If you literally have any other option I would take it because unless you are a super genius, you will not do well in this class.
You will have no idea what is going on in his class. Avoid if possible.

I urge anyone with a choice to bypass taking Prof. Morrison's calculus class. He is nearly incomprehensible, and has led me to very nearly resent a subject I adored in high school. I never thought I would have a teacher that would actually do more harm than help, but I feel confident in saying that I would do better in this class by skipping it!

It's understandable thay he has such low ratings. He's smart to death and too smart as a professor. I hated him in the first half of the semester that he made me an idiot. But it  turns out that I love him. You can't imagine what's in this man's brain. English adjectives can't be used to describe him! Take him if you like math!!!

I had him for finiate and he was absolutely horrid. I would go to his office hours and he was hardly ever there or completely rude whenever I asked a question. DO NOT TAKE unless you want to be miserable all semester. I recieved a B in his class by some miracle

avoid ian morrison at all costs. this man is the most pompous, unhelpful professor at fordham. he makes you feel stupid for asking questions, and just expects you to understand his absurd concepts. i had an A average in math in highschool, and i'll be lucky to pass this course. ian morrison is the spawn of satan.
This is possibly the hardest class I ever took. Every time I went to class I died a little on the inside.

I was a straight A student in highschool. I received 2 A's and 2 B's on my midsemester grades. I received my ONLY C from none other then Ian Morrison. If you ask a question, he makes you feel like an idiot. If you try to read ahead of time or do the problems he gives you it just confuses you more. I had to teach myself everything.

He makes learning easy math really difficult. I knew most everything he was teaching, and I still got confused. Be prepared to teach yourself. The times I've been to office hours with him, he basically ripped me apart and was extremely disrespectful. Take another math class. If you choose to stick with him, buy the finite textbook from the store.
Very qualified and knowledgeable, and adequately accessible for help outside of the classroom. Expects much of students, but is still very fair.

First I thought he was a horrible professor. I soon realized he just expected the students to come to class having tried to understand the material before hand. And if  that didn't work he was willing to help out.Going to his class not having read the material is what made him a poor professor, which was my fault. I learned more and better his way.

Even thoughI had to self teach much of the material in the end he was an excellent professor.  I realized that I HAD to read the chapter and do the problems before class.  His teaching style forced me to be a better student and helped me learn and love calculus.  I think he's great.

Rambles; is very unclear.  Weekly homework assignments end up being more difficult than they should be because his teaching style is so scattered.  Textbook will not help as he invents his own style that does not work with the book.  Not a professor for someone who has difficulty with math.  Is unhelpful and lacks compassion and enthusiasm in and o
Terrible teacher.. I did advanced calc my senior year 90 for the year and I couldnt understand this simple subject turned impossible by this guy..DONT TAKE HIM ..

He is a great professor, yes I'll admit I taught myself a lot of material but he gives you a take home quiz every week all you have to do is go to the math help center and they make sure every one of your answers is correct. He was always VERY nice to me, he just doesn't like slackers. So, if you're hard working this class should be a breeze.

You must teach yourself everything; I have to study out of my highschool notebook. If I hadn't already learned what he was teaching, I'd be completely lost. Recitation is imperative to get it. He does not explain anything. However, he does run into things occasionally which makes the class humouous. If you have to take calculus, find someone else.

Condescending, rude, not helpful outside or inside the classroom, has TWO midterms, the second of which appears to be approachable, but when you actually take the test it contains impossible and completely off-the-wall questions. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. He does not know how to teach. If you like paying tution to teach yourself, go right ahead.

He teaches way too fast and stands right in front of what he is writing so it is nearly impossible to follow him. Seems to be somewhat nice person but definetely needs to slow down and explain things more clearly.

Dr. Morrison is quite helpful, easy to approach outside of class, and assigns a relatively light workload. However, his lectures often include long digressions, and he can sometimes be difficult to understand. He grades very fairly, though, and appears quite dedicated to his teaching.

Yeah basically you have to teach yourself. If you are not a math person, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. When you go to see him during office hours he basically tells you that you are dumb. He rambles on during class and you want to stab yourself with your pencil. don't take him
doesn't give a lot of work, but you have to teach yourself. If you can teach yourself from his notes you'll be fine, if not you will be lost
I had him as a freshman 3 years ago and still have nightmares about it.. DO NOT TAKE HIM

Every day after class I had to go get a huge coffee to wake myself up. Not only does he digress from math for twenty minutes at a time, but he thinks everyone enjoys his jokes. He made me dread mondays and thursdays.. do NOT take him !!!!
if you look at him at a certain angle in a certain light he sometimes slightly resembles sean connery... i think i might be the only one to see this, but hey, i guess i'm weird like that

He def. loves math, but he just doesnt get that no one else does. If you wanna pass the quizzes so math help, or just teach yourself because hes really bad in explaining the material. I tooks this class the year before in high school, and i understood it. Now in finite, im compleletly lost.

the dumb*ss that gave morrisson all 5's and shared his 'love' for math, was probably morrisson giving himself a review so he can make people suffer. put it to you this way, i took his class last year, and STILL feel compelled to give him a bad review. stay FAR FAR away!!!!!

I went in for help during his office hours and he almost made me cry. He doesn't know anyones name, he doesn't take attendance, he doesn't really care if you do the work. PLEASE do not make the mistake I did in taking his class. It is by far the worst class ever and he is the worst teacher ever!
Loved the course, good prof. too. pity more didn't share the mans love for math. TAKE THIS COURSE, its good!
hard class but i suck at math anyway. hes a good guy, seems like he doesnt care but he actually does. nto my first choice but not awful either. doesnt take attendence, dont buy the book and your set.

I don't even know where to start.  Worst class ever. Worst teacher ever. REQUIRED for all math majors. First day it was a full house but after a week there were three idiots who couldn't figure out how to get around the requirement... I was one of them. I almost jumped out of my dorm room window.
morrison will destroy your gpa. Einstein couldnt understand the**** that comes out of her lectures. Makes no sense at all. example of why tenure is a very bad idea.

Morrison does not explain the material clearly.  Everything is taught in the hardest and most complex way, and he gives the class quizes on material not yet covered. If you take this class you pretty much have to teach yourself. Spare yourself the trouble, take another class!
Stephen Hawking dropped the course.
WORST TEACHER EVER!!! HE SUCKS. DESERVES TO BE FIRED ASAP
he brings the material to a higher level.  his tests arent extremely bad and he gives you a curve.  hes condescending towards students, but really not a bad guy.  take him for a challenge.
i would drop out of college before i had to have this man as a professor again

The math isn't that hard, but he explains it horribly. Goes too far in depth with things we don't need to know. Text book is useless, mostly uses online source. And if he said 'again' again i was gonna stab him. Sooo Canadian.
No Comments

Morrison is out of control! He loves math, but only HE loves HIS type of math. We bought a very expensive textbook (110$) for only two chapters, and printed out HIS "Math for Life" textbook from a .pdf file online (88 pages). He enjoys belittlin

The most boring class, he makes everything far more complicated than necessary and teaches half the semester using a book he wrote. Same stuff is in the other book and it makes more sense. It requires work, but not terrible if you've taken stats before.
actually you cant get excited over anything in this class except maybe staying as far away as possible. he is awful, cannot teach. and almost everyone who takes him drops or fails. your choice.
Incredibly boring.  Clearly loves math, but isn't a very good teacher.  Shows you everything you don't need to know and not enough of what you do.  Text is horrid!  Doesn't take attendance.

This class isn't too bad. The man hands you the midterm and final on a silver platter. Weekly quizzes are easy. Just come to class and try not to fall asleep. He knows what he's talking about, but really..how excited can you get about compound interest&#6

He is smart, but does not know how to deal properly with people. Doesn't get to know students or help them, he belittles them. Quote:"You need a reasonable amount of intelligence to answer this, so anyone who needs extra credit, won't be able to answ
morrison is the anti-christ. Worst teacher in the history of man. He couldnt teach if his life depanded on it.

Weekly take home quizes are easy, and he posts exact replicas of the midterms on blackboard. However, he is the most belittling, intimidating man I have ever met. He is far from friendly, and if you go in for help, bring tissues, cause you'll cry.

By far the worst professor I have ever had at Fordham and elsewhere.  Public and private humiliation and a 12% on the final..save yourself, take computer science.

He speeds through everything and seems unaware that there are students trying to learn.  He seems to assume that we are all as smart as he is.  Do not ever go for extra help, he makes you feel like an idiot!!!  Not a nice man, Do not take class.
WORST CLASS EVER!!! This man is the devil... he hates people and should be fired ASAP

Hes nice but he moves too fast and doesnt review over the problems as he should.  He knows what hes doing but doesnt know how to teach it. First midterm was kind of easy, not looking foward to second one though.

dvisable to see him for extra help, its better to go to the Math room. (unless you want to feel belittled and intimidated). Weekly assignments and a few tests, relatively easy for those competent in math. If nothing else, he's very attractive
fire this jerk

absolutely terrible - moves way too fast, oblivious to his students. had to drop his class after he made me take the midterm (i finished it in 2 minutes and handed in a blank paper!) AVOID HIM.

world's worst teacher. no joke, he is awful and goes out of his way to make your existence miserbale. his class is horrable, i wouldnt take him for a million bucks.
He is very organized so you know where the class is going, notes are very clear and extremely helpful if you take them. I would definitely recommend him.
the worst teacher i have ever had. arrogant, pompous, avoid at all costs
Absolutely terrible... he is unwilling to help students. No amount of money could convince me to take a class with him again!
He is terrible, fire him!!

I don't know what's wrong with you people. Did you even try to read or did you just expect to be spoonfed?  Finite math is nothing compared to linear algebra 2, and he was excellent in that class. He was both clear and challenging.
Terrible teacher, one of the worst I have ever had!
HE SUCKS

BY FAR THE WORST TEACHER I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!! HE IS HORRABLE. TAKING HIS CLASS WILL BE THE BIGGEST MISTAKE OF YOUR LIFE. HE IS DUMB, UNCLEAR AND CANNOT TEACH. ALSO HE IS A HORRABLE GRADER AND EXTREMELY BORING AND STUPID IN HIS COMMENTS.

Szu-Pei Fu is a very straightforward and helpful teacher. His homework and quizzes are easy and directly from the material given. The exams are essentially the same as the study guide with different numbers. He is very helpful if you need him, but his lectures pretty much cover everything you would need. I would highly recommend him for anyone.
Show up to all the lectures and take notes. He'll answer any question you ask him and he's very nice. Quizzes and tests are easy if you can do the homework.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I had him for calc 2 and now multivariable and he just rocks. He gives weekly homeworks which are graded for accuracy but then there's bi-weekly quizzes that are all extra credit which count ontop ofhomework. He basically gives you the exact problems for quizzes and tests so you can study it he just changes the numbers. He is super kind and caring.
He is super good professor. very caring students. You would never regret if you take his class. Try!
SUPER NICE! take home everything! gives hw with answers at the end of the book.
Fantastic! Such a sweet guy who's willing to help you not matter what it takes. He's super understanding and gets it when you don't get it and helps you bridge the gap of understanding

This Professor means well- but he does not know how to teach. Unless you are a math major with a very clear past experience with calculus, you will struggle in his class. He doesn't explain anything clearly and when you go for extra help, his explanations barely make a difference. Do not recommend unless you've already aced the subject once.

She is a nice teacher, but do not take this class if you just need an EP and have no interest in film. Expects students who aren't necessarily film students to know alot about the history of film. There is also a lot of homework and it takes more than 4 hours outside of class to complete work. Don't take if you don't care about film and need EP.

I believe Professor Reich's honesty is often mistaken for rudeness. She has been very accommodating during online learning, and if a student is behind she is more than understanding. The homework is definitely doable. Just do the readings, watch the films, and participate occasionally and you'll do fine. Be prepared to put effort into papers.

I went to her for guidance on how to manage my double-major and she was nothing but rude and unprofessional towards me. Her only advice to me was to drop down to a DTEM minor instead of major. Very unapproachable and condescending.

Poor communication skills. I have to remind her several times about things, and when she does get to them her responses are nonchalant -- as if she doesn't care. Would absolutely avoid. 0/10 do not take!!!

I took this class thinking it would be a fun elective, but Prof. Reich nearly failed everyone on the midterm after giving no guidance as to what would be on it. Shes a hard professor and doesn't respond to emails and isn't very approachable Not an easy A whatsoever, and you watch lots of boring silent b&w films and have to memorize dates.

Provides no guidance on what to expect on exams- our entire class failed/nearly failed the midterm & she did not curve.  Went to office hours for help on paper and even tho I emailed her before, she was unprepared and told me to leave.  She expects too much from her students but does not reciprocate with help or time.  Thought Film would be fun.

Professor Buzick is extremely knowledgeable in his field and can talk for hours about Greek History. It is clear to see that he is passionate about what he is teaching, which makes the long lectures engaging and interesting. He is very helpful outside of the class. HIGHLY recommend going to office hours! He is amazing! Definitely take him!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Taken during the pandemic in an online format. Interesting lectures. Some readings from the textbook are long but always manageable. Big research paper at the end of the semester that requires a lot of dedication and time but topic can be anything. Overall I really enjoyed this class, the topic, and really liked the professor.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: what a great professor! i took him for ancient greek history. really funny and nice guy. extremely knowledgeable of the subject. grades fairly and gives study guides. not hard to do well if you study and put the effort into the class. definitely recommend him!

Buzick is a great person but awful lectures. He does try to make class interactive and is realistic whereas if he only has a few things to say or you have work due soon he lets you out after 10 minutes to giveyou more time. To really appreciate him you have to attend office hours - big research paper, unlike any I've written before -def challenging
Great teacher, Great Class.
Good professor who doesn't put too much pressure on students but still teaches an interesting class. Easy grader; easy to relate to; nice guy. Good class.
My favorite prof. this semester! An absolute doll, so funny! His comments on the papers are extremely helpful.

The chillest professor ever.  Quizzes were a bit difficult but he gave an assignment at the end of the semester that could make up for your grades on them.  Let us out of class early most of the time. Made the material interesting, funny and relatable which is sometimes difficult to do with greek classics. Would definitely recommend him!!!
His class is awesome. Quizzes on identifying characters, two papers, participation, and a final each 20%. Definitely the class to take for sophomore English.

Most boring class Ive ever taken. Long lectures made of nonsensical preachy rants. You cannot have a different opinion than him or prepare yourself for a bad grade. On top of this when people ask for clarifications or have questions he is dismissive and rude, ESPECIALLY per email.

Dr. Pickett is a nice guy, but his insanely long lectures made me bored every class. The readings are extremely long, and your grade is based on a couple of papers, panel discussions, and weekly responses. As long as you say a few words every other class, you are good for participation. The class is light, but it could be annoying at times.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: While he seems like a nice guy, this is the worst class I've taken. Ever. If my life depended on it, I could not tell you one thing that has happened in class. He just rants the whole time. The readings are insanely long, and will make you want to take a W. Forces you to present. Avoid unless you like theology or poor life decisions.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Pickett talks a ton, and your grade is dependent on online posts where you reflect on the readings, a midterm paper, and 2 group presentations you do during the semester. Although the readings are long, you can almost always get away with looking up a summary, and saying a few lines in class. Overall not work heavy, and very inspirational guy

Professor Pickett gives lectures every class, even though he says the class is discussion (in the form of 'panels') based. The panels are a pain to do. You have to work with 2 other students and essentially plan to teach the class on a reading. Very ineffective way to learn. Also final was a 10 page paper (not fun). Do not take his class.

Be prepared for really redundant, mundane classes. Every class structure is the same: you prepare a reading, professor lectures for 25 minutes, then students from the class present on the reading. However, he is quite inspiring and really insightful when it comes to theology, specifically Black Christianity in America.

Yikes. He makes students present during each class on rather large readings, which are often hurried by his tendency to indulge in long, preachy (oh, boy) lectures . If you want the grade you basically just have to just regurgitate whatever he rants about in class on your papers and hw. Vocalizing different thoughts and opinions is not encouraged.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: honestly choose him only if you really really like reading. he's really interactive but the readings get too much especially due to the fact that we have 4 other courses as well.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: At first I thought professor Pickett seemed nice... and then the class actually started and he just went on rants the whole time and didn't seem like he had a point. I fell asleep EVERY class. The class was lead of students which was kind of nice and each class they would teach the class about that nights reading. The readings were very long.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof Ellman is not the toughest grader, her class is pretty manageable. However, since it was online, she gave a lot of work (perusall annotations, discussion boards, reflection every other week, 2 major essays) She requires students to speak up in class and calls you out when you don't (can be anxiety-inducing for some). Avoid her class if you can
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I personally enjoyed taking her class, which was a surprise to me. There's definitely reading to be done and it can sometimes be a bit of a pain but her class was immensely rewarding. We discussed topics relevant to the current world and she respects everyone's views equally. Showing some effort will go a long way this class
so many readings.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Although her rating does not look great, she is a good professor for THOSE WHO WANT TO WORK FOR THEIR GRADE.   Personally, I thought she was a tough paper grader and I struggled. But, she allowed me to rewrite the papers and she worked with me to get my papers to an A level.   Her final is easy as long as you know the main idea of each author.

Avoid at all costs. If she does not like your style of writing, you will not get higher than a B on your papers. She expects you to participate a ridiculous amount of the time if you want an A because participation is like 20%. The only reason I got an A- is because I studied my ass off for the final and got a perfect score which raised my grade.

Rabbi Ellman is one of the most interesting people you will meet. She's a TOUGH grader, but honestly--it's fair. She offers rewrites. PLUS you can send in drafts and she'll review/help you get a better grade. She's the coolest person--brought up feminist perspectives, racial justice, and transgender readings. Be ready to work, but TAKE HER.

Terrible. Do not take. She is nice and rather intelligent, but her class is difficult for no reason (She gave me a "C" on my writing even though I get all A's in my english class). If you don't write your papers according to her own thoughts and beliefs, you will not get a good grade. Also, participation matters...a lot.

Expectations for the class are not clear and participation and papers never seem good enough. You write 3 papers worth 60% of your grade all semester and have a few readings and a discussion board for every class. Not too much homework. She's nice enough & classes are all discussion style but your grade will NEVER be above a B.

Ellman said that if you are doing everything right (participating, coming prepared, doing the homework) then you will get a B-, which seems low to me for doing everything right.  She also doesn't thoroughly explain the context for readings which ends up being confusing. Wouldn't recommend.

This class was tough. It required  hard work on papers and little feedback from Professor Ellman, but a lot of reading outside of class and quite a bit of preparations for quizzes, but once it came to the final exam I was completely prepared. Intense partipation is the only way you will get an A because she expects a lot.

Honestly a really good professor.  Very fair and gave enough extra credit opportunities to have anyone who really put in the effort to get an A.  Also she provided every question on the final many months ahead of time.

Be prepared to have work due every class, even if its just participating in the online discussion board. There is a great deal of reading. However, I found her an easy grader and you are given the questions for the final exam in advance. It is not hard to do well in this class at all.
She seems very nice and her lectures can be interesting but I don't think I would recommend her. She is a hard grader and she doesn't make it clear what she expects from you.

Jonathan was a super laid back and funny professor. His expectations were clearly outlined in the syllabus and he was great with communication. He allows rewrites for all major essays, so you can get a good grade as long as you are willing to put in work. His feedback is sometimes harsh but always helpful, and he gave a very manageable workload.

Prof. Shapiro was amazing. He truly does care about his students and he takes time to get to know you and ask how you are every class. There are a good amount of writings and essays, but he is overall a chill grader as long as he sees you tried. Recommended that u do the readings, but u can get away with not doing them. no tests, final or quizzes

Read the below comment. It is very accurate. The professor can be a good mentor/friend; if you need him, he'll be there. No pop quiz, just class discussions about thoughts on the reading (simple even if you didn't read be careful tho). Then group class work. Super chill atmosphere. He loves knowing his students so be ready to talk about YOURSELF

Shapiro is the best prof ever. Had him for comp 2 first semester of freshman year. The man is so funny, he constantly cracks jokes throughout class. Super easy going and caring. No midterm or final. 4 papers (4 pages) and 2 writing practices (2 pages). Let's you revise each paper. Homework is just reading stories and no tests or quizzes.

Professor Shapiro recognizes hard work and he rewards you for it. He allowed up to 2 revisions on essays and I brought my grade up from an A- to an A. He's also really funny and he lifts up the mood really naturally in class. Not an easy A, but its definitely possible if you work hard and listen to his feedback.

Professor Shapiro genuinely cares about your progress in class and cares about his students becoming better writers. There are 4 page essays assigned and 2 page PRs assigned but all are allowed to be rewritten and revised once returned. He is funny and laid back but very helpful in making you understand coursework. Definitely take him for T&C

Jonathon Shapiro is a great professor and great guy. He assigns lot of essays, but allowed for rewrites on every one for boosted grades. Super laid back guy--very approachable and easy to talk to. Weekly reading is short stories and articles, with essays based on analysis on class-based discussions. I highly recommend Shapiro for Composition II. :)
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Shapiro is an amazing professor and he genuinely cares about his students. The class is structured and very helpful in developing writing skills! GO TO OFFICE HOURS! He will read your essay in advance and you can make changes to improve your grade. Try in the class and you will do well!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Took him for the second time for English Comp II. His class is very chill. There is a decent amount of reading and writing, but it never feels overwhelming. We read several books, had to write four 4-5 page essays, and five 2 page essays. Like everyone else said, you can rewrite papers which is great, but he's also really nice and funny in class.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Really cool and fun professor. He is a pretty tough reader, but as long as you put a reasonable amount of time and follow his feedback you can easily do well in the class. Great professor and if you pay attention and do all the work you'll end up becoming a much better writer!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Shapiro doesn't care about grades - all he wants to do is make his students better writers. He lets you revise all essays and gives great feedback. As someone who doesn't consider himself to be a good writer or someone who likes writing at all, I loved this class. If you listen to his comments and revise your papers you can easily get an A.

Shapiro is the best professor at Fordham. He really cares about his students and gives great feedback on essays (which there are a lot of). Although he is a really tough grader, he lets you revise your papers as many times as you want. English is not my strong suit but Shapiro made the class really enjoyable. 10/10 would take again.
Loved this class. He lets you revise papers and he'll bump up your grade, but it actually helps you become a better writer.

I would definitely recommend taking Shapiro. He is a bit of a tough grader but he lets you rewrite papers as many times as you want for full credit. I rewrote a paper that was originally a 78 and got it up to a 94. Also a really great guy and he has a good class system.
The professor is nice and funny at first and the assignments do not seem hard, however he is one of the toughest graders which makes it hard to do well in his class, do not take.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This is a pretty straight-forward class, weekly homework problems from the textbook with a few short assignments throughout the semester. The midterm and final are both worth 30% each, and class time is lecture heavy. Prof Bruck is a good lecturer but to be fair, the material isn't super intriguing - he definitely does the best he can!

Professor DeSantis is actually one of my favorite professors. I am not really a philosophy person and this class was a requirement, but it ended up being one of my favorite classes. He is always available outside of class and he gives good feedback on the essays you turn in. Overall, discussions during class and content is explained thoroughly.

There are 3 papers and no tests. Watch his lectures because they will help you do well on the papers. He answers emails quickly and will do zooms on the day your paper is due if you need help. Homework usually consists of 3 questions. He won't force anyone to answer questions in class.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: First English class at Fordham and I'm glad I had it with the Deebs. The comments he left on my papers always helped me improve. It's a writing heavy course with flexible deadlines, we had about 5 essays, a diagnostic, a midterm, and a research paper. The class was always engaging and entertaining, Debra made us laugh and made learning fun.
Was a very fun class, engaged teacher and, fought for the class to be interested in the subject. I ditched class one day and I'm still kicking myself for it 9 months later. Amazing teacher.

Debra is a great professor! I took him for Comp II and it was pretty easy. Five shorter papers, a midterm essay, and a final research paper. He rarely assigns homework besides the essays and understands that his class isn't your only class. Attendance matters, but class is not brutal.

Debra is my favorite professor hands down. He makes classes fun and gives more than enough time for due dates. You can tell he's extremely passionate about his subject and wants his students to learn the material. Definitely a writing intensive course though.
Amazing professor. Actually cares about his students and is passionate about the material. Encourages participation and makes the classroom a comfortable place. Not a hard grader either. Take him!
Professor Gowans means well but his lectures drone on for the entire class time and he is very rigid with students' answers. He is a tough grader and takes points off for the smallest things.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Gowans is an amazing professor. There are 3 papers, a presentation, and a cumulative final exam. Prof. Gowans gives really good feedback for the papers and allows you to hand in a second draft to replace the grade of the first draft. He is really helpful and his class is overall very easy. I would take him again if I could!

I loved Professor Gowans! Hes very passionate about philosophy. He cares about the success of his students. His essay feedback is very clear, which is essential for an EP1 class. I would definitely take his class again!

I LOVE Prof. Gowans. He's hilarious and makes the dry material interesting with his personal anecdotes. He is a tough grader but gives helpful feedback and is willing to help you with your papers during office hours. I took him for my EP1 and he helped guide us through understanding what was expected of us. 3 papers and 2 tests total.

Gowans is great, 2nd class w/ him, 1st was happiness & WB. Lectures are drier in this one, but prob bc material isn't as exciting. lots of readings & loves participation but show effort in papers/class & u will do fine. not too tough grader if u put in decent effort. 1 paper, 1 pres, TH midterm, advanced notice essay final, weekly reflections.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Take his happiness and well-being course if you have any sort of open-mindedness to you or want to make some meaning of your life. The variety of theories we studied was great and I am indebted to him for opening the door to a world of self-cultivation philosophies that I have been personally incorporating into my own life. Don't sleep on this one!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Gowans is a good teacher, but his lectures tend to be very dry and uninteresting. Some examples he gives don't make sense. Only gives two papers throughout the semester, so you have to hope they're good to do well in this class. Overall, not the greatest class, but not the worst. As a person, he's accessible and helpful to talk to.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: really enjoying his Happiness & Well-Being course. nice guy, if you don't mind powerpoint and discussion classes, pretty easy. Asian philosophies are his passion, so always good classes from him. haven't done my final paper or exam yet, but he hasn't graded other small written stuff harshly. readings are average length. interesting stuff!

Teaching style for an ethics class is from powerpoint. Not very ethical. Makes you memorize terms and material for midterm. Papers are mostly open ended which is a plus but is a tough grader----its a hit or miss with them. Need to do 10 "journals online", 3 papers, midterm and final.

Gowans is an extremely kind prof. Not the most exciting lecturer though... I'd recommend taking his Buddhism or Asian phil classes, as those are his specialty. Really nice and helpful in office hours. Fair grader. Not too many assignments. If you're a philosophy major, it's nothing new in terms of class expectations.

2 tests and 2 papers. the papers are relatively easy but the tests are very difficult. even if you answer everything correctly he will find something wrong with it. he uses powerpoints and posts class precies which are helpful for understanding the philosophers

Discourages note-taking because he hides his incompetence behind powerpoint presentations.  Doesnt include heavier philosophical works in the course because "those are harder and im not qualified to teach them".  Its easy to get a good grade once you figure out what he wants (crystal-clear writing i.e. who what when where why how) but why suffer?
His lectures can be very boring but his blackboard notes are detailed so that helps since his book can be confusing.  He only gives two papers, a midterm and a final.

Some of his lectures may be boring, but he is very clear, and his presentations are very note-taking friendly. He makes you earn your grade, but it's still totally possible to do well, you just have to put in the work.
Lectures are boring, notes are useless.  Makes you read his own book. (Which is poorly written and convoluted)  Accuses you of plagiarism if you don't cite properly.

2 papers, midterm, and final.  2 of the 4 books you read are his books, that should be your first red flag. Extremely boring to listen to, takes attendence every class and gives pop quizzes if nobody reads. We didn't do much ethics (despite the name of the class) we read his Buddha books instead. Also he whistles any S at the end of a word.

o m g....he is horrible. beware, very boring, TOUGH grader, has favorites, makes you take ridiculous quizzes at 830 in the morning because no one reads, well if we read interesting things then we would read. PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!!! he DESTROYED my gpa and i did ALL the work and met with him 4 times.
his class was the most boring class i have ever been a part of! his tests were very difficult and he grades very unfairly! beware...

you dont need to do the reading, but dont think that this means he is easy.  I studied 15 hrs for the midterm and got a B, and hoping for the same on the final.  He covers very random topics, very vaguely so it is a struggle to make sense of.  Its a challenge of a class for a darn core but definately doable. 2 papers, midterm, final, study hard!

When a professor makes you read not 1 but 2 of his books you know theres trouble.  Very hard grader and unclear in class.  Understands is a Core class and nobody wants to be there but tries to keep your attention.  Midterm Final and 2 papers.  Better than some other professors
Hes not Jay Leno, but he knows his stuff and gives clear answer.

Same old, typical reviews. Gowans is an extremely smart guy, but no one knows because no one wants to. Memorization...because you want to just barely get by. If you care about philosophy, you'll talk to him and learn what it means to think. Read his book on ethics, too, you lazy people. Go beyond what is required...if you think you're in preschool.
Nice guy. All you need is his notes. You don't really need the reading but his lectures are usually dry...once in a while a joke will pop up but still....5 minutes seemed like an hour
"He died so he is no longer alive." - Prof. Gowans  If you want to sit through lectures like that, take this class, but I recommend you save yourself the agony.

One of those guys I think I would really like if he wasn't a professor. Nice enough, but so boring you want to die. He also treats you as if you are in preschool and is married to his seating chart. Easy because all you have to do is memorize the notes, dont bother to read. Or think.  he doesnt wan thiking he just wants mindless memorization

This guys is like a dead man teaching. Every day in his class I struggled not to snore, because I slept every class. His method of teaching is so borring and he explains a comcept that would normally take a minutes to explain for literally half hour!! Booooring!!! Tests are a bit unfair, coz he makes us reherse eight essay and he chooses one of 'em

Gowans is a nice guy even though he is cut-and-dry. Lectures are to the point, 2 papers are somewhat interesting, and the midterm and final consist of memorizing his notes. Not the most captivating professor, but not the most difficult/undesirable professor either.
spells everything out step by step so it's almost impossible to get confused - however, boooooring. nice guy tho, i liked him.

If you were having a contest between a rock and Gowans to see who is more lively, the rock would win, hands down. He is so boring!! He gets chalk on himself all the time, which suggests a lack of motor skills. Notes are very easy to follow, mid-term was easy and 2 papers (4-5 and 6-8) were not too bad. Find a different professor if you can!!!

all notes are on powerpoint, so if you miss class you'll get the notes, 2 papers midterm and final, if you go see him you'll do great on the papers, midterm and final are easy if you go over his study notes...gives you review handouts with everything that will be on the tests...but clas can get boring quickly
buddhism section was interesting. his midterm was rough though. was too demanding for a 50 min. period and wanted too many specifics.
Good guy, two papers, two exams. The class does get kind of boring after a while.
Good guy, but hard grader -- but does make difficult subjects easy

he's a tough grader and the classes are boring, but you do learn alot about philosophy.  he uses powerpoint every single class, which gets old quick; and i didn't like the fact that he used two of his own books.  topics are interesting, however, and his papers aren't too tough.

not a bad professor, but is a very difficult grader, unless youve memorized the notes on the overhead you wont survive, on the up note, the classs notes are on blackboard, you dont have to go to class really
Horrible grader
Very hard teacher and very demanding -- his tests are extremely difficult. He's really smart though and has good lessons, but it's a harder class than it should be

Stay clear! He doesn't even know his own material. Papers are graded on irrelevant factors. uses overhead, good, but once u ask a question he labels you. Definately has favorites. Tests are super hard.

This man is very confusing. When i had him for philosophical ethics we had to read a book written by him and every time he asked us what we thought the message he was trying to convey was, he politely told us we were very wrong.take his class if you like to be told you are wrong a lot.
Not all that hard.  Spells out exactly what u need.  2 papers, 2 exams.  can never stand still!  overall, a decent guy.  I did pretty well in the class, for a subject that i hated.
he's a sweet man who engages ppl in conversation, can't say many other teachers do it as well as he does... besides my mother always told me: only boring people get bored.

He's a really nice guy. Tests are laid out exactly as he says in his layout. Journal entries can be tedious, but will help you understand the material better. Most texts are interesting, and he always explains them well in his powerpoints.

This is one funny little man. He makes the weirdest jokes and laughs to himself, it is really pretty entertaining. Class is pretty boring, but tests are right from the notes, which can be easily printed from blackboard, leaving lots of time for daydreamin

Forget his tone, forget his voice, forget this and that nonsense. Gowans is a brilliant man; his knowledge of philosophy is tremendous; his classes are well-structured; explanations are lucid; assignments are thoughtful. Human nature is now comprehensible
Professor Gowans is a little boring at times, but you know what to expect every day...if you take good notes and keep up with the readings, you'll be okay....interesting class, too.

you have to buy his book and answer questions on it... that part i did not like... giving your journal in... did not like... found out he answers almost all the questions for the journal eventually... LIKED! Midterm was easy, essay was graded fairly...

Such an easy class. Boring, but gives exact notes from powerpoint, and the midterm was a replica of the notes. Gives 2 big papers, very easy. Has a weird sense of humor, not thrilling but an okay class. I liked him.
Very Boring...killed, murdered, massacred my interest in philosophy. Nice man though.

The class was boring. I could never stay awake during his class. He is a very nice man, however, the class is boring and so are the readings. The contemporary ethics readings were good. That made the class interesting. Tests were horrible. I hated them.
This man gives new meaning to the word BORING...He is a human tranquilizer and kinda looks like the boss from Office Space...In all seriousness though, his class is not worth the effort!
The most boring class ever. It's hard tokeep awake.  His lectures are not all of what he puts on the board.  You need to take really thorough notes. I would not reccomend taking him
No Comments

he was such a sweet man.  i enjoyed his class alot.  he gave us great notes on the readings.  i understood philosophy alot better than before.  he is geniunely interested in the students and what they think.
VERY HELPFUL AND VERY CLEAR IN THE LECTURES.
No Comments
No Comments
thought i was doing really well in the class, and performed well on tests and papers but came up with an insane grading policy in the end.
Quiet, methodical, but learned
smart man, boring class... but papers are broad and fair.  tests he grades harder than you'd think.
makes you read books he wrote. amazingly boring with a voice like a seditive.
He does this funny little dance; it's the only entertaining moment of his class.
No Comments
Solid Course
She is the best professor at Fordham!!! Take her if you get the chance, you won't regret it!!!

Jones is an overall fantastic professor and amazing person. She really cares about her students and wants everyone to do well while also making sure class is engaging and entertaining. Lets you rewrite papers for a better grade, but is not a hard grader to begin with. Class discussions are fun and homework is simple, couldn't ask for a better prof

Prof Jones it the BEST professor at Fordham. She genuinely cares about her students and perfectly explains lectures. Every lecture was interesting and there were many different factors that tied into our grades (not just papers: which btw weren't even long and she also gives the option to send her your draft) Put in the effort and you'll have fun!

I'm taking a pass/fail course with her but I just wanted to bolster up her already high Ratemyprofessor score since Prof Jones is amazing!!! Highly respected, caring, and intelligent, Prof. Jones is one of the only philosophy professors I trust. Easy to talk to, and easy to do well in her classes. Take her!!!

Jude Jones is a blessing. Harry Potter and Philosophy is a coveted class for a reason. Though sometimes she takes a while to hand back essays, she always writes notes and gives good feedback. This class is split into houses that compete for points, just like at Hogwarts. Her office is covered in Harry Potter memorabilia--definitely worth visiting.
ratingTags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Jones is amazing! You read three books in the class, but you really go into each of them. There were only two papers (the second one was cancelled), but the first one was interesting and the second one was 10+ pages on your own topic. Lectures can be a little dry, but she explains material very well. Would absolutely take her again!
Gives extremely detailed feedback on papers and is very welcoming to students.  The material is tough, but she knows what she's doing and she's there to help you get through it.

Prof. Jones is a kinda, personable, friendly, and brilliant professor and human being, and she finds incredible new ways of approaching HP.  The class was disorganized, assignments were handed back far too late, and the class often felt too novel-focused or too philosophical to the point it wasn't very applicable to HP.  Class was fun and easy.
Awesomely funny, lets the class discussions go where they will. Very manageable workload. Take her!!
I had to check this page many times and reread the reviews to make sure I registered for the right teacher. Highly Disappointed

holy crap.she expected way too much from a core class. she does not know that students have other classes to take as well. she assigns 3 pages essays on boring topics and takes about 3 weeks to grade it. its funny how she was able to read our 8 page final essay and grade our final exam in 3 days. Avoid at all cost. Don't let previous rating fool yo

My expectations going in to this class were high seeing as she had really positive ratings on here. Unfortunately, she has not lived up to them. She is a nice lady but not as good as people have rated her. She also has given us to much work for the final including a 8 page paper and a useless review sheet. Buyer beware.

She is a really nice lady and you can tell she knows her stuff. She expects way to much from the class though and is a difficult grader. Plus, we not only have a final but an 8-page term paper in addition to that. She is forgetting we have other tests to study for. Really inconsiderate.

Jude Jones is an absolutely fabulous teacher and a wonderful woman. I highly recommend friending her on Facebook, although be warned she probably updates it even more than you do. Philosophy and I never got along, but Jude Jones made it awesome. Very smart and very wonderful woman. DEFINITELY take her.

Dr. Jones simply rocks. What other professor can you talk sports with? The class is a little hard to follow, but shes incredibly helpful, she'll meet with you whenever, even on weekends. I got an A, and I've never cracked a B in philosophy before. Take her if you can, and enjoy every minute.

Hippyish and Spacy but hey ... its philosophy.  Kinda disorganized, but grades fair, and doesn't pile on the work like some professors.  Plus she is easily one of if not the smartest philosophy professor at Fordham.  Wicked cool and mad nice in my book.  Easy B and with some effort an A.  Take her if you can!
She gives herself completely to the material and to the students.  Wonderful!
Truly outstanding teacher. She loves her field and will do anything to help students.  Can wander at times, but even th wandering can be very interesting
I love Professor Brandt!!!! I have taken him twice and think he is so inspirational and kind and he truly wants students to learn something new in his class. I love him!

The entire class was him talking, but he gave opportunities for students who wanted to chime in. Such a sweet man who loves talking with students and will engage peacefully with all views expressed. Struggled with online learning, but made expectations clear and was generous in grading.

Wonderful guy- great class. Expectations are very clear, and your work is graded on your creativity. Definitely grew as a better writer and had the option to write about whatever I wanted. Interesting professor with tons of knowledge and life experience so utilize the stories he tells.

Took his writing workshop translation poetry class. Easiest class I have ever taken at Fordham. He is a really nice old man who has a lot of life experiences and stories to share. Wants his students to get a good grade. I would take his class again 100%

Just a lonely old man who has a lot of knowledge and life experience he wants to share. He tells interesting stories from an interesting perspective, even if he does repeat stories often and talk about things irrelevant to the class. He really cares about his students and he's looking to give As. Show some interest and effort and he'll like you.
One of the best classes I've ever taken.
most impressive and interesting professor you will ever have the opportunity to take

Class is VERY easy and often interesting if you enjoy social justice and the media. Brandt is the most boring lecturer on the planet, but it's worth it for the easy A. nice guy, and cool class if you like the topic already.

Mr. Brandt is awesome. He responds extremely quickly to emails, is very helpful in and outside of class, and cares so much about his students and the course work. There are two papers, both very clear, and a group project presentation. No midterm or final, but he is a strict grader, as he has much experience with professional writers. Great guy!

I got a B+ in the class and mind you I did not put ANY effort. Im sure if I did, i would have gotten an A. Very chill professor and he wants you to teach him and give him your thoughts and opinions about life. Two  papers (which can be however long you want) a group project and a take home final.  Take him!

Professor Brandt is definitely one of the most educated people I've ever met. He'll make you feel like you've never read a single book (but not in a bad way). It's an easy class (he doesn't believe in tests or grades); just write your poems and you'll do well.

Brandt desperately tries to gain the love of his students, but his class is simply too unorganized and abstract to be enjoyable.  "Peace, Justice, & the Media" was hardly what was discussed in class, his final paper was bizarre, & the project assignment was not well-implemented into the course.  Easy class, but I would've appreciated more structure
Very easy class. Just submit a creative piece every couple weeks or so.

I recently took Brandt for my Peace Justice and the Media Comm class. If you actually pay attention to his lectures, this man's class can change your life. I will admit that his lectures do get a little boring at times, but most of them are extremely fascinating. Brandt has more real world experience than most FU professors

Shouldn't be a teacher. brags about mouthing off to police officers at protests. Puts protests ahead of teaching duties and solicits students to  protest with him. His lectures are very off topic and revolve around his extremely liberal almost communist beliefs/conspiracy theories. The class itself isn't hard but tougher grader than in the past.
Great teacher. Enormous, all-round culture will blow you away. Likes creative writing. Go to class, enjoy his lecture and write 4 papers. Done. Amazing teacher and person.
Intelligent and wise.

Prof. Brandt is the best. This was a creative writing class and the environment he set up put us all at ease with sharing even the worst of drafts. It was great learning things about my writing that I usually overlook. And I loved everyone else's writing. He's also brilliant, can hear him talk for hours about just about anything, without ever tirin
Nick Leshi is amazing!! His class is engaging and interesting and taught so much on the subject of PR!

SO EASY! Gives a good look at the PR Industry without all the stress of a college class lol. Not essential to read textbook at all, just do the weekly journal (paragraph to a page, super easy and interesting questions), a few fun projects, and take-home final. Easy A, he's super nice and knows his stuff

Although there are weekly writing assignments, they are mostly one paragraph in length and take no more than 20 min. to write and are opinion based (no wrong answers). There is no midterm or Final for this class. He is not super strict on turning things  in on time. Classes never last the full scheduled time slot. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. EASY 4 CREDITS
His public relations class was excellent and eye opening. Creative assignments, learned a lot.  Might consider PR as a career now.
Maybe too much powerpoint presentations. He tries hard to make it interesting.  A good guy.
Loved it. Best class at Fordham. Great teacher.

What a great teacher!  Love this man. He really worked hard to show us the practical side of online writing. Before this class I didn't know much about blogging, but now I see all the potential it has for personal as well as professional communication.  Prof. Leshi made each class informative and fun.  He really cares about his students.
He really cares a lot about his students and it's obvious he knows a lot about the topic.  He made the class fun and interesting.  I wish he taught some other classes too so I could take him again.
Lots of reading assignments, but skimming is fine and the readings all make sense with the course. Super approachable and a fair grader!

Prof. Hogan is amazing!!! She really sparks conversation that is engaging and thought provoking. The readings she assigned were all very pertinent and interesting. Makes you think and gives assignments that are challenging but ultimately extremely rewarding. A very realistic grader, though- put in the work and you will rewarded. Love her!

Very kind/friendly. Extremely knowledgeable, really knows her material! Very accessible (great office hours, fast email replies). READ ASSIGNED TEXTS. Participation is KEY. Tough but very fair grader (don't bs). Engaging/discussion driven class! Weekly readings, 5 papers, midterm, final project, final. Don't skip bc lots of important info for exams
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Vincente is one of my favorite professors at Fordham. He is very caring and understanding. Spanish is my worst subject, but he made the material fun and easy to understand. The workload is pretty standard for a language class. Definitely take his class if you have the option to!

one of my favorite profs at fordham. all my spanish classes before his were really stressful, but pablo was super approachable and made the class a comfortable space to make mistakes and learn from them. hes a real gem of a professor!

The best professor Ive had at Fordham so far! So kind and goes the extra mile to make sure his students understand difficult concepts. Also super friendly, funny, and approachable. Truly cares about his students and is super passionate about what he teaches.

Professor Pablo is honestly one of the best professors I've had at Fordham. He's extremely relatable and down to earth, and he undeniably cares and roots for his students. I always looked forward to class, because he is the funniest guy and he makes class interesting. He's also extremely accommodating and accessible. Would highly recommend.
Great professor, takes the time to help each student, went out of his way to help his students. He has a great passion for teaching and made the class worth going to. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

Probably the best Spanish teacher I ever had! He is so charismatic and takes the time to make sure each of his students understand. He makes learning easy/fun and less of a chore. Be ready to play kahoots and listen to Spanish music before every class! After taking the course, I decided that I want to minor in spanish:)

I took Professor Pablo's class for my first semester of college Spanish and then liked it so much I chose him again for my second semester. His teaching style is very interesting and he is definitely not a boring teacher. You definitely will need to study outside of class, but I think that should be expected in a language course.

First had Prof. Vicente for the fall semester and took him again for the spring semester. Loved the class, really helped advance my Spanish skills, take his class if youre looking to do the same. Participation matters because of course its integral to a language class. Super accessible, very understanding, and goes out of his way for students.

One of the funnest and funniest professors at Fordham. He genuinely cares for his students and would go the extra mile to make sure even the smallest concepts and ideas are explained. Not the most consistent grader, but always open for questions and clarifications. Take him if you're really willing to learn Spanish and put in some work.
Very subjective grader but a nice person. I would take him again but definitely not my favorite professor

Typical A/B student, got F on midterm & dropped class, here's why -Class teaches to ppl who took Span in HS. I didn't -First 3 weeks taught by way better student prof. who then left -Tough grader, Cs normal for good students also: -$150 txtbk required -Participation docked for bathroom + phone use- weird
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He was very funny during class. He is a bit unorganized sometimes when trying to explain concepts. He is very nice and understanding.

Second time taking Profesora-- she is wonderful and genuinely cares for her students. My ONLY complaint is that sometimes assignments are unclear, but that's the nature of zoom class and she's more than happy to help clear things up. So happy I had her during this difficult time, she really looks out for her kids.

Profesora is such an amazing professor who loves to teach. She is so incredibly helpful and will always check in on students. Profesora also lectures at fast yet understandable speeds, so don't be intimidated. You will have to study for exams, but they're straightforward. Overall, Profesora is a wonderful professor, and I would 100% take her again!

Prof Mihailovic is incredibly sweet and understanding. It's clear that she wants to see all of her students succeed. She always made class enjoyable, and it was one of my better classes taken online. Grading follows the standard spanish rubric, but I always felt prepared to do well on exams. Always willing to meet outside of class and help you.

Coming into this course, I was extremely nervous as I hadn't taken Spanish since early HS. Prof. Mihailovic is so kind, sweet, and understanding of these tough times. The Spanish department assigns a lot of homework--so it's not her fault but there is a lot of tedious homework. She grades super lightly and it's easy to do well. Take her!!

Prof. Mihailovic was great. All she really wants from you is your best and for you to participate in class. She is so nice and you can tell that she cares about her students. There is a fair amount of homework but that also may be because we weren't meeting in person. I learned more this semester then in all of high school Spanish classes.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's a really great Spanish teacher to have. She is so nice, easy-going and good at keeping the class fun and not too serious.

Profesora is a very good teacher. While her class got a bit boring for me at times, its better than it being too difficult. She clearly puts in effort to make the class engaging and fun and demonstrates a genuine desire for her students to do well. Besides being the type of teacher to keep you as long as possible, I really liked her. Take her!

Such a lovely and caring woman. I entered this class behind my peers with my Spanish skills, but she helped me get up to speed one-on-one. You can tell she cares about you, and the "busywork" assigned is intended to actually improve your skills. I learned so much in a short time because she's very genuinely invested in my education.

the spanish dept at fordham requires extremely rigorous coursework and lots of tests, projects, and essays all within a short time period. Jelena makes sure we are all prepared. she understands that it is overwhelming. It is a lot of work, but it's not her fault and she tries to make it as painless as possible. caring, kind, and i learned so much.

I came into this class so scared because I hadn't taken Spanish in three years, but I'm so glad I had Jelena because she made it very easy to pick up again! She is not a tough grader and she is very encouraging of students to ask questions and participate in class. She's very nice, take her if you get the chance!

She's an amazing professor and if you've taken spanish in high school, it shouldn't be difficult to get an A in this class. She genuinely cares about her students and is always looking for ways to help you. TAKE HER!!

Professor Mihailovic really goes above and beyond for her students. Very engaging and patient teacher, knows how to effectively present material. Also, a straightforward and frank person, which always makes things a lot easier. The class can be difficult if you don't have a good background (or study) but she is very approachable and willing to help
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Jelena is amazing. One of the best professors I've ever had. She is passionate about the language and tries her very best to share her knowledge. She knows how to effectively present the material. She does not rush. She gives us time to allow us to get comfortable with what we're learning and even pushes the test back if we need more time.

Prof. Mihailovic is super helpful and accessible if you have questions. You are required to know a few things going into this class so don't take it if you're totally clueless about Spanish. She is fair and her tests are straightforward. Very approachable if you don't understand or need help.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Mihailovic is so nice  and really cares about her students. Her office hours are extremely helpful so go to them if you can. Tests are pretty straight-forward and based off of what's said in class. I would take her again.

Professor Mihailovic is fantastic! She really engages the class and makes it interesting for her students. Her grading is very fair but her exams can be a bit tricky. I throughly enjoyed the material we covered and I would undoubtedly take the course again. After taking this course, I have been thinking of minoring in the language.

She teaches a very typical Spanish class. Could've done a little better with giving grammar structures but overall she's pretty chill. She's willing to give a lot of help and make activities for you (but expect a lot of random emails!). Try to participate in class when discussing activities and you'll get on her good side.

This was a normal spanish class. However, I had hoped that we would read Spanish poems and short stories like we did in my AP Spanish Literature class. However, it was just a bunch of annoying grammar and vocab. Although the material is boring, she is a good teacher who cares about her students. I didn't study very hard and I got a decent grade.
Great professor, very chill, always making things more exciting.

Ms Mihailovic is so hot,she is very nice and easy. She is very clear, she does care for her students. She is available at almost any time, She is pretty straightforward, no curveballs. Just show up most of the time.

My THIRD course with Prof George- I tell everyone I know to take her courses. She is the reason why I changed my major and my career path; truly my favorite professor I've EVER had. Empathetic, brilliant, and engaging. She changed my life in such an amazing way, and I hope to keep in contact with her throughout my career. Can't speak highly enough!

I heard the most amazing things about Prof. George and she truly is so nice. However, her lectures are really long and are not hard to follow but are very difficult to take notes on. Discussion boards each week ARE mandatory. The essays are difficult unless you have truly done all the readings. Not a good online course. Not *that* easy of a grader.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: If you need a liberal arts elective, Professor George's intro to cultural anthropology class is great. There are just 2 short papers that she graded very leniently and a midterm and final that are MC/ fill in the blank. She also is very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject so the class goes by pretty quickly

Absolutely adore her content-rich lectures coupled with minimal homework. You can feel the passion flowing out of her in every class, and that she genuinely cares about your learning. Easy A, but I learned so much. Do note that if you are more conservative, you may disagree with some concepts but she is still very respectful of all views.
Amazing professor! Loved having her and would definitely take her again. Not unreasonably difficult but her lectures were extremely content-rich and I felt like I really got a lot out of the class.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. George makes the class so interesting so you don't have to sit there wondering when the class will end. She is caring, nice and easy to talk to. Midterm/final are multiple choices and fill in the blank only. Very easy. She is a fair grader on papers too. Participate, and she will like you. If you don't do great in her class, it's your fault.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I loved professor George's class. Her lectures were really engaging and she chose great readings. It wasn't terribly difficult and she offers extra credit. She asks you to buy a textbook but you don't need it. Do buy the other two books though.

Prof. George is very passionate. Participate in her class and she will love you. Two main projects/essays, a midterm and a final. She does present her political opinion in almost every lecture - she's very liberal - but this is an anthropology class so to expect anything else would be wrong.

Professor George was my favorite professor this semester. Her lectures are super interesting, so you'll always pay attention. Be prepared to read, but everything is interesting. She's clear on what she wants you to study for tests, and gives you a study guide. Show up to class, or you'll miss crucial notes. I'd definitely recommend her!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof George really loves what she teaches, is super nice/approachable, and is willing to make arrangements to meet outside class if you need it. Theres a good amount of reading but its mainly articles and you go over them in class. Def go to class, if you go and pay attention you should be fine. Midterm is straightforward and the project was fun :)

Amazing woman, difficult class. Be prepared to spend HOURS doing work for her, but you'll leave being an expert on the material. You have to take finite math for core, and she's a good choice if you want to actually learn the subject. The online hw and participation reqs can be a bit much, but BOY do I know how to calculate a binomial equation!

Absolute beast of a professor. Dr. Breiner will make sure you know everything you need to know and more if you do what you need to do to learn that information. Every explanation just makes sense; she could make an elementary school student understand calc. Put in the time and the work, and youll appreciate your grade.

Amazing professor b/c very enthusiastic, but can throw a lot of problems straying from the core concept, and participation is expected. To be frank, the homeworks and exams get really difficult; So be prepared to WORK. I'd say homeworks can even be over 5 hours at times, some over 10 hours + needed tutoring. It's not a cakewalk, so be prepared.
One of the best professors ever.

One of my favorite professors so far at Fordham. Breiner cares a lot about the subject and was a great teacher. Extremely easy to talk to and incredibly helpful in office hours. Would definitely take again.

This class was one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. The written homeworks were impossible. The average on all three tests we had over the semester was about a 60. I ended up with a B in the class but I worked incredibly hard for it. Make sure you make this class your priorty if you want to do well
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Qualified teacher, passionate about math. Assigns 1 written and 1 homework, takes up a good portion of your time- start in advance. Weekly Quizzes. 3 lowest written HW and quizzes dropped. Tests are fair IF you study everything carefully. Moves fast and class atmosphere is kind of not chill, high stress. Overemphasizes proofs for theorems
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Breiner is verrryyy enthusiaciat professor so enthusiastic where she expects you knowing the topics before class and expects you solve every question without delay. Written HW are extremely difficult and provides you with little help. I would not recommend unless ur enthusiastic about math!

She's a great professor. The subject is pretty tricky, but she is always willing to help out and she's hilarious and super nice. I would definitely take her again. Tests are more than fair, but the homeworks tend to be a little harder than necessary, but she drops the three lowest HW grades. Definitely would recommend.

OMG Professor Breiner is absolutely amazing. She is such a great teacher. She goes a little quick but that is to be expected of a college calculus class. Her tests and quizzes are extremely fair and she is funny in class as well. ABSOLUTELY TAKE HER IF SHE IS OPEN!!!!!!

Professor Breiner is awesome. Took her at 8:30 am, TF, and she managed to keep a class of 35 kids awake and learning. Came up with great examples to explain math and business concepts. Gives easy quizzes every week that keep you on track and can only boost your grade if you put in the work. Would definitely take one of her classes again.

Great professor, with a good sense of humor. Notes are clear. And she always tries to help you understanding the materials. As long as you go to her lecture and make sure you understand HW problems you will be fine.
Hard class but great professor

Dr. Lehman is, simply put, a queen. I took her the first time she taught her ICC, and despite being the guinea pig for the course it was well-organized, clear, and I learned so many amazing things. I've already registered for another class of hers because I enjoyed this one so much! You can tell she cares for her students deeply.

Serious workload for a course of this nature. Thought this one might be easy, but there are SO many essays to write and books to read. Expect about an hour of homework per class and the final paper is a 27-30 pager written over the course of the whole semester.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Took for transatlantic picaresque and Im a native Spanish speaker. She was okay usual workload for a Spanish class. Participation matters 25% I believe so you have to do the readings. Paper was the only thing that I did not do well even tho she told me I was doing well on it. So she can be unclear with what she wants on a paper
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great teacher in and out of the classroom, dedicated to her discipline and her students; had her for a unique seminar class in the manresa program: different for sure but she kept it interesting and engaging for the most part; great sense of humor, would recommend taking in again and getting to know
Outstanding teacher for a lousy course. I'd take her again
Prof Lehman is a great teacher. She really knows her stuff and explains everything very well. Expects you to do the work which is not too difficult. Definitely recommend.

I highly recommend Professor Lehman. Yes, the workload is heavy, but you will learn a lot and the class is not impossible if you put in effort and participate in class. She expects a lot, but she is very clear about what is expected. Definitely not a class you can skate through, you will need to work hard.  Takes attendance every day.

Speaks English, so there's no clarity issue. She is not very accommodating for students, which may be partly thanks to the ridiculous course outline the dept. gives her. She is a very hard grader and offers little help if you see her in office hours, etc. I did fine in the class, but wouldn't take her again. Not a nice lady.
not a bad class, interesting, but a hard grader

Nice lady, American so no accent . Class is discussion which is nice. LOTS of homeworks, seriously A LOT. She'll take into consideration how long a break is and assign more. HW even on day of test! But, the tests are small and noncum. Only 3. Take her if you rather do the work during the year than have huge tests and finals.

Best teacher I've ever had in Spanish, one of the best I've ever had overall as well.  She knows the dynamics of teaching and she creates a very inviting atmosphere.  She has hard tests but if you do the work you should be fine.  I HIGHLY ADVISE ANYONE TO TAKE HER

lots of homework, the work in class is easy but then the tests are very difficult, hard grader even though she doesnt teach much. nice and helpful but if you have the oppotunity to take someone else, dont take her

Very easy teacher...tests are a joke....little emphasis on vocab from each chapter...class is oriented mostly on talking in small groups for a few minutes several times...class helps you become better speaker....very approachable.....very fluent
Incredibly nice.  Gives pop quizes and fairly hard tests.  Native english speaker, so you can understand her.
Professor Lehman is such a nice and genial professor.  Shes very approachable but gives a tough test.  Hardest spanish class ive taken, but ive learned the most from her.
I love Prof. Lehman! She is such a nice person and tries to keep class interesting. You need to study the entire chapters for her tests and the final. She is very easy to talk to and knows a ton.
