She is an insane grader.  I got the lowest grade in her class that I have ever recieved in any Spanish class that I have ever taken and its my major!!! Not only that but this is my 7th Spanish class at Fordham. She is approachable.

She's a really nice person and is def. fluent even though she's american, but omg she gives an INSANE amount of work! we read 4 books and wrote four 5 pg papers. she's a fair grader tho, and is helpful.  i'd recommend her, one of the very few decent spanish profs, but tons of work

So, I'm a humanities major in his ICC but he does an AMAZING job being accessible for both STEM majors and fake majors like me! (joke.) Truly such a funny guy and, despite this being my first time taking physics in any way, he makes sure I understand just as well as kids who are experts. He's often described as "literally the best" and I co-sign.

Professor Holler is a good person, but the structure of this class didn't allow him to teach effectively. Lectures were confusing, and there was only one assignment before the final that generally covered the topics we learned. The final itself had many questions about topics we didn't discuss too. I think he would be great in a full class, though.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Physics is really hard and I definitely struggle a lot. However, Dr. Holler is committed to making sure he can help you in any way. He's always checking his email, even at like 4am, so don't hesitate to ask questions. He wants everyone to perform as best as possible so he has extra credit. His lectures are straightforward but he talks fast sometime
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: My absolute favorite teacher. Dr. Holler goes above and beyond to help you understand material in class/office hours and over email (even at 2am). He makes learning a tough subject not only easy but fun! LOTS of opportunities to boost grades (hw, quizzes, extra cred, etc.). Also just a fantastic person overall - please get to know this great man!

Physics is a difficult subject. But with Professor Holler, you'll be able to grasp the material easily. He truly wants everyone to do well and understand the material. He is very accessible outside of class. If you ever have questions, he will take his time to explain things and ensure that you now understand. Put in the time and you will do well!
Holler is am amazing professor. You will actually learn from him is you show up and do the work. His tests are hard but they are balanced by lots of online quiz and homework grades
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Holler is an absolute gem - a great teacher, a wise mentor, and a supportive, dedicated educator. He once emailed me at 2am after we both spent hours on a problem, just to let me know what we were doing wrong. Take his class, and you won't regret it.

Dr. Holler is one of the best professors I've had at Fordham. He is genuinely interested in each and every one of his students and will take the time in office hours not only to explain difficult problems, but also to get to know you. The class is tough, but Holler is so helpful and will make sure that you understand the subject.

One of the more finer professors in Fordham's science sect. Holler might not be the clearest professor while teaching, but if you pay attention and follow the steps he shows on the board, it's very easy to understand what's going on. U WILL do good if u go to office hours, be proactive and DO YOUR HOMEWORK (actually learn off it, even after Chegg).

Holler tries to make physics understandable but it still is physics. Still, a good class to take. MAKE A CHEGG and use it for your online hw and online quizzes. Holler gives three exams, two during the semester and one during finals. The two semester exams are 60% in class and 40% online. work in groups to get all the 40 points. good luck.

Prof Holler is one of the best professors I've had at Fordham. Physics is difficult, but he makes it as painless as possible while still challenging you. He goes above and beyond in trying to make you understand if you email him or go to office hours. The homework forces you to learn the material. Plus he brings in his kids sometimes to class.

HOLLER IS THE MAN. Cares for students and encourages question. Overall cool teacher, go office hours for questions or  for candy, he's really helpful and clear considering he teaches physics.  Three tests. Webassign weekly assignments and quizzes. Read textbook, go over concepts. Holler's golden.

Steve Holler is the most helpful professor at Fordham University. Physics is not an easy subject, but he goes out of his way to be available during office hours for extra help on homework and exam problems. He also gives extra credit for every chapter. Last thing, use the Johnson and Cutnell Physics book, it directly correlates to the homework.
Professor Yoo is amazing! Homework is easy, helpful, and graded on completion. Homework before tests is also very similar to the actual tests, which is great for studying. Take her if you can!

The best Professor I have ever had. I love her. She is the nicest person in the world. She gives you a good grade on the homework if you do it. So make sure you turn it in! The midterm was very easy and straight forward and was similar to the practice one she gives us. Would take again 10/10.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Had her for Math for econ and micro theory. Both classes had 2-3 HWs, 2 midterms, and a final. Show up to class and pay attention to the example problems because they're like the problems on the exams. Her lectures are clear and take and review the notes (or study a bit more if theoretical classes/math isnt your thing) and you'll be fine.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I dont know where these other ratings came from but that not the professor I had at all. Her lectures are BRUTAL to say the least and graded me so hard and failed me on a test when its 30% of our grade and took off points with no care. Shes the kind of professor to not care at all about you passing her class and has no remorse with failing you.

solid teacher. take notes in class and do the homeworks and the tests are exactly the same. she is not trying to kill you--wants everyone to learn. tests are just variations of problems done in class so don't skip and you'll get an A in this class.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She is extremely clear in her lectures and writes down everything you need to know on the board. As long as you do the two/three homework assignments, you will do well on the exams (she pulls questions from the homework).
Explains concept very well. Very sweet and very nice professor.

Her class consisted of 3 tests and HW but it was only checked for completion. She explains concepts very well and reviews for all exams. Her review is very thorough and matches what will actually be on the exam. She is a very fair professor and an A is achievable as long as you study and pay attention when she reviews.
Most amazing professor at Fordham. Very concise lecture notes with examples that are on the exams as well. Overall, a very simple class with easy homework assignments and exams.
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great teacher for any ECON major. 3 exams and 3 homeworks. Very approachable and if you show up and keep up with the class you're fine.

Professor Yoo is your average easy A teacher. Looks like a student and gives good lectures and gives out notes to students and makes the tests as easy as possible, if you don't get an A in her class you should not be at Fordham.

Professor Yoo is one of the best professors I have had thus far. Her lectures are extremely informative and insightful. Exams are very clear and not too difficult. If you attend class and pay attention, you will definitely do well in this class. I would highly recommend Professor Yoo to anyone who has never taken a Statistics class.

She is a very adorable and very fair teacher. Her tests are simple and she make sure to be a very fair grader.  Homework is required but its just for completion and is a grade booster. Take her if you can, honestly the best Stats 2 teacher.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This woman is amazing. Not only is she a really great teacher, but she makes sure that you know exactly what will be on every single exam. She never throws any curveballs at you. She has a slight Korean accent, but it is the most adorable thing ever and she makes sarcastic little comments all the time. I wish I could take every class with her.

I love her so so much! I didn't get to know her personally but she was crystal clear about her expectations. 3 exams, final included and 3 hws that are due after/ on the day of an exam. I didn't need to read the textbook nor study much because her lectures were so helpful.

Prof Valle is so understanding and accessible outside of class. She seems to truly care about individual students and she's a fair grader. Although lectures can get kinda boring and assignments and readings can be a bit tedious, they're really easy so long as you pay attention and show up to class. Take her!!

I believe that she is one of, if not, the worst professor taken at Fordham. She simply lacks the understanding of general teaching. She does NOT give any criticism. She will enjoy wasting your time and energy. She openly admits that she enjoys students 'struggle'. She also blindly acknowledge that she can, and WILL, destroy your GPA. Worst Prof.
the worst teacher you will EVER take.
do not take this class. ruined my freshman year experience. papers are vague, prof. hates her students, lectures are boring, lots of readings ...
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: amazing professor & so kind too. lectures can get a little boring just because there's a lot of material, but it really isn't difficult, she posts the lectures online, and she constantly gives opportunity for discussion. fair grader, VERY understanding w personal circumstances, one of the best professors at this school. take her if u can! A QUEEN!
If you do most of the readings (there are a lot), then you'll be fine. Hard to stay awake during her lectures but you can find all her notes and powerpoints online.

Prof. Valle's class was not hard. I didn't use the textbook and still understood what happened in class. She did have a midterm and a final, both were 4 short answer questions. She also assigns 3 papers throughout the semester that are supposed to be 3-4 pages long. Take her if you want an easier course, but still a little bit of work.

Her lectures are difficult to follow, but if you have done the readings you should be fine. She doesn't do tests, but the course consisted of about 3 Media Journals (3, 3-page papers) and one longer final paper. Each paper had a clear rubric on what she wanted and if you followed that, you got a good grade. Show up to class and read for an A.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Valle is one of the best professors at Fordham. She gives the notes through powerpoints and goes through it slowly enough that you can copy all of the material. But if you could not get it all for some reason, she posts it online after class. The grade consists of three reflection papers, a midterm and a final. They are all extremely easy

This professor just lectures at you from the powerpoint the entire time in her very heavy Chilean accent.  Class periods are not interesting because they are the same thing every day and she barely looks up from her notes.  You could honestly miss class (though you only have 5 skips) and still pass the exams.  There are 3 papers per semester.

I had prof. Valle for Intro to Sociology and I absolutely adore this woman. She DOES have a very strong Chilean accent. The class structure is very simple, She does a power point to present all of her notes, though she thoroughly engages the class with modern examples work. Essays are a cake walk and the exams come straight from the readings and pp

Professor Valle is not so bad. The whole class is taught through powerpoints and there is a lot of reading. Midterm, Final and three essays. The essays aren't bad but the exams are tough. The exams are made up of short answers, maybe like 5, on very specific subjects. I hardly read the readings and I was still able to get a B in her class.

.....Lets Me just say there is nothing more than a 1 hr powerpoint in every class. It makes her boring and confusing, especially with her Chilean accent. Essays are simple (use Durkheim in all the essays) but the midterm and final are ridiculous..STUDY!!

Honestly, Professor Gelbart is such a kind and intelligent Person who makes class interesting and easy to follow. It is not an easy A class but if you really want to learn something then TAKE HIS CLASS. He is super sweet and funny and he might be a tough grader but its fair and justified.

Professor Gelbart really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. His classes are really interesting and he knows how to make content relevant and engaging. I highly recommend taking his course

Prof. Gelbart is a really great professor. He's educated in both classical and contemporary music (has a degree from Harvard and a PhD from UC Berkeley!) and clearly knows what he's talking about. Plus he's just a really great guy with fun lectures. Took him for Rock & Pop Since WWII and it was an amazing decision. LOTS of reading but so worth it.

Pros: he owns a pet rat(s) and is just a charming dude whose music library is a story to be told. Cons: tough grader, to the point that you question whether or not its really him thats grading, or some evil little leprechaun. I highly recommend for fulfilling your arts req. I will say though that he's less tough on those who participate often.

Professor Gelbart is a really sweet professor. But, his music history class is difficult. He expects you to know and understand the topics although this is an intro. class. There are two 5-6 page papers, a midterm, and a final. He gives the essay questions for the exams ahead of time but the listening sections are really tricky.

Professor Gelbart is a genuinely good professor. At least in Music History, he no longer gives pop quizzes, so that concern in older reviews is irrelevant. He is actually really nice, his office hours are helpful, and his lectures are informative. His homework never takes long and isn't too demanding.

He takes his class too seriously. Most of the students in the class are not music majors and are just taking the class to fill the core but he doesn't understand that. He gives pop quizzes on readings and 2-3 papers, midterm and final. Class itself is sometimes so boring to get through. He just talks, not much student interaction.
Talks to you are if you are a professional in music, which is not what this class it intended for, its an intro to music history. Is a REALLY hard grader, borderline unreasonable

Go to class, work hard, pay attention, and you'll do well. Professor Gelbart doesn't just give out good grades, you have to work for it. Lots of written hw, 2 papers, midterm and final are listening and essays (you get prompts before). He's a great teacher who is really passionate about the subject. He keeps it light too! Take him if you can.

Nothing against the guy personally, he's nice and all. But the class is awful. Unless you have some background in music the class is next to impossible, and as an introductory class its hardly justifiable. He's an extremely harsh grader and you have to spend hours to keep up with the amount of reading he gives you. If you can, don't take the class.

Very interesting classes, very heavy based on in class discussions and keeps them going well and classes flow smoothly.  Decent amount of reading, only a few papers, but hard grader and the essays are very vague.  The last paper for the class is on whatever you want, so you have no idea what he wants

Brilliant man who is crystal clear on what he expects. You should never expect any class to be an easy A and this is no exception. He gives you 5 short answer questions to study for on the midterm/final and then tests you on 3 of them out of a choice of 4. It is a very fair class. If you do the reading you will get a decent grade.

Don't take this class if you don't have a basic knowledge or interest in music. Not an easy A. Challenging class, but he is a very intelligent professor. Pay attention, go to class, and take notes on EVERYTHING because the final is all short answer and you must know information from readings throughout the semester. I recommend this professor.

Definitely not an easy A, but not impossible. He definitely revived my appreciation for music and actually made it interesting. If you're genuinely interested in music and willing to put in work, take him. If you're looking for an easy fine arts class, look elsewhere.

The reviews saying this class is an easy A are FALSE. In fact, this class isn't even an easy B. Gelbart's a nice guy who makes a boring class somewhat less boring, but his grading is HARSH. Says he believes the class average should be a "C" and doesn't curve. Class requires way too much work for a core. Trust me on this one, take someone else.

Gelbart is not an easy professor these ratings are so false. He is very nice and makes funny motionsthroughout the clas but the textbook sucks and you do have to read it. The class is fine untill you have to write the papers/ take the midterm/final whihc basically are your entire grade and cover WAY to much. He is okay but i would not really reccom

Are u kidding me? These reviews must have been written by gelbart himself. He is a really hard grader. He wants the class average to be a C+. Avoid for fine arts elective. Out of all my classes right now, he demands the most work! Avoid him , I dread going to his class!

Really knowledgeable without being pompous, a good sense of humor about the subject matter. Clear about his expectations and his assignments. Notes are good but the textbook has plenty. Makes a required class enjoyable for uninterested students.

Professor Gelbert is by far the best I have taken at Fordham. I had no interest in music prior to taking this class, but you cannot help appreciate it once you take this class. He is so funny and give interesting lectures. Midterm was easy cause it was similar to review sheet. And he actually allows rewrites on paper O.O. Take for an easy A/A-

He REALLY knows his stuff and is very personable, accomodating and fair. Go to class, pay attention and take note of what he says, do the homework (not too much of it), take the 2 papers seriously and use your notes to study for exams. You will be fine. He is always there to help if you need direction and clarity for what you need to know. Good guy

Don Deere was a great professor becuase he really tried to simplify a hard topic however he does give A LOT of work (at least for my online class). We had lectures, readings, discussion questions, midterm, final, and 5 papers throughout the semester. While he graded fairly, the work did add up! Still, he was super sweet and cares :)

GREAT MAN. He is quirky and very into what he teaches. Standard discussion posts, midterm, final, and 5 papers throughout the semester (they are only a page not difficult). He really teaches the material so well and this became my favorite class despite my lack of reading and writing skills. TAKE! (only meet once a week too)

Professor Deere is probably the best teacher I had in my first semester at Fordham. I was dreading having to take this philosophy class but it ended up being fine. There are weekly readings that may be long but are pretty interesting. Also weekly quizzes and five short papers due throughout the semester. Overall, Dr. Deere is a great teacher!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Don Deere Is an amazing professor for Phil 1000 at Fordham. He is an easy grader but there is a lot of reading to get done before class. There is a quiz every week based on the readings. All of the work is manageable and a very easy A if you stay on top of your work. Participation is required for group discussions. I highly recommend him!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Im a first year and I loved Professor Deere. He was so kind, cool, and had a personality. He loved talking about philosophy. This class was not hard. He gave us everything we needed and we had short quizzes online (no tests). He gave 5 essays due throughout the semester (but you choose when you want to turn them in). Def recommend him
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Deere allowed for the class to have some of the best discussions regarding all philosophical readings done each week. Beware of many long readings for homework followed by long in depth videos regarding the readings, then discussion posts and a weekly quiz. He also requires 5 papers done throughout the semester.

Professor Deere made PHIL 1000 an incredibly engaging experience. Would highly recommend taking him. Work wise there is a weekly reading and usually, some type of lecture video to watch than a quiz and short discussion post, which needs 4-5 hours a week. In lectures, he would always be enthusiastic and open-minded.

He's a relatively young guy who knows a lot about philosophy and has an open mind to everyone's opinions. The readings and quizzes weren't bad at all and class discussion was great. He really likes when people share their opinions. I would definitely take him for another philosophy class.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Deere takes a slightly boring class and makes it interesting. He really challenges you to think about the material and his lectures are engaging. The modules are a lot of reading and the weekly quizzes range from easy to moderately difficult, but good preparation will secure you a good grade. Highly recommend.

Professor Deere knows a lot about Philosophy, and his lectures can actually be pretty interesting. The assignments are always manageable to do by week and fairly simple. I'd definitely recommend taking this class.

Dr. Deere loves philosophy a lot and it is clear when he teaches. His classes are all lecture. He likes to hear what you have to say. If you pay attention and take notes it is not difficult to do well. Beware that his voice is super calming and it might put you to sleep. Makes jokes sometimes that are pretty funny

Dussel is a great professor. He chooses a wide range of topics in philosophy that are interesting to look at. He is understanding and flexible with his students. You will have to do readings every week in order to get an A but I didn't find that they were too much. I recommend taking him!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Great class! Would definitely take Dr. Deere again. He makes philosophy really interesting and relevant.

This class is definitely an easy A if you show up to class and do what is asked of you. Online reading quizzes, a midterm exam, an in-class debate, and a take-home final are the only things that are asked of you, so he is very specific in grading them. Lectures are miserably boring but if you show up and take some notes it's an easy A
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Literally the nicest professor at Fordham. Cares about students and is passionate about what she's teaching. She truly did everything to help me pass the class and would recommend her to anyone. All my friends love Prof. Ye :))))

Ye is super sweet and her class is easy to follow. She gives out her own notes (while a bit messy, they're very helpful if the class time wasn't enough) and there is plenty of time between a lesson and the corresponding homework due date. Her class is a solid choice for freshman who want to get the math requirement out of the way. Take her!

Prof Ye was literally the best. She gives a lot of homework but also gives you a week to complete them. The tests are identical to the homework. She reviews before each test and gives an extra credit review on mymathlab. She moves fast and has an accent but you get used to it. She really sets you up to pass. Take her if you can.
Shes such a sweet and understanding teacher! Take her!

My current math professor sucks so much that I am leaving a review for one of the best professors in Fordham's math department. I wish she was teaching this class that I'm currently taking and I miss her. 10/10 would recommend

Professor Ye is a great professor and really cares about the success of her students. She offers extra credit for exams and the homework is extremely helpful and relevant to the course. She's easily accessible outside of class and will work with you as long as you try. The online exams are open book and you can bring notes to the final.

Ye is a gem!! Her strong accent is a bit intimidating at first, but give it two classes and you'll be fine. 2 midterm exams and 1 final. Midterms are open notebook, final is not. All homework is online with one written component. Exams are easy, she prepares you well and does not test on anything she does not teach. Exams have extra credit. <3

As long as you show up to class, it is very easy. Her lectures are super clear and organized. She won't test you on anything she doesn't teach in class. The homework is online, and really good practice for the tests. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. If she finishes early (which happened a few times), she'll let you out early.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Ye is an amazing teacher. I had her for finite math, and she always available for help. She gives extra credit for both midterms, and wants all her students to do well. If you have the option 10/10 pick Prof Ye you won't regret it.

Professor Ye is probably the best finite teacher at Fordham. Instead of a hardcover textbook, you just have to buy an online access code to do homework. Her classes are lecture heavy, but if she finishes what she has to say she lets you out early. Her exams are just like the homework and she offers extra credit for the two midterms. Take her class!
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Amazing professor. Clear assignments, explanations of topics, and tests.

Professor Ye is dedicated to ensuring success among her students. Whether you're a math person or not, Prof Ye will help you succeed. Homework is simple, and you are fully prepared for tests. She gives so many examples, there is no reason everyone can't get an A. Very caring and has lots of office hours too.

Prof. Ye is awesome. she gives extra credit, easy exams which are very similar to class notes, homeworks are easy and quizes are very easy. Stress free class, if you want an easy A take her would recommend
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I would take her again even though I don't need to. If you ever felt that you can't do math, she'll prove you wrong. Thank you Prof YE! :) Take her for finite and it'll be the easiest A, but you actually feel like its deserved.

AMAZING professor. Teaches so efficiently- take good notes and you never have to read the textbook. Homework online, 3 shots for every question AND it gives you walk-throughs to help. Not hard if you're a good student, but not easy if you don't try and don't use homework to help learn the material. She's super sweet and wants you to succeed. Take!!
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Definitely one of the best finite professors you could take at Fordham. Although like most of the math classes at Fordham, unless you're already good at math you probably won't do well. However, Professor Ye was very accessible outside of class and would respond to emails right away with any questions you may have. Also dropped lowest quiz grade

Professor Xiaojin is by far the best professor in the math department at Fordham. Not only is she very understanding and caring but she will also help you and ask you if you understand a topic during class. I wish I could take her for every math class at fordham!!!!
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Ye is the sweetest lady ever. All she wants is for every student to do well. Lectures can be fast so you dont want to miss notes, but shell give plenty of homework and drop a few quizzes to help your grade. No trick questions on exams and very nice with grading. Highly recommend
EXTREMELY KIND AND GENEROUS PROFESSOR. Prof. Ye gives a lot of extra credit opportunities, and doesn't try to trick you on exams. She goes really quickly for notes, so try not to miss classes.

Made me rethink my ability in math. I used to think I was terrible, this class proved that it was actually previous teachers who instilled this, not the work itself. She is one of the easier professors here at Fordham, and its not a bad thing if you're just taking a core req. It's an easy A but you actually feel satisfied about it.

Prof. Ye is a good math teacher. She is very energetic and generally friendly, but she can be quite fast paced in her lectures. Even so, the material wasn't too difficult and she was clear with her explanations. There is quite a bit of online math homework but not that many tests or quizzes, and she dropped our two lowest quiz grades.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The best professor I've had the privilege of knowing. She genuinely cares for her students. Gives great notes. I took two classes with her and both were great

She is one of the best professor I ever have and probably a great one from Math depart. Defiantly need to attend class in order to understand material. She also gives extra-credit and very caring. Also, available for office hours. I simply loved her class. You just need to pay attention in class and would be an easy A!
Sometimes she's hard to understand and she's very loud but as far as teaching goes she does a pretty good job. She goes kind of fast though.

You know how good the first bite of mac and cheese is? Well, thats every class with Ms. Ye. She may not know your name but she loves you. She is a saint. She is the greatest. Homework is so easy, you can get 100's on all of them and get an A in the class so easily!!!!!

Probably my favorite professor I've had at Fordham. She genuinely cares for all of her students, and she adds humor to her lectures. Lectures were based around the reading which were super interesting. Participation matters a lot, but if you do the readings it won't be hard to participate. Can not express enough that you need Axen in your life!!!

Favorite professor I've had so far at Fordham. Genuinely a great person, who is super understanding and is laid back/easy going. Makes the material very interesting and engaging, allowing you to participate and more involved with material. Style of teaching and knowledge of subject matter helped me enjoy the material and want to come to class.

Prof. Axen is my favorite Fordham professor thus far. She was understanding of the course being online and tried her best to keep class time as short as possible to give us a break. She assigns weekly quizzes that are easy A's if you take notes on her lecture vids. Long essay towards the end, longer if you are doing it for EP1.

Axen is one of the best professors ever. Her Medieval History class is extremely interesting and covers many different facets of the Middle Ages. She really cares about her students and making sure you understand the information. Definitely a lot of reading but they're all interesting. You can definitely get away with not getting the textbook.

Prof. Axen is incredible and by far one of the best professors I've had. She's such a sweetheart and makes the material very accessible and understandable for students. Weekly quizzes are fairly easy and keep you on top of things, and the only two tests are the midterm and the final. There are a presentation and an essay toward the end of the sem.

Take Professor Axen. Just take her. She is the best professor I've had at Fordham. Even if you aren't interested in the course she is offering, you will be surprised at how she makes the content interesting. I never thought I would like medieval history, but she completely changed my view on it. If you can, take her!

I LOVE PROFESSOR AXEN! If you can take anyone for UHC take Prof Axen's Medieval History. She is soo nice and an extremly understanding professor. The content is super interesting and she tries her best to make sure everyone is interested in something in the course. A lot of variability, not just sit and listen. The best prof I've had at fordham!

Dr. Axen makes medieval history interesting and relevant - something I thought impossible before taking her course. TAKE HER FOR YOUR HISTORY CORE. She is caring, dynamic, and makes the content accessible and easy to understand. She is one of the best professors I've had at Fordham.

Prof. Axen is honestly amazing. Her lectures are great and she really enjoys what she's teaching. The work is pretty light, usually consist of readings you have to do and an occassional blackboard post. She also gives quizzes but they are super easy if you pay attention in class. There's one midterm, one final and a final project/paper.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Used to think Medieval history was boring, but Dr. Axen is very good at making the subkect matter very interesting. Not only is the class interesting, but it is not very difficult. Course is comprised of weekly readings which you discuss, 2 papers, and a midterm and final. Take her!

Dr. Axen is a phenomenal teacher. She's super passionate about the subject matter in the course and makes her students interested in it as well. She assigns a lot of readings weekly, and they are discussed in class. If she finds that discussion is slow, she'll give pop quizzes. She's super caring and wants you to be engaged in the course.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I hate history. But Dr. Axen has transformed the way I think about history, to the point where I am considering a double major with medieval history. Her class is amazing, and is willing to help outside of class. However, you have to also be really passionate about her class to do well.

Dr. Axen is a must take. I took her for Medieval History, and it was my favorite class for the semester. She is lively, fun, incredibly passionate, and has many stories from her travels in Europe. However, she can get political during elections, it doesn't happen often, but if you do not like being lectured on what you should think, beware.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Axen is a fabulous professor! It's clear through her classes that she is knowledgeable, funny, and caring. Her lectures are interesting, with an emphasis on the primary source and textbook readings (reading those is homework). If you do your work, participate, and put in effort, you'll certainly do well. Take her! I promise you won't regret it.
She's a good teacher. She's intimidating at first, but once you get used to her you'll be a fan. The midterm isn't hard at all if you've done the readings and paid attention in class.

Axen is great, especially if you're just fulfilling your core requirement. She is hilarious and enthusiastic and makes the class interesting. There are a few quizzes, one big essay, midterm/final, but they're all fair. There's a decent amount of reading but they're more interesting than most other readings. She posts all the powerpoints online.

I really don't understand why her ratings are so bad. I think Prof Beer is an amazing professor and truly cares so much about her students and their well-being. We did small discussion group and participation is a major part of the grade. This Prof is amazing and definitely deserves better reviews!!!

Might just be because this was an asynchronous class due to covid but her performance as a prof was horrible. Once took points off for using the Constitution of the United States as an "outside source". Seems to be grading based off a criteria we don't have access to. Would not take again.

Prof Beer was an ok teacher. She's very understanding if you communicate well with her and would give as many as 4 extensions each sem. She's a somewhat tough grader but she gives good feedback for improvement. She's very organized but there's a lot of work every week. I personally wouldn't take her again, but I see how many would succeed with her
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Very caring and understanding. She was my favorite professor this semester and it was asynchronous! There's a bit of textbook reading involved, however, if you mainly paid attention to the primary sources you'd be fine. In the beginning I wasn't doing that well on some assignments, but once I realized what she wanted I started doing much better.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I'm not sure why the other ratings are so bad, it could be because her class is online and asynchronous this year. She is very generous with extensions and allows quizzes to be retaken (they're open note as well). It's the easiest class I have this semester. If the course is online and you want an easy A I highly recommend.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Really cares about what she teaches, very knowledgable on what she specifically teaches, but not necessarily on other questions. Lot of dates to memorize, lots of quizzes, likes trick questions. Push through and can get a B+ and poss. A-, but she's hard. Flies through lectures, focuses on quantity rather than quality of her lectures
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You have to work hard, but an A is possible if you pay attention and DON'T PROCRASTINATE. The professor is actually really helpful and flexible. She loves what she teaches; she took my class to the library to look at old manuscripts and held a battle simulator. She removed a section from our test when most of my class did bad on it. Does extensions

WORST TEACHER EVER. I wish i could give her a 0 in every category. Don't take her and you'll be fully satisfied with you decision. I used to find history very interesting, but she made me dread going to the class and she made me hate history. I don't even know how she became a teacher, she's that bad. Just don't take her, or you're in trouble
Don't take her. She's brutal

Expects you to only like medieval history. She thinks this is the only class you're taking and assigns so much work. Her powerpoints are useless because she just skims through them. Might as well teach history yourself so you don't have to deal with her. THE worst professor I have ever had. AVOID HER. I know I will never like history again

Tough grader. You have to work hard, even for a B. You will have reading every night, and a good amount of it. Weekly essays: 2 -pages, and then you start revising previous 2 pgs into 4 pgs. However, probably the best teacher I have had. Very clear, very passionate about the subject, teaches a lot, very engaging, knows her stuff. Lots of EC opp.

Dubey is a super nice guy. Quizzes are ok and most of the questions are put on the test. Mastering Astronomy homework is a lot but it's doable. Definitely not as bad as what reviews say but also I took it as an online class.

Prof Dubey is super flexible on when quizzes are and literally asks students what day they want it and pushes it back if we need. He drops 1-2 lowest quiz grades and your lowest test grade. Labs are super easy, just answer some questions. He uses the same questions on the test that were on past quizzes. Everything is open note/open book. Take him!!

I really don't know what the bad reviews are about, although I had him for a semester online (Fall 2020) so that might have been a factor. His lectures were just him talking to us our labs were online. Super easy and if you had any questions he would respond in a timely fashion. He graded really nicely and was a sweet man. I want to take him again!

Impossible to understand in the lecture. I don't know why he has a 1 star rating for difficulty it should be 5 because nothing he teaches is on the exam, and he is very nice but cannot teach to save his life. Very thick indian accent. Beware
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He lost half the classes quizzes and it took a while for him to take responsibility! His accent is impossible to understand and he can be cold sometimes
Maybe one of the worst teachers i had at fordham. Very thick indian accent and he does not reply to emails. His tests have questions on topics he never even taught us. Do not take.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is a horrible professor. He said he put our grades in and that if we didn't have one, it meant we didn't send him our tests. The entire class was missing grades and had proof the tests were sent to him. He will give tests on things he doesn't teach and will tell you a test is on one thing and then make it about something else entirely. Terrible.

I have mixed feelings about Dr. Dubey. He can sometimes be hard to understand and it can be hard to keep up with what he's explaining and he doesn't explain everything that is on the tests/quizzes. Despite that, his class is fairly easy. He's friendly and funny, and I enjoyed having him. Not good at explaining what he wants from you.

He has a heavy accent and broken English so he's often hard to understand. Grading/points do not make sense. Not unfriendly, but also not the friendliest.. Very laid back and easy class (no homework and workload is light) but the quizzes and tests are hard bc you dont know what to expect since youre tested on stuff he doesnt teach or is in the PPs

Whole class is a discussion, doesn't take attendance. Weekly group write ups, midterm paper, and final paper. It's the end of the semester and he hasn't given back a single grade, so im assuming he gives everyone an A.
such a nice professor! a very jolly person. he's the only professor this semester who made me laugh each class. classes are fun, work is easy, and he's a great person. highly recommend.

Prof. Jackson is so great. Take his class and you will be so glad you did. He only assigns an easy case study once a week and has an easy midterm and final paper. Attendance over Zoom is not mandatory. Should be an easy A! Nice guy.

Prof. Jackson, an ICON! This man is truly brilliant, funny, and caring! Class was just an hour conversation even though it was technically a 3-hour class. He likes engaging with students, telling stories, and making many dad jokes. Students actually wanted to be in class, turn their cameras on and show up for this wonderful person!

We often started class by meditating followed by breaking up into groups all around Keating to discuss readings. He loved to keep things fresh and informal. He manages to combine relevant course topics and humor. Only 2 tests on 3-5 chapters each (just read textbook you'll get an A) and a few short response papers. Highly recommend.

Course is the perfect culmination of  ethics courses at Fordham. Professor Jackson is amazing: brilliant, funny, and incredibly engaging. His class format, material and class presence make the course fascinating. I would recommend both the course and Professor Jackson again!

Professor Jackson is one the best professors at Fordham.  Extremely knowledgable on the topic of ethics and brings real world examples into the discussion to which we can all relate. He is engaging, funny and memorable as a teacher.
Absolutely loved this class. Great prof. gets you engaged & thinking about ethics in business. Keeps things real by connecting theory to cases and discussions.

I loved being in class with Professor Jackson. His animated style makes class interesting and also allows students to feel comfortable engaging in discussions. One of my favorite professors at Fordham.

Absolutely incredible prof. Every other prof at Fordham should aspire to be like Kevin Jackson. Makes you think and learn without an ounce of homework or testing or even realizing you're thinking and learning. I've taken him for 2 classes and both have been a pleasure. Laugh at his jokes and you'll enjoy a great semester.

Easy A.  Don't have to read.  Midterm and a final.  Four short essays due with the midterm (like 2 paragraphs each so barely the equivalent of one essay for a normal class).  On group project that can literally be about anything.  Literally about anything.

Great guy, easy class. We literally did yoga for 20 minutes. Super chill and has interesting topics. You can get away with not reading. Be sure to participate and laugh at his jokes, he's very personable. Lectures may be boring at times. Try to get to know him outside of class.
Wants you to learn so he keeps things interesting.  You need to read before class and study for the tests.  Has a lot of case discussion.  Smart prof. w/ great sense of humor.
Was ok, not particularly interesting.  Midterm was misleading and covered material never one mentioned in class, final was easy though.  Also group presentation/final paper assigned.
he's truly an outstanding prof.!! cool + real smart
Prof. Jackson's class is awesome.  He's hands down the best law/ethics professor at Fordham. Course totally rocks -- he's humorous, interesting, keeps things moving. Grading is hard but pretty fair.

Jackson expects you to come to class well-prepared and then takes it from there.  He assigns a lot of reading. If you read everything you'll get a lot out of the class and will make it through the tests. Case studies are interesting and make for great classroom discussions, which Jackson is especially good at conducting.

I would have liked to have learned more from this class. Jackson really doesn't do all that much. Lax on attendance and work and grades. Tests are sort of difficult and annoying to study for. Tries to make the class funny which is nice, but I really wouldn't recommend him strongly.

This is kind of a dumb class, but Jackson is a great person to teach it. About half of the class is him making admittedly funny jokes. He keeps the class interesting because the other half is spent discussing ethical issues in business, which can get boring fast. He's very lenient on attendance and work, and I would recommend him for Bus Ethics.
Professor Jackson is very animated about what he is teaching and encourages you to express your opinion and participate in debate. Fair grading policy. Enjoyed his class very much.
Excellent profesor who really enjoys teaching and tries his best to make the class fair, enjoyable and stimulating.

I was in his night class and it was a complete joke. He doesn't lecture half of the time. He just banters with you and tells jokes. He says the objective of his class is to have a good time and to laugh. One midterm and One final each worth 50%. I had to do my own reading and take my own notes for both exams which were quite extensive in material.

He takes a class that should be boring an makes it fun and interesting. If you follow his study guides, the midterm and final are no problem. He is also one of the most hilarious professors at Fordham. He wants you to laugh and have fun, how can you go wrong.
You have to be an idiot not to do well in this class
I loved this class. One of the smartest guys teaching at Fordham. Prof. stiumulates discussion and presents an important side of business  others take for granted.
great class, just do all the reading, and tests are no problem at all.
good class. knows subject well. useful and current topics.
Interesting class, with great class discussions. Very intelligent professor, wide range of knowledge, and applies issues to business world. Grades fair, he cares about students.

Excellent class overall but beware -- he drops you one letter grade for any late homework and if you're absent more than 3 classes you get an F for the course.  Quizzes can be hard if you don't keep up with the reading.

This class if really easy, but a waste of time. He let's you out 20 minutes early every class. The final is 50% of your grade and you get full credit on anything you turn in. Study for the final for an hour and you'll get an A.
Best professor I've had at Fordham University.  Grading is fair, presentations clear, and fantastic class discussions.  Interesting prof, knows his stuff and has a terrific sense of humor!

by and far, the best class and best prof i've had in my 3+ years at fordham. two objectives in this class according to him- don't fall asleep and have a good time. be ready to laugh and learn. definitely take this class!
Really nice guy. wants everyone to have a good time and get through the material. no pressure. easy exam, easy homework, no attendance policy
Wonderful class.  Really enjoyed class discussions.  thought provoking.
Jackson is awesome and knows his material.  Extremely witty and great strategy when it comes to teaching.
great professor, really cares about his students. I learned and laughed a lot.

This guy is undoubtedly the man. You know that guy?....well he IS THAT guy! Tells jokes every 5 minutes to hold the attention of the class and lets the class out 5 to 10 mins early almost every class. Just take this teacher, you won't regret it.
No Comments
Prof Jackson is the man! Take this class if you want to learn about drugs and other illicit activities.
The best night class ever!! Easy and interesting. You'll be missing out if you don't take Jackson!
this is such a ridiculously easy class that it's an insult to my intelligence. it's like a frikkin kindergarten class. if you want to learn, don't take it. if ur lazy, take it.
He's the best, as good as it gets.
A kind, compassionate, really intelligent and interesting professor.  Nice range of different reading material included in the assigned course textbooks.
Simply one of the best profs at CBA.
such an easy course that you'd be a fool to do poorly.

Jackson is one of the few profs that actually has a big name from having published ideas and made an impact on the world!  Take him -- he'll change the way you look at traditional business.  Grading and work load is fair.

Make no mistake -- you'd have to be a $%^#$ idiot to get a B- or lower with Prof. Jackson's classes.   Yes, he allows for some openness to get us to think and discuss the issues, but that's a good thing.  Jackson rules!
He makes his students buy his book, making $ off all of them. Kevin Jackson teaching business ethics is like Mike Jackson teaching a child care class.

stay clear. He uses dartboard system for grading.I did all the work, stayed through each class in its entirety while the majority lrft early during films.  I showed the interest and respect and ended up with a B-.  I should have easily recieved an A. Corney jokes, corney grades. Really unfair grade.
very unorganized, unfair grading policy,  no midterm, some papers,class is boring Final is open book many questions- not covered in class.
interesting professor, unclear assignments and not sure about his grading style? no input throughout the course.
Can be an easy A...go to the classes, open books final, and one 8 page paper thats done with a 5 person group, take him, just go to the class
I heard that too!
is it true that jackson is teaching the monday night section in the spring?  anyone know?  post the answer, ok...
Yup, he's a real card and jokester alright, gave me a C too.  You are hereby warned: enter at your on risk.

Where is all this "A" stuff coming from.  Did all the work, went to every class, still go a C--what the hell.  Randomly assigns grades.  Has a dart board system for grading.  My friends told me to take Fr. LaRocca last spring but noooo would I listen--shoot me.
Really funny, makes class light and enjoyable. An easy A if you do all the assignments. Impossible to dislike the guy,he's very liberal and gives you lots of freedom in class.

Took him for Business Ethics and International Ethics...most intelligent teacher at Fordham and the nicest man ever.  He is hilarious and makes the class bearable and easy but even though he doesnt mention it...you have to show up for class to do well

Take this guy. He is absolutely hillarious, and he makes a very boring subject as good as it can get. He does not give take home tests anymore so ignore that part. 1 midterm, 1 final, and quick homeworks every now and then.

Does it get any better?  You learn a lot and learn it painlessly.  Do the work, you'll be more than fine - tests are very easy.  Very sarcastic sense of humor keeps you somewhat engrossed in the absolutely BORING subject matter. Screw Ethics.
He gives weekly homework assignments, so you need to keep up with the readings.  Great, awesome teacher -- really encouraged me to think.
he is a stand up comedian! i love this teacher! attendance is not manditory, so easy, and so funny. dont take anyone else!!! easy easy A
what a great guy! Don't take anyone else for business ethics
Take home tests. Jokes in class. We watched Boiler Room and Wall Street as examples of ethics and insider trading. Best Teacher at Fordham.
I love this man! He teaches the course with jokes. Tests were take home.
very easy and lear. his tests are a joke
Easy class. One group project with a write up, basic weekly HW, play critique, and watch some plays. Class can be a boring because its mostly discussion or presentations.

Professor Calderazzo is probably one of the most easiest professors you'll meet at Fordham. She's so understanding and keeps class interesting by allowing us to watch plays for homework. Your final consists of watching two plays and having a group project about them. You have one essay to write the whole semester and thats all! Take her!

super nice and laughs at anything. she requires that you watch five plays and write a critique (2-3 pgs) on one of them worth 40% of your grade and then a group final project, which you also have to write a paper for (2-3 pgs.). as long as u show up to class, you're guaranteed an A.

Professor Calderazzo is a very genuine and caring person. We did lots of group presentations and wrote several papers. Overall it's an interesting class. The class was also fun because we got to go see different plays.

Simple and plain, this is the class you want to be in for an easy A. She loves theatre and class time goes by quickly. You will not have to do much at all. Put in an ounce of work, and you'll get the A and you'll be glad you took this class

Diana is a dry, funny person and cares less than you probably do. As long as you do the work and show up most of the time you're guaranteed an A. The class itself is interesting and worth paying attention to if you're interested in theater. I loved how immersive the class was and being able to go to plays as assignments.
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This is an easy A. She gives you a final group project that is a class long explanation of a play you chose and the different elements of a play. A lot of the classes are just watching plays or discussions. You have to see plays outside of class and for one of them you have to write a 2 page long critique. If you do the work you're guaranteed an A.

Father Horan is absolutely phenomenal. He is beyond caring and understanding of all things life can throw at you, and he makes a point to truly get to know you. 1 midterm and 1 final which have many readings but are very easy if you put in the work. A true Fordham gem and I cannot recommend a better professor for POSC!!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Father Horan is one of the most caring professors I've ever had. I took his class during Fall 2020, when we only had one-on-one zoom every 2 weeks. He would always ask how *I* was doing, and was genuinely interested in my well-being. Lectures are very important, but exams are nearly word for word what he gives you in class. Very understanding guy.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Father Horan is incredibly knowledgeable on all aspects of Law, and I greatly enjoyed his lectures. This course has very extensive lectures, but they are wildly educational.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Father Horan is by far my favorite professor I have taken at Fordham. He is so knowledgable, but expects a lot. His classes are a lot of work so be prepared to memorize your notes. He writes everything on the board you just have to write it down and he expects you to know it. So caring and a great man, definitely take him, but his class is hard.

Father Horan has made my first semester at Fordham so much better than I could have ever expected. I've loved his intro class and will be taking another one next semester, it has also really secured my interest in being at Poly Sci major. However if you do not love politics this is a class that you may not love, there are easier core classes.

Father Horan is a great professor. I have taken multiple classes with him. He is very passionate about law, and I am amazed every class about how knowledgable he is about specific cases and laws. He writes all of the notes himself on the board, and sends about thirty readings for tests. It is a lot of memorizing details, but I've learned a lot.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof Horan was honestly the best professor Ive had at Fordham thus far. He is the most caring professor you can probably take and explains things in a way that somehow always seems to make sense. While some topics could be boring, he presented them in a way that always kept you engaged. No homework, papers, just 3 exams that were quite easy once u

Incredibly knowledgeable and learned SO MUCH. However, three tests, each test you get about 30 articles and 10 pages of notes and he expects you to know EVERYTHING. Final is cumulative in terms of notes but you only have to do 20/40 questions. Study guide was 55 pages. Very kind and always willing to meet at any time. Def would take again
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I've taken a number of Horan's classes and you definitely can learn a lot. He's brilliant and passionate about what he teaches. He is a stickler for the details at times, so memorize your notes. Sometimes he is a bit too wordy for my liking, but he's overall someone I plan to take again. Do the readings and study your notes you'll be fine!

Father Horan very knowledgeable and seems to enjoy what he is teaching. He cares about his students .Participation is mandatory but he does understand if you cant make it to class. No homework, just reading. He tests on EXACTLY what is written on the boards during lectures. Memorize notes and readings in detail. Great class. Great Professor
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Father Horan is passionate about what he is teaching, and he really cares a lot about his students. There were indeed lots of readings and notes for each test, but I would think those were really necessary since this class was supposed to get us know American Legal System as much as possible. Best POSC professor so far!

He is just a tough grader. He took off points for tiny missing details that I have never had other professors do, which in the end add up. He sends you like 34 readings and has a lot of notes in the board. The readings are short but trying to memorize names of the ppl involved in the readings and the amounts of notes he writes, its too much!!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Wang is amazing. While lectures can sometimes drag, the information taught is so incredibly valuable, especially if you're intending on pursuing journalism. 1 midterm (very easy) and 1 final project that's in conjunction w the lab course. She is so understanding and very encouraging. You will always receive great feedback, too! Take her!!

she is the sweetest and definitely wants to help, but the class was so long and just boring (journalism isn't for me) which made it a lot more difficult for me. not too much homework but the homework we had was graded kind of tough but if you are willing to put in effort and ask for help I think an A is def achievable

Prof Schweiger is seriously awesome. This class is a great one to take for the core requirement, but you will also get a lot out of it. He teaches philosophy in a different way than a traditional class, and you'll actually be interested in it. Online, there were 3 papers and small participation in every class.--definitely take him!!!

Real chill class, you don't have to read the assigned readings just pay attention to his lectures as he sums up the important points of them. Three short papers and two longer ones, he gives a guideline for how to write them.

Basically, you only need to read the assigned reading when you have the papers to do. Other than that, you can just chill in the class. He will summarize all the readings, and you could listen to it if you don't want this class to be a waste of time. There will be 3 major papers and 3 small essays.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: He had this weird rule where if you walk in ten minutes late to class you lose a point on your final grade, which prompted me to show up to class 9 minutes late everyday. Aside from this rule, he's an average joe just like you and I. Grade is 2-3 papers, and an open book final. He likes papers written in a systematic form.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Minimal workload since you don't need to do the readings for each class since he goes through it. If you take good notes, it's easy to get a B. The final was great since it's open notes. It's almost impossible to get an A on his essays, and its normal to get a C on the first one. One of the easier phil classes though, as there isn't a lot of work

She is a super great professor, but I honestly think that she just expects more from students than they are capable. I had her for Text & Context and she just expects higher comprehension than is reasonable for a course of that level. We had two short papers (6pg) and 1 long (12pg) and it was hard! They took days! There is also a LOT of reading.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Taking this class was the hardest thing I have ever done in my life. She's extremely passionate and really wants you to learn but OMG this class is so hard- lots of homework, tests, and one final. I would rather die than take this class again.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor LaPenta is super passionate and extremely knowledgable. With that said, I had never received less than an A- on a paper prior to this class and she repeatedly gave me B+s for important projects and papers for no apparent reason. Unclear grading criteria despite there being a rubric. I was a straight A student before taking this class :/
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The syllabus was not followed at all, the required book costs like $150 (and you don't even use the whole thing), and her grading is unclear. 20% of the grade is participation, and a portion of that depends on your classmates.. so if no one else talks but you, your participation grade will still take a hit.

I absolutely loved Lapenta's class. She really wants you to learn the material, and if you aren't really interested in learning Italian, you likely won't do well. You should definitely do the homework, it helps a lot. She tries to speak as little English as possible, so you really have to use context clues to figure out what she's saying.

No. Just No. This is the worst teacher ive ever had in my life. I thought teachers are supposed to educate and help their students. If im pay $75,000 a year for a teacher to not help her students do better then wow. A direct quote from her is "I dont care if I fail all of my students."
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor LaPenta is incredibly difficult. Her grading is vague and while she accessible outside of class she does not provide any significant assistance. The class was way too advanced for a 101 class. Two midterms, a final, biweekly quizzes, homework every night and random projects thrown in.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took her for both Italian 1501 and 1502. A lot of people seem to have an issue with her because she is a tough grader and is not lenient. But I always liked her - the class was not stressful. Two exams, final, and projects thrown in the mix.

Kathleen LaPenta is a tough professor because she really cares about the material and expects you to care as well. Participation matters and she usually has an idea of what she wants to hear (so your opinion doesn't really matter). There's lots of really difficult reading and much of it was in Italian despite this class being an English course.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor LaPenta is very sweet and this is my second semester taking her. She is a very nice person and cares for her students but is no easy professor. The class if very work heavy and requires a lot of dedication. 6 quizzes, 2 projects/presentations, 2 midterms, and one final. Lots of vocabulary memorization.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professoressa Lapenta is so sweet. Although the class is very intense and difficult, she is very easy to talk to and encourages the class to ask questions. The quizes are biweekly and always pretty tough but the tests are relatively easy as long as you study. Two midterms and a final given in the class along with three video blogs and two themes.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took her for Italian history Texts & Contexts. We had a midterm and final paper (6-8 pages each) and short assignments due every other class. You're speaking component is running the lecture one day. She doesn't have the clearest grading techniques/feedback so you really should go to her office hours to discuss papers. Nice woman, class was good.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is the best Italian professor at Fordham! she really helps you learn the material and is very lenient with the work that she hands out. She is not a tough grader at all, as long as you do your homework. I would suggest taking her for the requirements!

She is a great professor! She is really understanding and will help you to learn the material. I was a little behind at the beginning of the semester, but she helped me catch up and better understand the material. She cares about her students and offers useful ways to learn the language. She does assign alot of work, but it is not busy work it help

Professoressa LaPenta is a wonderful woman; I loved taking her this past semester. She is a non-native speaker, so she gives good tips on how to learn the language. Some may find the tests a little challenging. Feedback on written assignments is very helpful. She really does care about her students and wants to see us succeed.

Awesome Professor.  Genuinely cares about her students and is very clear with her expectations.  If you are taking Italian, I absolutely recommend Professora Lapenta.  Very sweet lady and makes class discussions tolerable.

A wonderful person, but an average teacher.  Says that she rounds up and grades generously, then does neither.  It's a shame because I really love Italian but she acts like she's on your side and will crack jokes in class but when push comes to shove she will screw you (and your grade) over in a heartbeat. Tests are weighted much too heavily.

I love LaPenta. She isn't a native speaker so she has a lot to offer in terms of learning  techniques. It's a hard class, but she is an awesome person who will do anything to help you succeed. There's a ton of group work and you definitely need to participate and do all of the homework.

She puts in the effort to make grammar concepts clear. She'll switch into English often enough for you to know what's going on and participate. She's kind, definitely not as horrible and crazy as others make her to be. I think she's pretty lax and let's your edit your papers often.
Say away, do not take her class
Worst italian teacher i have ever had. I do what she tells me to do, and she doesn't give me anything higher than a 85.

I really like Professor LaPenta, this was the second time I have had her. She is really kind and wants you to succeed. Her tests are extremely fair. She assigns a lot of homework but it is not difficult work. I recommend taking her.

Really enjoyed her class. Tests can be difficult and unclear, but she's always willing to help and likes to see you putting in the extra effort. Go to office hours and see an on-campus tutor and you'll be good to go. She really does like to see students succeed.

Forgot to post this over the summer. Try not to take her class if you can. She's a very nice person, but she's just not a good professor. My Italian regressed last semester if anything. She completely turned off any interest I had in learning the language. She grades semi-leniently (which in long run is bad) she's a detriment to your Italian

I have to disagree with (most) of you. This was the second time I had her and she was a pleasure. Her class is no joke but she's very helpful & cares about her students. If you actually put in effort and make sure she knows it, you'll do fine. She makes it possible for students to do well which is more than most Fordham language professors can say.

She expects students to know too much of the language in only the second level of Italian. I've forgotten almost everything I learned in my intro class, and her readings outside of class are nearly irrelevant to the grammar and vocab in the books. She doesn't teach the language, only the reading material which doesn't help at all.

I had her at Lincoln Center and she was a great professor. She has a lot of patience when formulating idea and thoughts in Italian. She was lenient with the readings. She was also really nice and funny.I learned more Italian than ever because she made it easy to understand. Her class can be hard.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS I BEG YOU. she's abosolutely terrible. she makes this nervous giggle all the time when nothing is funny. she's extremely irritating and does not help you at all. her tests would be easy if she actually taught or if you were a native speaker. all of her work is pointless and feels like busy work. AVOID

She was not a good teacher at all.  But her 3-credit intermediate class is much better than her 5-credit beginner class.  If you have a choice, don't take her as a beginner, but she's probably a better intermediate teacher.  She's reasonable, but I'm not going to "sing her praises" because I really didn't like her personally.

DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU ARE A BEGINNER. SHE'S HORRIBLE. Doesn't even teach, just breaks the class into groups and you two are expected to figure it out.  Gets really ticked off if you don't understand it.  She treats the class like we're intermediate after the second week and goes way too fast.  She has made Italian an unpleasant experience for me.

The class was only difficult because starting to learn a language just takes a lot of effort and time. He does a good job of actually teaching something and is very flexible with due dates. He is also VERY french lol (I cant explain it any better). Also he is horrible with technology (and he's like 35) which made pandemic learning kinda hilarious.

Prof Latour is a really cool and funny guy and is very understanding and helpful. He loves it when you build a relationship and participate. He does cold call and his class was hard for someone who has never taken any french as it moves really fast, but once you adjust it isn't bad. 4 tests, 5 compositions, a final, and an oral exam. Really good!

Awesome guy. Very caring and passionate. Makes class as fun as an intensive French course can be. Only problem I ever had is he tends to be very all over the place, and at times disorganized. But he makes up for it in that he is understanding if you dont turn something in on time once in a while. Definitely take him!!
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Latour is a really nice guy with a real passion for the arts - he incorporates art & music history into his class in tandem w/ the literary history, which was a nice surprise. He's also a native speaker, so I definitely feel like my accent has improved after having been regularly exposed to "real" French. Work was easy, just manage your time well.

Classes with Latour are chill but kind of boring. He's super laid back and dresses incredibly well, and will often go off on random tangents. He assigns a ton of online homework and the tests can be kind of difficult but he's definitely looking out for you and wants to help. If you need extra time/help/etc just ask.

I took Latour for my introductory class, the class is notoriously difficult but I ended up getting a decent grade so I decided to take him again, his teaching style is very lasseiz-faire and often I'll be so lost I'll just take notes by myself at home. He means well and tries to improve but his classes are definitely more brutal than other profs.

One of my top 5 profs at Fordham. Truly cares about his students and will try his hardest to help you if your're struggling. Super accessible outside of class as well. If you show that you're putting the effort in, he WILL help you get that A.

I took Latour for two semesters and they were the most interesting classes of my life. He's a great person who really cares about his students, but his teaching style was too laissez-faire. He barely taught what was on the final and used class time to talk about art. Latour is very accessible and it's worth going to his office hours.

Professor Latour really cares about his students. He will give you extra time on tests and will even slip in a few answers. He is very lenient when he comes to homework so you never have to do it on time. His stories in class are hilarious and his smile is contagious. Tests are a bit difficult but your overall grade is curved.
One of the better professors I've had at Fordham. Very nice guy who's there for you whenever you need help. Would take again.

I took him at St. Johns University for French 1000 & I'm warning you, if you want to learn French, DO NOT TAKE HIM! He only speaks in French as if we already know the language, hes unorganized, gives little to no assignments & the ones he does give are not helpful! I paid $120 for a book & access code, NEVER used the code. STEAR CLEAR OF HIM!!!!

Pros:  Easy grader, lets you re-do every assignment, down-to-earth, nice guy, encourages people to work together in class, makes it easier, practice labs online (not mandatory), weird sense of humor   Cons: You must participate, he calls on people, textbook is super expensive, he is really confusing and disorganized, tests are cumulative!

His Canadian accent made him impossible to understand in class. I never knew what was going on. Thankfully, he is not a tough grader so I got a decent grade. He was not consistent with the amount of work he assigned. Some weeks it would be none and then the next it would be too much. If you can take someone else, I would advise it
Pretty good professor, his French is easy to understand, but his expectations are pretty vague.  Need to read a lot of French literature.
I love professor Latour! He's very nice and funny, his assignments aren't difficult but his tests are. He's usually very disorganized but overall he's a fun teacher and I'm glad to have had him.

Class is pretty much how he feels like going for the day, seems pretty unplanned. Had at 8:30 and he was often late to class which is nice so you don't have to worry about being a few minutes late. Not many assignments, just put in a good effort and youll do fine .

Prof. Latour is very nice and will help you when you need it, I just found him very difficult to understand in class because he has a very heavy accent and talks pretty fast. However, do the work and you should be okay.

Rule to live by: take a French Canadian for French vs. an actual Frenchman or Islander. He is the MAN! If you don't work hard at all, you can pass, though with a low grade. If you put effort, you can learn a lot and get a good understanding of French. Best of both worlds, pass with no effort, learn with a lot. Loves his students, very stylish too.

LOVE Latour. This will be my third semester with him. If you're not already familiar with French then his class might be difficult because sometimes his explanations get confusing. But for the higher level classes he is great, he cares much more about discussions than reading from a textbook. Participate and do the readings and you'll be fine!

Excellent teacher that genuinely cares about his students. Accepting and patient of those who can't speak great French, as long as they put forth effort, show up to class, and participate. His lectures are interesting too. Highly recommended for French majors.

Not an easy class (lots of Material to cover), but overall, I got a lot from this course and the class atmosphere was great. I really enjoyed taking Latour's class and will continue with him next semester !
I dont wear a seatbelt driving to school in the morning in hopes I dont make it to this class.
I Enjoyed learning with Professor Latour, really helpful guy. You must participate in class.

He is probably the easiest professor I have ever had.  Consistently handed in late work, never did online work, and missed 8-10 classes.  Got an A- in the class. That being said, the man really doesn't teach you that much French at all.  Take him to get your req out of the way with a good grade, not to gain a better understanding of the language.

Latour is a terrible teacher. I went into the class hoping to learn French and instead learned nothing. Constantly gives us work online because he is too lazy to grade anything himself. Gives the wrong information when asked about what is to be on a test. Condescending and calls on students simply to embarrass them in front of the class. AWFUL!!

Nice guy but horrible teacher. His lessons were scattered and explanations incomprehensible. Be prepared to teach yourself.
