I hear he's good 1-on-1 but when i emailed him he would ask which class I was in and ignore any questions I asked. Up side, my grade was better than expected: C's on tests, B+ in class. Still, I won't be taking him again.
great teacher. helpful and understanding.

I had a hard time paying attention in class because he is SO hot. He also dresses strait out of a gucci ad. He was a very good professor, always willing to help, and highly rewarded improvement and class participation. I would DEFINITELY suggest him.

Latour is a great guy. He is very understanding when you are struggling and wants to see you succeed so if you put in the work to improve, he will grade you accordingly. Be honest and open about your problems and he will help you fix them. After meeting with him and taking his advice on how to improve my grade HONESTLY jumped 20 points!

If you are very serious about French, don't take him. His lectures are about as deep as a 7th grade English class and are usually taken from Wiki. He usually speaks in English. However, if you're like me and are just trying to finish french unscathed, he's great. He's an easy grader, nice guy, and doesn't expect hard work at all.

Let me say this. I do not by any means like Latour, but he is a very easy grader. I believe he gives every person, including me, a higher grade than they deserve. I got a solid A when I thought I might get a B+/A-. I still advise you to avoid him at all costs. He's confusing, boring, talks in English too much, and has poor teaching skills!

I liked Professor Latour, he was funny, and was fairly lenient about work (homework, quizzes, labs, compositions).  The only bad thing about Professor Latour is that he is extremely disorganized, he ended up cramming several assignments, tests and orals into the last few weeks of class.

his accent is a little hard to understand and the workbook and language labs aren't very helpful, but he definitely tries to help you if you are struggling. he even let me retake part of a test that i didn't do well on. tests are medium hard but the compositions are worth more anyway.

Pretty good teacher. Was VERY helpful outside of class if you needed help, he even let me retake part of a test when i didn't do well. he's kind of hard to understand and he doesn't really follow the syllabus. the work book and language lab aren't very useful, but the conversation hour helped.
Very nice, great dresser! Just try to keep up with the readings and participate. He has a weird love for blackboard though.

prof. latour is a great guy! he is witty in this weird kind of way...u have to go to the labs, the quizzes are directed from what we learn in class and he does not require that much, just come to class and do ur work, oh and he calls on ppl to participate, but he will not penalize you for not answering or getting questions wrong. take him

Latour is the man.  The only annoying thing about his class is that he speaks in english a little too often.  The subject material is interesting- we wrote 3 papers, and he is a relatively easy grader...plus he requires re-writes which always raises your grade(if you do them).  He's great and always available to help.
Nothing special about him.  An okay teacher.  I had taken French 1501 with Cospen before and he didn't even compare to her.
i am terrible in french but got a B plus...VISIT office hours, he is so nice and i did learn a lot...snazzy dresser too!

Ehh.  Latour knows his stuff, but he doesn't always follow his own syllabus.  I'm taking this course as a review, so tests are easy.  But he's unorganized and unclear to students taking French for the first time.  Tests are straightforward, take good notes on poems and readings in class.  Language lab requirement is a bit excessive.

prof moorman is SO nice and her class is the only one i didn't get bored of. didn't even get the textbook and still got good grades bc her lectures cover it well. participation is v important but she wont cold call on anyone. discussion boards are easy and interesting , same with screenings! ... also she radiates queer vibes lol. iconic earrings

Professor Moorman is one of my favorites at Fordham. Her lectures were interesting and relevant to current issues. There are weekly discussion boards that require you to watch a film each week. No tests but 2 papers. She's really passionate about her teaching and wants her students to succeed. Show up to class and do the work its an easy A.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Really nice teacher, easy assignments, fair grader. Take home midterm, she also gave us a really fun assignment for the final. Very enjoyable class, never makes us write long boring essays. Gives extra credit opportunities, very flexible with deadlines. Take Prof Chang if you can, she is amazing and incredibly nice.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: no words.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Chang is the BEST option for core. She is incredibly caring and considerate. I highly recommend her classes (especially for intro theo/stxt)

Prof Chang is so nice!! Just show up to class and do the work and you'll get a good grade. She's not that harsh like other professors are and she doesn't assign unnecessary amounts of work just because we're taking online classes. She's extremely understanding and knows how to engage the class in good convos + asks a lot of insightful questions!
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Let me start off and say that Professor Chang is an extremely nice and caring individual. However, her class was extremely boring. Very lecture heavy, and lots of reading involved. Despite this, there were few essays and an easy final project, so her class wasn't much of a chore. Essentially, easy but BORING.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Love Professor Chang!! She's an actual sweetheart and is probably one of the nicest professors at Fordham. I loved being in her class, it was really fun. Take her!!

professor chang is such a sweetheart. she makes class extremely easy, and tries to make lectures as engaging and fun as possible. definitely take her if you want to learn or if you're interested in theology. this is one of the best theo professors at fordham. i really enjoyed her class and will take again in the future !
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Im so confused why Professor Chang has such low ratings. During the hard time of online classes, she was INCREDIBLY giving, organized & caring. She is there for issues in class and personal issues. Im not extremely interested in theology but she made it extremely interesting and easy. Weekly blog posts, midterm, project & final. Take her for core!!
Great professor! I enjoyed Prof Chang's class. It's not an interesting class but the readings she gives are fun, and she is a really nice grader when it comes to essays.

I thought Professor Chang was a really nice and overall good professor. I remember in the Spring 2020 semester (before the dark times) she would be playing music as we walked into class! She's easy to reach out to and not very harsh on grading papers and whatnot. I highly recommend :)
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Agreed. Super sweet professor! I think last semester was overwhelming for everyone but this semester her classes are really great and I enjoy it because it's nothing too difficult. Definitely will be taking another one of Professor Chang's classes in the future.

Not a very interesting class, but I'm confused by the negativity. I think Professor Chang is very understanding and flexible, especially during COVID. She's been giving us extra credit opportunities throughout the semester and does not give a huge workload at all. She's accessible and seems to genuinely care about the wellbeing of her students.

I am currently halfway through this class and I can confidently say that it is simply the most mind-numbing class you will take at Fordham. The professor struggles to describe these 15th century texts in a way that students can understand. Furthermore, weekly writings make what should be a routine core class into a week-consuming nightmare.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: The class was incredibly lecture heavy and pretty boring. We also would do group work constantly, but for questions that didn't really require it. While the only homework was reading, the midterm was far too much. So much writing for the midterm. However, Chang is incredibly nice, but is sort of awkward in her teaching. I just think she's new at it
I agree with the other students. She puts way too much pressure on us but fails to explain or clarify the concepts so basically a waste of time.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: save yourself the stress and avoid taking this professor! there are so many other great theology profs at fordham. i don't think chang has any idea what she's doing or the amount of pressure she's putting students through. nearly all of my professors have eased up on us with grading, but chang just keeps making us do unreasonably difficult tasks.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Do not take this class. Chang makes us to group work every class where our group discussions form the basis of class notes. She herself struggles to interpret the texts and explain them in a concise manner. Also, she is an extremely difficult grader and her tests are writing HEAVY. The class average on the midterm was less than a B.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She asked us to group work every class... but she can't interpret the content well, making students more confused. Her test is the MOST difficult and unreasonable one I took in Fordham. You will be asked to write a lot of stuff that you can't memorize. Due to the coronavirus, instead of reducing our pressure, she assigned more work to do online...
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: Please do not take this class if you dont like groupwork. I went into this course thinking itd be okay because theology is an easy subject and I dont see why we need to talk to people in the class every day. I agree with the other person who said this. This professor is really unlikeable and makes things awkward as well. Never taking her again.

Extremely boring classes. She makes us group up and talk the whole time. It's college. We don't like groupwork. She doesn't realize that. All I can say is this class is boring. She doesn't interact with students after class. Never taking her again.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: good choice for faith & critical reason. midterm, final, 4 1-page reading reflections and two longer papers. classes primarily consist of group work. all reading material posted on blackboard. almost impossible to not do well

Professor Gopaldas is the best! I am not a marketing major and I am not even in the business school, so I took his class purely to learn more about marketing - and I did! There are weekly quizzes based off of video lectures and a group presentation. Simple, straightforward and cool introduction class. But truly, an even cooler professor! Take him!!

I took professor Gopaldas this spring for social marketing and I loved him and the class. One of the best Gabelli professors. He's so understanding, clear about his expectations, and makes the course very easy and manageable for his students. Definitely take him and this class!!

I've taken him twice now, what a legit amazing human being. Literally one of the nicest people on the planet who cares for his students more than anything. TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM! TAKE HIM!

Great human being! Professor Gopaldas was the most understanding, flexible, and caring professor I've had in 3 years at Fordham. He handled the conversion to online classes like a champ. He is an industry professional and it shows, as he is so extremely eager to help you grow not only as a student but an industry candidate. 10/10 guy

Super nice and genuinely wants everyone to learn about marketing. He goes out of his way to cut out the BS in the textbook and just give you what is important in the slides. He cold calls but class is basically one big discussion. He also preps you for interviews. For night class we would only be there for 1.5/3 hours max. Definitely take him.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Ahir is one of the best teachers at Fordham! I took him for Social Marketing this spring, and I would look forward to his class every week. He truly cares about his students and will form individual connections. You complete two portfolios which are very helpful to bring on interviews or send in as supplements. You will not regret taking him!!
Pretty laid back and willing to accommodate students. Clear-cut teacher who gives us time to answer problems on our own before he gives us the answer. Tests arent too bad. A solid choice

Professor Wood is honestly a really nice person, but he just is very boring. Not only is he boring, but our exams are entirely different from the questions he introduces to us in class and the ones he gives us as practice exam problems. We were all surprised with the questions that would come up the day of the exam.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Amazing teacher and person, always available to help. From someone who sucks at math, highly recommend taking.

He assigns lots of work and he can be very difficult to follow sometimes. I'm sure his teaching style may be different in person, but it was not the best over Zoom. Other than that, Prof. Wood is helpful and quick to respond to emails with any questions that you may have.

Professor Wood was not a good teacher. I wanna give him the benefit of the doubt since this semester was online, but he explained easy concepts in such confusing ways that idk how much better it would've been in person. His teaching style is so confusing- if I hadn't taken AP Stats in high school I would've been very lost. Wouldn't recommend.

This class was... fine. Lectures are pretty boring but get the job done. I took calc in high school and had an amazing teacher then, so this class was fairly easy. Pretty sure the same goes for people who haven't taken calc yet. Most of the quizzes are take-home and tests are pretty easy. Material is very accessible outside of class though.

He's kinda boring and we only met once a week but the material is easy and it's not a lot of work at all. Attendance was optional and if you didn't show up, the material was pretty easy to teach yourself from the textbook. Helpful in office hours and likes when people ask questions.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Wood was just kind of a weird guy. The only reason I passed his class was because my roommate was in it, had taken calc in high school, and knew what she was doing. We often described his class as "teaching a math class like it was an English class." He spent a lot more time on the why of calc than how to do it.

Took as an online on-campus student. Worst professor of the semester. His lectures aren't mandatory, and your "group" only meets once a week. But, after the first few weeks, if you're one of four students that actually attends, you quickly won't be. He teaches his hour-long lectures like he's being paid $1 an hour. I've never heard anyone so bored.
A great human being who really knows his stuff. FANTASTIC DUDE

Best Professor for finite for non-STEM majors. The kindest, funniest, most helpful Professor. Class often ends early, drops the lowest grades per category (HW, quiz, etc.) If youre willing to put in the work outside of class and go to office hours you are guaranteed an A.

If you are not good at math, do not take Prof. Wood. He is a math genius so he goes through things fast w little explanation. If you are good at math he is your best bet. Ends class early. Gives plenty of take-home assignments. Practice tests are exactly like the real ones. No textbook necessary. He is really funny and a good choice.

Professor Wood is one of that crazy math genius-types who thinks everyone is running in tune with his brain waves. When he lectures, he rarely stops for questions and generally is not supportive of students not understanding what he teaches. That being said, there are plenty of take-home quizzes and homework that you can score highly in. Good luck.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Took Prof Wood for Finite and as someone who hates math, it was not difficult. Along with class often starting 10 mins late & finishing 10 mins early, Prof Wood does not take attendance and is very helpful during office hours. Many of the tests and quizzes are take home.

Evan Wood's class is entertaining if nothing else. His lectures aren't particularly engaging but he's a really nice guy with frequent office hours, & he wants to see his students do well. Class usually gets out early & only one in-class quiz. Both the final and midterm had take-home components. Material is kinda abstract but overall painless class
He shows up late sometimes and ends early most days!

A must take for Finite!! He's very socially awkward which is unintentionally funny. He lectures a lot, but spends a couple of days on a concept and explains it thoroughly. Take-Home quizzes, some homework, a midterm (which is 1/3 take home) and a final is what your grade is out of. If you ask, he'll help you get the answers to hw and quizzes. TAKE!

take him. although you might end up teaching yourself a lot of the material and having to go to the office hours, his quizzes are either take home or open book, and he drops the lowest quiz grade. the midterm was half take home half in class, and the final is the same. not homework heavy at all and gives you ample time to do it.

For someone who's not good at math, this class is manageable. Professor Wood is very nice and understanding, and will let you make up tests/quizzes during his office hours. The class is mainly lectures, and he ends class early nearly every day. Most tests and quizzes have take home portions. I'd recommend this class for sure!

Hes too smart to teach. He doesnt understand why people wouldnt automatically understand the material. He also failed to teach us an equation that would significantly cut down the amount of work we have to do to when solving for the inverse of a matrix. He mumbles to himself while teaching and doesnt look students in the eyes. Not a lot of hw.

I was really expecting so much better from all the comments. He speaks way too fast so you get lost every time youre in class. Every time I leave class I feel like I unerstand the material, but when you do the work in the textbook it seems like totally different problems.

One of the best professors I've had. Take him if you want an easy A in Finite Math. He is unintentionally hilarious, and is very helpful. He drops the lowest quiz grade and half of the final was take home. He also often ends class early. Definitely one of the most chill classes I've taken
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: By far my favorite prof. nothing to really say except he really just wants you to do well and will go to any length to make sure you get a good grade even if you're not good at math. go to his office hours and you'll learn the material. just a lot of take home quizzes and funny classes where he let out early. easy A and funny guy.

He's a good guy who really helps you out! I was worried at the start but got an A. Gives extra credit, help with homework and graded take home assignments, dropped lowest quiz grade. Half the final was take home and he's so available for help! Lectures can be confusing but all graded material is straightforward. lets class out early often. TAKE HIM
Professor Wood is an easy A. I took this class to fulfill my math req and as long as you do the work he assigns you will be just fine.

Professor Wood is a decent professor. He often ends class early, and he gives lectures for the bulk of the class. The work isn't awful, and I liked that he made himself accessible outside class. He warms up to you (he's a bit awkward) and is quite nice when you ask for help. Considering the other options, Evan Wood was the best choice for me.
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had to take this class for credit and I am terrible at math but professor wood's class was completely manageable if you are willing to put in some effort. He is not tough on grading, due dates, or attendance and is a little all over the place with his notes and lectures so just make sure you pay attention. I would definitely recommend his class.
For us he drops the lowest homework grade and gave a couple extra credit questions.

Professor Wood was super straightforward. You always knew exactly what would be on each test, he wasn't trying to trick you. The class can be a little dull, but he is such a nice and funny person, that I enjoyed it anyways. In his Math Modeling class there were very few homeworks, a couple easy tests, and that's really it.
Explains simple math in theoretical terms to confuse a class full of non-math minded students. Scatter brained. Does example problems on the board for those who need them.

He is a sweet person and an easy teacher. He gives take-home quizzes and extra credit questions for you to hand in by the end of the class. He gives only one midterm and the final. Whenever he asks for homework, it is graded. He is usually late for his first class of the day and he ends class early very often. Overall, he is an easy teacher.
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Literally the easiest teacher ever. Don't even write notes and still got a 97 on the midterm. Ends every class early too

He's chill and a good guy. He doesn't explain things very well and assumes everyone knows what he's saying. A little odd, but I liked him as a person. Hated his teaching methods and lack of caring. You'll probably do well if you're already good at math. If you suck I'd opt for someone else. I suck at math and got a C+

He is so unbelievable hard. I have no idea what the other students were saying!!! After reading his reviews I thought his class was going to be great, but it is unbearable. I'm a strong math students and I can barely pass his class! I do not recommend this professor unless you want your GPA to suffer!!!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Take Professor Wood. He is able to simplify the material in a way that makes even the most complex problems seem straightforward and easy. He lets you out early almost every class so pay attention while you are there.  He will occasionally give homework and quizzes but they are just there to help you review for tests. He's also hilarious.

Although Professor Wood seems kind of awkward the first couple of days he's actually really chill and hilarious without knowing it. He really wants you to understand the concept of math not just memorizing the formulas. Offered to help a student get a concept even if everyone else already got it. Only two midterms and final so make sure you know it

I think that Professor Wood's class was one of the most straight forward classes I've taken so far at Fordham. He is a bit awkward, but you kinda get used to it. It does take a while for him to start the class, he makes it his goal to end class as early as possible. He is a great math professor and I would definitely take his class again.

For a lacking math department Wood is great.  Ends class early and material is basic.  Gives homework and occasional quizzes.  Tests are fair, you should study, he gives review sheets for each test.  Great guy overall and would take him again.
He's a funny guy that gives minimal homework, wants everyone to do well, and gives great study sheets out before tests. Take his class!

Great guy. Really interesting and passionate teacher. I would highly recommend. He's a little awkward at first but he becomes super comfortable later on in the semester. Tests are exactly the review sheet. He lets you out of class early, take him if you can!!

Wood is knowledgable and presents the material better than you might initially think that he would. The first couple of weeks, we all thought that he was odd, but once he gets to know the class, he settles in and becomes actually really funny and cool. Not the easiest class, but definitely not the hardest. He's good.

he is a good guy. at SHU math 101 seemed to be a struggle for a lot of kids. He wants to help you do well though. He is overall a nice guy. I wouldn't take the class again because I didnt do so well. Moves at a slow pace. only 4 quizzes and two tests and then a final. quizzes super easy, tests just review all the handouts and you will be fine.

Professor Wood is awesome. Content is super well explained and always provides a clear idea of what will be quizzed and tested. Extra credit problems always given and many quizzes count for extra credit too. Wants people to do well. Really really awkwardly funny, he warms up after a few weeks. Lets class out early all the time.

Such a good educator. I'm a graduating senior and think about my sophomore year with Dr. DeGregorio all the time. So clear, focused lectures, never ever annoyed to go over something again. She bought us pizza and pastries. A real gem at Fordham, thank you Dr.!

De Gregorio is so sweet and caring. She really wants her students to do well and is excited when you succeed. She gives a decent amount of homework, but it's mainly repetition of stuff you learn in class. If a lot of the students don't understand something/do poorly on a quiz, she'll spend more time in class reviewing and sometimes won't count it.

De Gregorio is so sweet and caring. Lots of homework but it's completely manageable. Classes can be boring because after going over the hw she does a lecture. Exams are super easy if you study. Easy grader and gives points back on exams. Dialogues are fun. No midterm but a final. Definitely take her!

She is so sweet, but class can be a little boring sometimes. She assigns a lot of homework. She gives a review which is the format of each test and quiz which is very helpful. Overall she is a good teacher and if you put in the effort you will get a good grade.

Dr. De Gregorio is a sweet, caring lady. She assigns a lot of homework every class, but it's actually very helpful for learning the language and studying for quizzes. She is very straight-foward with what she expects, and just really wants everyone to do well. I'm looking forward to taking her class again next semester!

Professor DeGregorio is the nicest human being Fordham has to offer. Her teaching method is so clear and her office door is open at all times for those who don't understand a concept. She does give a lot of quizzes, but none of them are surprises and all of them are meant to be grade boosters. Her class has been an utmost pleasure. Cherish her.

Lots and lots of homework. You have to be ready to put in the time and effort for sure. When you don't get something, she makes sure that you eventually get it. Great teacher if you really want to learn Italian.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Dr. De Gregorio is such a sweet lady. If she sees you struggling, she really wants to help. There is a lot of homework, but its manageable to get done an hour before class. There are quite a few quizzes and tests, but she lets you know ahead of time exactly what she is looking for on them.

Best professor I've had thus far at Fordham. A genuinely nice lady, Dr. DeGregorio goes out of her way to make sure that each and every student in her class has a fair chance to succeed. She gives A LOT of homework, but it all helps towards the quizzestests. Would HIGHLY recommend that anyone who has the chance to take her class does!
She's such a nice lady. The work is not easy but it's worth it and she is always available to help. Definitely take her if you get the chance

Not only the best in the department but one of the best professors I've had to far at Fordham. Truly cares and goes out of her way to ensure all of her students succeed and learn the material. Daily homework, multiple quizzes, exam, midterm,& final. Quizzes are basically a repeat of the HW and before all 3 exams she provided a spot on study guide!
Doctor DeGregorio is WONDERFUL. A lot of work but it's all worth it in the end. Definitely reccomend her

There is no other way to learn Italian! Dr. DeGregorio is extremely helpful and clear about what she expects. She gives a decent amount of work, but all of it is manageable and it will help you to understand what you are learning. I DEFINITELY recommend her!

She is so sweet and helpful. I definitely recommend this class. Daily homework and quizzes almost every class but they are easy points.  A couple of tests, a midterm and a final also make up the grade. Class requires work but she really makes you understand the material and helps you whenever you are confused.

TAKE THIS CLASS. She is an amazing professor who truly cares. It is a lot of work... daily quizzes, longer quizzes, exams, midterm and final, oh and daily homework, but it reflects what you do in class. It is not difficult and depending on the situation she lets you retake quizzes and exams. Great class.

Memorization is key! Daily Quizes, tons of hw every night, and lots of memorization! But I still enjoyed the course, and she is a great professor. Shes very clear with what she expects you to do. I'd take her.

I love this woman. She is friendly and patient and makes Italian easy to learn. I would take her again with no questions. There's some busy work, but it's all worth it. It's the only way to learn the language.
love her! she is the sweetest woman ever, tells you whats going to be on tests, is there for extra help whenever you need her, just awesome!
She is a great teacher. She explains everything clearly, is available for extra help, and the tests are doable.
Love this teacher! totally helpful and nice...do the work and stay on top of it and you'll be fine..she's great

Great teacher! She is very helpful, and really wants her students to do well. Her tests are easy if you study. Also, always do your homework,the only time she gets angry(which is to say not very angry) is when students aren't prepared.
rele rele helpful! makes learning a language simple! rele great teacher!

Very nice lady, class is very organized and straightforward. Lets you hand in assignments up to a week late. Should be an easy A if youve ever taken a language in high school and are used to memorizing vocab. Grade based on HW assignments (once a week), language labs, easy short quizes, midterm and final. Def. the best Italian professor at Fordham.
Really nice, always willing to help, summer class went pretty fast. She tells you whats on each quiz, midterm, and final so you know what to study, VERY easy compared to some other classes

Professor Charles does give a decent amount of readings, but he is very engaging and thoughtful in his lectures when he goes over them. There is no fluff content in his class, it's all purposeful and involves thinking. He is a pleasure in class and great at engaging with the students, and encourages participation. Solid course.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Charles is the hardest professor I've had by far. And that says a lot! The material he presents is very complex for an introductory theology class. I wish I knew what I was getting myself into when I decided to take his class. I had to read the readings twice, sometimes three times, to understand them. Would not recommend. Beware!
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Charles is very caring about students and a pleasant man. He encourages participation and welcomes different ideas. However, the readings are often long. The papers are difficult and he grades harshly. The course was interesting and engaging up until the midterm, then it got repetitive and the readings got hard. Class just got too boring.

Professor Charles is one of the best Professors I've had in a while. He knows his stuff! Beware, there is a lot of reading, and they are very long. He just discusses it in class and encourages conversation. Only graded on essays, midterm, and final. He cares deeply for his students.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor! Very relaxed just a lot of reading, but he goes over them in detail a lot during class. Not much homework besides reading and maybe 3-5 short papers of 5 pages max. Responds to emails fairly fast and likes participation.

By far my favorite professor at Fordham. Professor Turan has a deep understanding of the material, but more importantly she knows how to teach. She doesn't want to give an overview but instead gives you a rich understanding. Many may find her grading harsh, I found it very fair. Her lectures have the perfect harmony of engagement, humor, and info.

took so long to give back graded work. sprung a take home midterm exam on us with two hours of warning on a friday night to be finished by midnight. That really sucked. the textbook was so helpful. SUPER tough grader, doesn't give any feedback on returned work. pretty funny in her own way. genuinely cares about the material.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Prof Turan is extremely knowledgeable about the subject, but she also does a fantastic job of contextualizing the history from various perspectives so you really get a sense of what different conflicting groups of people were thinking. If you know almost nothing about Islam and the Middle-East like I did, I highly recommend this crash course.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Turan is truly a fantastic lecturer. Her knowledge of medieval Islamic history is truly endless, and she never fails to make her classes interesting, informative, and inspirational. She is a tough grader and really makes one work for their grade. However, the feedback she gives is thorough and will certainly make you a better writer!

Prof. Turan is really caring and passionate about the material of the course. However, she is a very tough grader and there isn't a lot of room to redeem yourself. She lectures for the entirety of every class but I found the material very interesting. She is a good teacher but sometimes grades a bit harshly. She has an accent so be ready for that.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is very knowledgable and passionate about her subject, but she is a very tough professor. Very tough grader, which is frustrating since there is not much opportunities to redeem yourself.

Incredibly disorganized. Springs a 2000 word essays on the class out of nowhere, whether we had that class that day or not. One time we got a 2000 word essay due midnight at 5pm on a Friday. However, she is very sweet and if you love history you might like her.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Turan is a GEM. The workload isn't so bad (you don't need the textbook but it helps), and she's a tough grader, but she legitimately cares about her students and wants you to do well. She's very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject, and you can learn a lot. Be ready to memorize, and an A is very much achievable.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Professor Turan is super straight forward from the beginning that she grades her papers harshly. However, she also tells you exactly what she is looking for when it comes to the midterm/final so it is possible to do well. If you work hard and take very detailed notes, you can definitely get an A in her class.

Professor Turan is a knowledgeable professor. Nevertheless, she is a hard grader and definitely makes you work for your grade. Therefore, do not expect an easy A especially on essays; however, it is possible to do well on tests/quizzes. You should also have a genuine interest in the subject. I do not regret taking her and will be taking her again.
ratingTags: Tough grader--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Turan is an amazing professor. She really cares about her students and is a very fair grader. Her lectures are very interesting and she is always available to give her students help. She is by far one of the best professors at Fordham. Take her if you love history!

Prof Turan is one of the most committed professors I've ever had. Her entire class is her talking about material--no projects, 2 papers, a few quizzes but she tells you in advance. TOUGH grader--looks for the smallest details. Big on note taking--if you miss a lecture you will miss a century of history. Genuinely loved the material and her.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If you want a class that is easy to follow, DO NOT take this class. She only lectures with absolutely no use of powerpoints or any sort of aid to help note-taking. She grades papers and tests way too harshly and expects you to memorize pages worth of material for each term (there are 20 terms) and spout it back. A smart lady but too unflexible.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She tells you from the get-go what she expects on her exams and papers. Follow the guidelines and you'll do fine. She is a tough-grader though and has high expectations. Do the readings especially from the textbook to understand her lectures better. Overall, work hard, attend the lectures, and you'll get an A.

I would highly recommend taking any class by this semester if you're actually interested in learning about the subject. She does an amazing job of teaching the information and does so in an unbiased way--which is tricky given the subject matter. Be prepared to pay attention and take notes if you want to do well!
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor I've had at Fordham. All of her lectures are fun and interesting, class is never boring. Extremely nice and funny. Definitely a difficult class but so worth it.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: look she is very specific with what she wants on her papers and tests, but her guidelines are pretty clear. Her lectures are like storytelling time- they're super interesting with a bit of her dry humor. never even opened the textbook just take good notes ( i recommend you audio record them).
ratingTags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is eye-opening and amazing. She can be intimidating but is also funny and relaxed. Very tough grader though. I got a D on the midterm and a B overall thanks to curving.

Insanely inflexible with rescheduling exams. I was sick for a midterm and she was a total nightmare, saying that the only time I could take it was the same time I had another midterm. The dean ended up proctoring but she gave me low grades without any feedback whatsoever. Bottomline: If you miss an exam, don't bother rescheduling, just withdraw.

Tough class but with an awesome prof. She is very lecture heavy so be prepared to take a lot of notes. She is also tough grader on her essay's but she pretty much tells you exactly what is on the tests. If you take the class seriously, you will get an A.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This is the AP of history classes at Fordham - it is clear that people are taking this course for a reason. Not for an easy A, but for an intelligent teacher. Ebru Turan is by far one of the best professors Fordham has to offer. Get ready to work hard
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hands down most intelligent teacher I've had. By no means is this class an easy A. Grades the papers brutally. If you meet with her, (always available to meet), she will take the time to review.  If you put in the work, your grade will reflect that. Its not that she wants you to fail (as the person stated below), but she wants to challenge you.
ratingTags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Doesn't want you to succeed. Would not recommend taking this class. Went to several office hours, not helpful, not usually available. Lectures are engaging but often repetitive. Unnecessarily tough grader--will say "if you study, you will get an A"-not the case!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr Turan is very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject material. Unlike most history professors at Fordham, she keeps all her lectures interesting and engaging with a touch of humor to add. She is very aware of the fact that history is seldom biased and thus does a good job of always addressing the different points of views and biases. 5/5
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Best professor I've had at Fordham. Gives tear-jerking and hilarious lectures, I beg my friends to take a class with her. The first day of class she said, you will hear, people say I'm the devil, this is true.  Comically difficult but she doesn't hide the ball and if you work for it, you can get an A. Worth working hard for. Passionate soul.

Professor Turan is extremely knowledgeable about all things Mideast and extremely passionate. Her lectures are super interesting but very packed and important. She is one of the toughest graders I have ever had at Fordham in terms of essays and essays in exams. Her class is so interesting but you need to put in 5xs the work you think you do.

Professor Turan is an amazing lecturer. Her lectures are really interesting and full of knowledge. Love it. and take tons of notes or you will fail on the exams. Don't rent or buy any textbook. It's not necessary. Midterm and Final really killed me and my friend. We wrote notes on three giant boards in order to memorize everything. Super strict

She's a tough grader and memorization of the information is necessary; however, regardless of these aspects, this history class has been the best class I've taken so far. Her lectures are never boring and she throws in humor into the lecture to make Islamic History sound like a drama. Take the class!!!

This class is by no means easy. She grades all of the papers unbelievably harsh, but in the end, the midterm and final matter the most, which you probably won't pass unless you know every single little detail. However, it is doable, and it is so worth it. The subject is current and interesting and she can teach it better than anyone else.

Ebru is easily the most intelligent professor I have had. Her lectures are very interesting and she has so much humor and wit. She is a very harsh grader on papers, but if you write to her standards you will be fine. If you take good notes, you will be able to do well on her midterm and final. But you need every single important detail.

Professor Turan is strict, to say the least. You need to take thorough notes and study like your life depends on it for her tests. Difficulty aside- she's one of the best professors I've ever had. She teaches her class like she's telling a story, and she adds great humor to her lectures. Yeah she's tough but it's so worth it for a great professor.

She comes off as tough, but is actually sweet and hilarious! As long as you write down every word that comes out of her mouth and can reproduce that on the midterm and final exam, you will be in very good shape.  Participate in class, complete your papers on time, and you will find this class very rewarding.

I loved this class. It was interesting and I feel that I learned a lot. However, it is not easy. It requires a lot of work, and you have to pay constant attention in class. Take a lot of notes, and you'll be fine for the tests. The quizzes aren't bad either. The papers are very difficult though. Great class.
Awesome. Smart. Enthusiastic. Intersting. Definitely an eye-opening class

You will learn so, so much with Professor Turan. Her lectures are so engaging and easy to follow, and the topic itself is very interesting. Yes, she is a hard grader on the papers, but they don't count as much as the 3 quizzes, midterm, and final, all of which are easy. She is a fantastic professor and I highly recommend you take this class.

This is easily the hardest class i've ever taken. 2 pop quizzes(easy), a midterm and final, which are average and 2 mandatory essays which she grades like the DEVIL. they're each worth 10% of your grade and she gives out 3s and 4s (out of 10) like its her job. She's hilarious and super smart, but impossible and will ruin your GPA :(
Professor Turan is a great teacher who is passionate about her subject and has an awesome accent. The class is enormously difficult but definitely worth taking.

She knows her history, and she wants you to learn it. Love her as a teacher but as a foreign transfer student I got a 610 instead of a 910 for grammar mistakes which is a bit anoying. If you want good grades look somewhere else but if you want a challenging and extremelly instructing class she is your professor

Here's the deal- I love Turan's Islamic history class. She is a brilliant professor and you learn a lot of very interesting material. I don't regret taking this class, but my grade is definitely suffering. Take her seriously when she says she gives bad grades because she "has a reputation to uphold".

Prof. Turan is an extremely hard grader & she takes pride in it. Unless you really like history and you're really interested, take the course. Just be ready. She is biased. Midterm, final, two essays, two pop quizzes & a map quiz. Beware. Don't be fooled; she will fail you. She gives bad grades for fun and "to keep her reputation," like she says.

I took Islamic History and Culture; it was a very interesting course. Professor Turan gives a lot of reading from the textbook, but it is not discussed in class and never pop up. She is an extremely hard grader and she grades on a personal level. Don't offend her people (I got a 310 on an essay for siding with christians). That essay was worth 20%
She honestly gives bad grades for giggles

Prof. Turan is a very hard grader, but her class is  informative and interesting. Read ALL of her assigned readings, because you will have pop quizzes on them. At the end of the semester you will realize that you've learned a lot from her. Be sure to pay attention in class, final grades are greatly affected by class participation.

Where to begin..You will learn A LOT, but at the price of your GPA. I once infamously received a 4/10 on a paper with the lone comment "this paper lacks proper analysis." Nearly impossible to get an A in this class. I don't even think she could get an A in her own class.

History of the Modern Middle East was not only one of the most interesting classes I took, it was also one of the saddest. As for the papers, just prove that the document is showing what you're learning in class. Also, participation counts for a lot, and it should be fairly easy to participate since it only requires reading the textbook.

Prof. Turan is a stickler about attendance and paying attention. She commands respect from students. She is very nice, however, and always reasonable. She knows the history like the back of her hand-absolutely brilliant. If you want a class with an expert, take her!

Took her for Modern Middle East. Personally, Dr. Turan is an awesome professor. She's passionate about her subject and Very helpful in office hours. However, her expectations for papers are not clear, and her feedback isn't helpful. Still, If you're ready for a challenging but rewarding class, take Turan

Excellent teacher, very passionate about subject, her lectures cover everything for the final.  Grades papers on hard side but midterm and final straight from notes.  Very approachable and loves to interact with students. One of my favorite professors at Fordham.

Professor Turan is a great professor! She may be a little harsh at times but she knows her history and is extremely approachable! As long as you don't sleep with class and meet with her during her office hours, you will be fine! Fordham is increasing in the ranks, don't expect it to be easy anymore!

Here's the deal She knows everything about history,but a VERY hard grader and demanding of the information u need to know She lectures for the entire class & write down a lot cause those are ur only notes. She rips apart ur papers. quizzes u have to study a lot if u wanna do well. Theres imp info to learn, but don't take if u want an A

I am an A- /A student at Fordham..Turan is an extremely harsh/unfair grader. Although she is extremely passionate about middle eastern studies,it is nearly impossible to do well after the first quiz. Turan is the only teacher I regret taking after 2 years at Fordham. Avoid if you can. If you can't, be sure to take excellent notes.

She is a fine teacher (at least in an intro level course). Pretty easy if you pay attention during class and take notes. Has a Turkish accent but that isn't a problem; class is interesting. Course included some quizzes, five short essays, and a fair final. It's easy to avoid, but she'll take off more points than a mistake or omission is worth.

this woman is absolutely wonderful .. i love her like crazy .. she is so intelligent and teaches like she has been for a billion years ..she is really interesting and fun and is extremelyyyyyyyyyyy smart .. you won't regret taking her ..she is by far the best female prof. at fordham .. and she is great at what she does ..she is better than a lot!

take good notes because the midterm and final are composed of questions that come directly from the notes. they're not hard if you study. you dont have to read because participation isnt necessary and everything that is important shell cover in class. there is also a 5pg paper that isnt too hard. the class in interesting & she holds your attention.
Two thumbs up.

One of the most invaluable classes I have taken here at Fordham. Of course the class was hard because it was alot of information and Turan covers alot in a short amount of time.  But she explains things very well and there's no major surprises on the test. 2 exams and 1 5pg paper. Definitely take here for history!

she's a nice lady n all but she assigns so much work tht its way too demanding even for a nerd i mean cmon we have lives and i dont even mean that cliche-wise but seriously no one could devote tht much time into readings like she expects ...she's just got way too much goin on she acts like we re gettin phdz in dis its relli unfair beware of turan!
shes relli nice but shes relli hard ...which makes her not nice

Prof Turan is one of my favorite professors! The class definetly takes a lot of work. She gives a lot of reading assignments but they are not necessary. If you go to class every day and take good notes you will be fine. She is extremely smart and you actually learn something useful in her class! If you are at all interested in this subject take her

extremely intelligent and prepared; all lectures are outlined in detail. great sense of humor and incredibly nice. she is a FAIR grader (if you're dumb/lazy, don't take?)... this class was very enriching and rewarding. midterm, paper, final.

Before i took her class i was very interested in ME history. She is a horrible teacher, difficult to understand, biased and completely ruined all interest i had in the subject matter. If you take her you'll have to teach yourself everything. her class is really boring too

Take Turan if you are interested in actually learning about the subject matter. I am someone who gravitates toward the easy classes, but this was an exception that I'm really glad I made. She is a great teacher who is amazingly knowledgable about the subject and is extremely prepared. Also looks pretty hot sometimes.

Definately take this class.  Intro to Mid East history is by far my fav core class.  The material is difficult but very interesting and she grades very fairly.  She's a very good teacher, although once in a while she can be confusing.  Overall I really enjoy this class.  Everyone should take it!

Dr. Turan is so smart & she tries to keep the class fun & interesting and Intro to Middle Eastern History is definitely one of my favorite classes! There's a lot of reading, and you're required to study and apply some effort, but she's a fair/generous grader & she also really cares about each student. quizzes weren't that hard. Very valuable class

haha this is hilarious but sad ...prof turan is an absolutely TERRIFIC prof .. it's pathetic to see how unwilling students are to just READ A BOOK or two for a class in such a prestigious university ..turan is an amazingly sweet and generous grader ...her class was very easy ..she couldn't have made it any easier ..

wow, I'm actually surprised to hear that Prof Turan didn't give the person who's dad got a heart attack an extension ..she's actually really nice and very intelligent .. she's pretty when she dresses up! she's very willing to help if you contact her and she always responds to e-mails ..she isn't super easy but she's not evil AT ALL ..

wow i don't even know where to begin... she can't keep my attention, i thought the middle east would be interesting .. um not with this prof. ...shes is an extremly nice person... her 2 quizes are ridiculous no midterm and one paper... she is so confusing and give too much information at once and leaves you grasping nothing she has taught.

great person. but she can't teach. knows everything there is to know about the middle east, but doesn't know how to transfer that into her students. quizzes are incredibly unfair and hard. lectures are monotonous and hard to follow. nothing is written on the board during class. worst and most unfair class i've ever taken in fordham. HORRIBLE . . ..

I thought Middle Eastern History was a great course. She was a bit unclear with some things on the lecture, but gave us outlines of the material before each class. If you review those before the quizzes and tests, you'll do just fine. The one paper we had was kinda difficult, but I thought she graded it pretty easily. Overall, I'd recommend it.

OMFG...this had to be the worst course that I ever took in my entire career. i wanted to die in that course. We only had two quizzes (15 points each) each on like a million chapters of stuff...so you study and the chance that the stuff that you comes out on the quiz is like 1/100 chance. her lectures are boring as well. Tough grader. no midterm. BA
worst teacher ever, super hard. she gives no notes just lectures for 1hr 15min. very unfair grader. no gets over a b

Before taking the class I was really excite. She is a horrible teacher, thick accent takes a while to get use to. Give few assignments, test over 6 centuries with 8 questions. Extremely difficult grader. No one gets an A, and extremely biased. I couldn't even get an extension when my father had a heart attack@!
No Comments

Taught myself the entire course. Basically just makes you watch 3 hours of lectures online every week and take a quiz every other week. Synchronous meetings we just discuss the quizzes. Exams aren't terrible if you can teach yourself. I was honestly afraid to ask questions, he's very rude + condescending. My least favorite class of the semester

I went in seeing his rating thinking he couldn't be that bad, I WAS WRONG. Ask him for help? next class expect to have a rant on the agenda where he calls everyone incompetent and says he doesn't have time for your problems. Our class average was never above a 70, and I don't know a single person who was able to finish an exam. Horrible!!!

The HARDEST class I've ever taken at Fordham. Teaches to a camera he sets up in class to post it on his Youtube channel. Average in this class almost never exceeds 70 and he assigned an extremely long final project last minute. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I had him in person, he was terrible, teached to the camera, never explained concept, and also used a program called tophat which was later deemed to be a security hazard

Calc isn't easy and Jhevon didn't make it any easier. VERY tough grader but is usually generous with curves. He's a nice enough guy but wasn't very willing to put in work to help students be successful, and seemed to view office hours and questions as a chore rather than a chance to help students. Averages for most stuff was a 50/60.... skip him

I would not recommend taking this professor. His lectures on YouTube are very long and unclear. He is a nice man and understanding but will not give you an extension and is a very tough grader. He also does not give that much time for quizzes or tests so be prepared. Overall, terrible class, and when he cannot explain something he will be rude.

I've never felt compelled to write a teacher review but my experience with this one was so bad I had to. Jhevon is the worst teacher I've ever had. Made us pay an extra $80 for a homework platform and his hour-long Youtube lectures have ads every 7 minutes. He is passive-aggressive and straight-up MEAN. Jhevon if you're reading this: get therapy.

really enjoyed this class and found him to be a great professor. You definitely need to put some time in to study and practice but if you do you can do well. If you don't do well on the midterm but show a lot of improvement on the final he will change your grade. Did have weekly or semi-weekly quizzes and hard online hw but he is willing to help
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Avoid this professor at all COSTS. If you want to have a miserable semester take this class. Jhevon makes you watch these hour long lectures that waste your time. Half of the time hes  ranting about our generation. Dont email him because hell just mention how unnecessary your email was and how its your fault for not understanding the material.

He puts ads in his lectures. ADS. Every 7 minutes an ad will pop up during the asynchronous lectures and its horrible. He is mean, and totally not flexible or understanding of students. Would never recommend to anyone.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Just down right horrible. I would never recommend Jhevon to anyone. He ridicules students for asking questions, doesn't teach at all, and then spends most of class ranting about how poorly everyone is doing. He is the prime example of a terrible teacher.

I. Hate. Jhevon. He seems friendly and quirky when the semester first starts, but he is rude, and a horrible teacher. He focuses way too much on the theory behind the math, instead of just teaching the math. Whenever anyone asked a question or got an answer wrong he had a habit of making them feel stupid. Very homework heavy. would not recommend.

Professor Smith was professional and organized. He has a great background in mathematics, and most definitely knows what he is talking about. However, his teaching style focuses heavily on mathematical theory that quite frankly, 95% of the class does not need to know and is equally annoying to learn. Additionally, he seemed "standoffish" at times.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Fordhams math department is atrocious. Jhevon is a prime example of why. Hes a young professor so you would think hed take all this feedback and improve his teaching but for some reason he doesnt. I took his class while taking Gen. Chem and Intro Bio yet somehow Jhevons class was the hardest and required the most work.

Honestly, one of the worst teachers Ive ever had. Transferred into his class late and tried to catch up to the curriculum during office hours and he was dismissive the entire time. Incoming first years should pray they dont have him assigned and if they do drop him IMMEDIATELY.

Honestly I dont advise you to take this class , If so good luck. Spent overwhelming hours in the math tutor however sometimes the tutors (professors with degrees) would be in such shock that jhevon was giving his students these types of problems. If you dont take notes just get ready for a zero. Classes dont even correlate to the exams/quizzes!?

Jhevon is not the worst math professor out there. However, be prepared for a professor who teaches to a camera and writes useless derivations on the board that you don't need to know. He does write all of his notes on the board and his tests are pretty similar to the review shets. Be prepared for at least one curveball and a stressful final project
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Worst teacher I've ever had. Tells us we don't need the textbook, but his lectures are too fast to follow that you can't even learn the lesson without rushing the notes. Makes you feel stupid for asking simple questions. Assumes you should already be. Made me feel so unwelcome during office hours and suggest I use math tutors instead.

Jhevon is a nice guy, but his lectures are way too fast. It's hard to grasp everything, and homework is difficult. Grade mainly relies on three exams which are really hard. He does record lectures and posts review sheets which are helpful, but the material is very tough and is not taught well in my experience. This class caused me a lot of stress.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Aweful experiene in a math class. So much homework that does not apply to the class. Uses a third party website for the homework that he insists on keeping even though it is meant for math maticians; tutors do not know how to do the problems... i have tried to get help. Hard tests that require a lot of studying. Overall, dont take this class.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor! Literally writes everything he says on the board which is good because when you read back on notes it's very helpful. He gives examples on the board but in order to do good on his weekly quizzes, LOOK AT TEXTBOOK! His study guides for exams are extremely helpful. His teaching style is, in my opinion, very good.

Jhevon is an interesting guy. His lectures are really long and boring. There are weekly quizzes that are hard, but there is extra credit. Didn't give much homework (he didn't know how to use the homework format).Three exams: 1 midterm, 1 a week before the final, and a final. All of them are hard, but use his study guides (almost replicas of exams).

Its pronounced JUH-von not JAY-von. And for everyone wondering, hes Jamaican. In any case, hes got wisdom that exceeds any mere mortals feeble comprehension. You may hate him while you have him, but he knows what hes doing. In making you work hard, hes teaching you how to learn and improve, skills beneficial not just for math, but for life.

Look, I do not want to just outright bash Professor Smithhe actually does put a lot of effort into his lectures, and you can even access them online. That being said, I would say that your experience in this class HEAVILY DEPENDS on whether or not you 1) learned math before 2) enjoy learning math. Because if you don't, then this class will be hell
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This was my hardest class this semester and it really shouldnt have been. Nice guy but kinda arrogant when you dont understand something. However, gives review sheets before tests that are almost identical to the format of the test but the review sheets will be a lot easier than his tests.

Jhevon is an interesting guy. Kind of stern on the surface but he's actually pretty cool if you get to know him. He had a project at the end of the year which was unnecessarily stressful, along with a test and a final. You're gonna have to put a bit of work in to get a good grade in his class, but it's not too hard to get an A.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: This class was pretty difficult. Weekly quizzes and lots of homework assignments online. Quizzes were either easy A's or the entire class would come out with something below 60. He gives a lot of partial credit if you go to him, though! He is also funny and kind. Not impossible, but you definitely have to work hard and I recommend going to him!
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Gave us a test and a project one week before finals.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awful awful awful. I tried my very best in this class and yet this class ruined my GPA. He assigns way too much homework and all of the questions he assigns aren't necessarily helpful for his exams.

For Finite, he's really not bad at all. Jhevon is a really cool guy and is super easy to talk to. There's a ton of homework but it helps because it forces you to do it and drill it in for the exams. The end of the semester is way too crammed with work but the rest of the semester is honestly fine as long as you do your work and participate.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Jhevon's class is almost all lecture until a group project at the end of the semester. His teaching is fine except that he teaches as though calculators haven't been invented. The homework is frequent and depending on how well you can teach yourself could be pretty difficult.
ratingTags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Avoid at absolutely all costs.

Worst professor I have taken. Spends so much time writing unnecessary information on the board when he could be going over multiple problems. If you memorize his study guides (which is the only way to "study") & he changes the question up, good luck knowing what steps to take. If you previously took calc you might but okay but I learned nothing.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Horrible professor. Gave two exams back to back along with the final all because HE didn't realize the little time we had left in the semester. Do not take him.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Umm I would recommend not taking this class if you want an easy A. He is a horrible professor that is late to class every day. Please, do yourself a favor and don't take him
Condescending and ridiculous work load. Not an easy A. He also takes off for the littlest things. Point blank: Don't take him!

Jhevon taught the material in a way that was very easy to understand and was very helpful at office hours. Willing to give better grades if you showed up for help. Quizzes and homework due every week were a drag but definitely helped learn the material.

He's a really good professor in that he explains everything really clearly. If you have any questions he's always accessible during office hours. His exams aren't bad because he gives you review sheets before hand in which the exam is very similar to. He even records his lectures so if you miss one you can always watch it on youtube. Great teacher!
ratingTags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: There really is no reason to do poorly in his class, especially when all his lectures are posted online. He gives Test Reviews prior to each exam which is extremely alike to the actual exam. He was always available outside of class. He does give a lot of homework which I felt was the only downside. Otherwise, he was an awesome professor.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: sometimes he's nice, sometimes he's condescending. gives a lot of homework and quizzes. lectures are long and informative but are NEVER useful for the exams. you basically go over his practice test and hope for the best. AVOID if you've never taken calc before, you'll be lost most of the time.

Assigns way too much hw and even though he is a good lecturer, his grading IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST. Takes off the for the littlest things with no partial credit.....!!!! He cares about his students and drops the lowest 2 quizzes, 2 absences, 2 homeworks and even a test. Aviod if you can.
not a bad person but assigns unreal amounts of work/very harsh grader. came to class late a lot. accessible outside of class, but not always helpful

Very friendly and a great lecturer. From a theological standpoint, his lectures are a bit questionable. I went to a Catholic high school and my theology class there taught me 10x more than this class. A lot of reading with almost no other assignments. Weekly quizzes are a joke and asks very specific questions just to see if you did the reading.
ratingTags: Respected--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Scirghi is a lot of work but a lot of fun. If you're looking for a professor who will help you fix your writing and challenge you, Professor Scirghi is a great choice. If you are not someone who works well with too much challenge, I will avoid him at all costs. He is a great educator but is very hard and can be very accommodating.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: If you can take this man for Theo1000 do it!! His lectures are really insightful and interesting, even if you aren't catholic. He has a weekly 5 question multiple choice quiz, if you read what's assigned, you pass. Participate once per class and he'll love you. Gives outlines each class, studies those for the midterm and final and you're good!
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He's a really great theology professor if you pay attention in class. Quizzes once a week on the reading, but he was very clear on the midterm guidelines. As long as you pay attention in class and take notes on what he's saying, you'll get an A. He's also super willing to meet outside of class, highly recommend taking advantage of that
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Fr. Schirghi is a very nice man, but sort of old-fashioned. He calls on people without them raising their hands so always come prepared. I liked him a lot
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Fave prof! Do the readings, engage in class and you've got a solid shot at an A. Quizzes every week on the 2 readings from that week, which are not hard (if you read them...). Helps if you take notes on readings, and definitely take notes in class!! He's super engaging and uses personal anecdotes to explain. Show up, study, and go to office hours.

Thomas Scirghi was a great professor for Faith & Critical Reason. He's a bit of a hardass--doesn't like when people come in late, that sort of thing. Pop quizzes every week focused on what you've been working on. Offers opportunities for extra credit. Lectures are INCREDIBLE--very insightful, understanding, & funny guy. Challenging but worth it.

Father Scirghi is the best professor I have had at Fordham. His lectures are captivating and they keep me engaged. He took a topic I may have found boring and really made it intriguing. The class is by no means easy, but if you work hard, read and study, you'll do well. He also notices hard work and is appreciative of it. A caring and funny man.

He is sooooooo boring! A one page response on a heavy reading is due EVERY week. If you don't read or take notes you will fail. You have to write down everything, and I mean EVERYTHING he says, just to possibly pass this class. He is very old fashioned and strict. What I dislike most is how tough of a grader he is.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Fr. Scirghi is one of the best profs Definitely not an easy A, but if you put in the work and go to his office hours, it is possible. Fr. is willing to help you & wants you to succeed. He uses his preaching skills to create engaging and thoughtprovoking lectures, which encourage everyone to participate. Assignments help u to understand the material

I loved class with Father Scirghi. He truly wants you to succeed and is willing to help in any way he can if you just seek him out. He is an engaging professor and has clear outlines of each lecture to facilitate easy note-taking.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: One of my only regrets at Fordham is not having taken a class taught by Fr. Scirghi before my senior year. His subtle humor, well-structured lectures, and genuine caring personality taught me exactly what a professor should be--a real hidden gem. Take this man's class if you have a chance--it's hard work, but he makes it worth it.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I was so lucky to be placed into Fr. Scirghi's Faith & Critical Reason class. He's a great professor who's very engaging when he speaks. Usually I don't like professors who don't write on the board much but this guy's different. There's a weekly quiz on readings so be sure to do those, even if they're difficult! Lots of extra credit opportunities!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Father Scirghi is by far one of THE best professors I've had. I didnt have an interest in theology, but his class is great. He's a brutal grader but it makes you a better writer. Visiting him in office hours is great because he's very easy to talk to and he makes your opinion feel valued and it's easy an comfortable to participate in his class.

Fr. Scirghi is an incredible professor. He assigns a lot of reading but makes sure to discuss it in class to make sure his students understand. He cares about his students, giving them every opportunity to do well; he's very accommodating. As long as you show up, do the readings and show him respect, you'll do fine.
A brutally tough grader. I worked my butt off to scrape together a B-. He's a good teacher, but be prepared to work, especially if this is a class you're taking during your first semester.

Initially there was some confusion about what we needed to know, mid way through the semester someone asked about whether he could give us sheets to take notes on and it became a lot more clear, he actually made them. If you go to him in office hours once or twice he will love you and it makes the whole thing a lot easier.

I really enjoyed this class, but it was definitely hard work. At first it seemed that he grades essays a bit harshly, but he actually grades very fairly. If you go to his office hours, he is very nice and helpful; plus, he is a Jesuit! You definitely have to do the readings for this class though; he calls on people.

Scirghi is one of the most close-minded individuals that I have ever met. He shoves his opinions down your throat, calls you out in class for not reading, and plays favorites. I got an A in the course, but dreaded going to class every week. You must do the readings, or he will humiliate you in front of the class...trust me I've seen him do it.

Scirghi is a hard grader, but VERY fair. My first essay of the semester I got a 6 out of 10, which he said was good..I made only a few changes (grammar ,wording) and he bumped it up to a 10. On every essay after that, I have gotten above an 8. You MUST do the readings, he will call you out if you don't. Approachable, FUNNY, and a Jesuit...take him!
Awful! Run! Run as fast as you can! Never seen such a rude, condescending Professor in my life!. He constantly belittles people, and makes absolutely no sense when explaining things.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Super condescending and gets mad when you are not understanding what he's saying. On top of that, I was bored half to death. Would never take again.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I took Professor Quinn for Comp II and Text and Context and I must say at first I was intimidated based on the reviews, but after the second class meeting, I felt more at ease. He is a tough grader. He assigns an essay every week. as long as you attend class and do the assignments you will work with you. He gives only gives a midterm and a final.

I had a very difficult time with his grading style. While the class is challenging, he fails to recognize that this is a composition 2 class, and not a PHD level course. Hes notoriously difficult with his grades. He is a smart guy, so if you dont care about your GPA and want to be challenged, then take his class.
He will grade everything you wrote. Very hard professor. Dont take him.

Very good and kind Professor. Tries very hard to be clear on everything so you can understand and is very welcoming to any questions students might have. Hes very clear and precise without being rude which I like.

Loved this class. Such a breeze compared to the other classes and I loved Prof Nassif. Overall a great guy who was very understanding about the transition into college. A few short essays in the beginning but nothing hard. Mostly opinion-based! Lectures were good, cameras mandatory but it was a very small class. Overall recommend him 100%!!!!!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Although, there isn't a lot of papers in this class, homework definitely makes up for it. He actually assigns entire books for you to read. If you missed class or wanna email him, chances are 90% of the time he won't respond; the rest of my classmates have agreed with me on this issue. If you can get a better professor, he's a plausible choice.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I had him for comp 2 and took him again for texts and contexts and he makes class a very good experience and his grading is clear and he wants his students to do well. I would totally take him again.

Took Prof. Nassif for comp 2. He's a super cool guy and chose awesome texts for us to read. There was a three page paper due each class which was quite a lot but he's a fair grader. We had an in-class essay for midterm, a 10 page research paper, and a 5 page final paper. Lots of writing but totally recommend

Professor Welborn is probably the best professor I have had at Fordham. He is so kind, really cares about his students, and is incredibly passionate about what he does. I definitely recommend taking his class; it was a pleasure to be taught by him!

Larry was seriously the greatest professor I have EVER taken at Fordham. I purposely have been looking for another class to take with him because I enjoyed his previous theology class.
