He is so kind and so thoughtful and just really really cares about his students. Definitely take him if you have the opportunity, you won't regret it.
Just the sweetest, kindest professor I have ever had. Please take him! You will not regret it!

Larry is probably one of the best liberal arts professors I have had. I do not like theology but his passion for the class made me interested. There are two tests and two papers, but he is a very generous grader. His excitement for the class is captivating and it makes theology not only bearable, but enjoyable. Totally worth taking him!

100% recommend Prof. Welborn. Exams include term identification so make sure to go to class and take notes (sometimes they're in the book and sometimes not). You can send him drafts of your papers which is helpful. I wouldn't say it's an easy A but if you just go to class, take notes, and read some of the passages, you can do really well.

Professor Welborn is an extremely passionate caring professor. Prior to his class I was not interested in Theology but his lectures and enthusiasm changed this. His class consists of a midterm, final, 5+ page paper and a 10+ page paper, each one worth 25 percent. If you pay attention in class and seek guidance on assignments the class is an Easy A.

A great prof who is very caring and knowledgeable. 2 papers (5 & 10 pgs), a midterm, and a take-home final- 25% each. Do the readings, show up, and go to office hours and you'll be fine. Papers seem difficult, but he breaks them down for you. If you've studied the Gospels with some detail before, the first half of the semester is easy. highly recom

Professor Welborn is the nicest and most inspiring professor I have ever had at Fordham. I wish I could have taken him for more classes. He loves his job and his students. If you have the change to take him I would. The class is comprised of a midterm, a final, a 5-page paper, and a 10-page paper (25% each for grade). Not hard though he helps.

Larry Welborn was such a nice man! He make class interesting especially for theology. He is so passionate about teaching, he really cares about each individual student. Lecture involves note taking. 2 papers, a midterm, and a final. Class is not an easy A, you need to work for it.

He is a passionate lecturer. HOWEVER: for your essays, you must visit him beforehand in office hours to best get your highest grade in those. Otherwise you're stuck with mediocre grades, seriously. You've been warned!

Amazing and inspiring lectures. Caring and Brilliant man. If you attend class and pay attention, you will do well. He makes learning about the new testament engaging and exciting. Couldn't wait to go to class every day. 2 papers and 2 tests. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

By far the best professor I have ever had. Wellborn is an amazing human being and a phenomenal teacher. He makes every student feel intelligent and important. I went from being entirely unexcited about theology to excited about going to every one of his classes. I recommend taking him at any chance you get.
Best professor I've had at Fordham. Fully recommended.
ratingTags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Welborn is truly an incredible professor & person. He was recommended by another student, thankfully I got into his class before full. I had no interest whatsoever in Theology, but his passion, knowledge & enthusiasm begs you to listen. He was the best professor I have ever had here. 2 papers, 2 exams. Very straight forward (notes) Please take.

Welborn , is an exceptional professor , he is great a at explaining bible readings and the materials for the papers . He has  a passion for religion that is evident in his lectures. His papers are pretty long , but as long as you attend class and take great notes , it should not be difficult at all. 10/10 , best professor at Fordham !

As a Chinese who never took Theology and possess a negative view on the course, I find his class on Intro to New Testament very engaging and interesting. He is so far my favorite professor at Fordham. He is very clear and passionate. His class is of normal difficulty. As long as you study, you will be fine. Definitely Recommend Him!

Prof Welborn is super sweet & so intelligent. Super knowledgable and his lectures are inspirational He knows 3 ancient languages!! No attendance but you must go to class, he discusses everything there. His enthusiasm makes up for it. Two 5 pg papers, midterm and final, matching with essay questions only. Take him even if youre not interested!!

Professor Welborn is one of the most enthusiastic and welcoming professors I know. He his jokes are a little corny at times, but he really loves what he does! To get an A, you have to attend all lectures and take good notes. His tests come right from his notes. He also sometimes gives you a study guide for tests which is very helpful.

Great professor and has many interesting stories. He is a very genuine and humble guy. Professor wise, his lectures are not covered in the textbooks (useless even if you have it), and he rambles on multiple tangents. hard to follow especially if religion is not of interest. Avoid him if you're not into theo. dont skip unless you want to fail.

The kindest man you will meet and the most genuine of theologians. Welborn isn't just concerned about the intellectual aspect of theology but also how it can shape and transform your life. His lectures are incredible, and he's the type of man who inspires you to find your vocation. He's one of the few who approach the subject pastorally.

by far the best teacher i've had at fordham..professor welborn is so passionate about what he does and gets so involved in his lectures.. 2 papers a midterm and a final and if u go to class, take notes, and listen, theres no way u won't get an A or at least an A-..i want to take every class he offers..best teacher i've had so far!

(NT) Welborn is a delight! He makes the seemingly menial topic of the New Testament into an exciting class in the history of the authors of the Bible books. I'm not huge on religion classes, but this revived my interest in the subject. His lectures are dynamic, interesting, fun, and absolutely result in great notes. TAKE WELBORN YOU WON'T REGRET IT

What a dynamic precense to have dawned this campus. You get the impression that a great theologian has approached the podium accompanying Jesus Christ or Paul. He not only knows them personally, but also intricately. It has crossed my mind that his sense of knowledge has far surpassed any timeline boundaries  restricting their relationships.

The best prof at Fordham. He cares about his students more than any other prof I've had. Go to office hours b/c he will tell you the most interesting stories in the world. You get overcome with emotion in class because it is so interesting and powerful. If you don't do the reading, you're missing out on a lot. It's impossible not to love this class

Welborn is the best professor at this university. TAKE HIM! he is enthusiastic and SO smart. he knows over 3 ancient langauges. he makes people who don't know or care about New Testament interested in it. Can't say enough about him. He's pretty easy too and couldn't be more helpful. I wish i could take him again- he is the best.

Larry Welborn is without a doubt the sweetest man on the Earth. So helpful and kind, it's almost sickening. He's very genuine and wants his students to really grasp the material and do well. He gives a midterm and final and 2 papers which he outlines for you. His stories are so cute. You can tell he really loves his job. Take him if you can!
The sweetest and most kind professor ever.  Very intelligent and engaging.  Very helpful when it comes to questions regarding the papers and exams.  Def take him!

Definitely take Welborne! He is extremely intelligent, but also very kind, fair, and a good person. also, his lectures are enthusiastic and clear. there are 2 papers, a midterm and final. the exams are not hard. suprisingly my favorite class this semester.

Professor Welborn is the type of teacher that wakes up every day to teach, and nothing else.  He is compassionate, kind, and completely invested in his students.  You will not be sorry if you take any of his classes.  Definitely the best religion professor at Fordham!
I LOVE this teacher. He's brilliant, and his enthusiasm for theology keeps you interested. My favorite class this semester.

If you are not interested in art history and want an easy A, don't take this class. But if you enjoy art history, this class is amazing. There is a lot of content but it is so fascinating and Dr. Mundy does an amazing job at explaining it all and making it engaging. Definitely one of my favorite classes so far.

Total expert in Meso America. On sabbatical she lectures at YALE (you're getting Ivy League caliber education)! Took as ICC (writing/presentation/discussion heavy). Fascinating material (art/archea/anthro/history). Extremely kind & very eager to help w/ assignments! 3 papers, 3 presentations, Wikipedia project, museum visit, final. Would take again

Took Dr. Mundy for Art History of the Americas. She's brilliant and an expert in the field of Aztec art, so she knows what she's talking about in this class. HOWEVER, if you don't like art history or if you are looking for an easy class to fulfill a core requirement, I would not recommend taking her class.
She's such a good person, and I hope the best for her! She is an expert and she speaks so clearly. She made the material accessible.

The midterm and final are really difficult. There is a 5 minute video project. The class is hard for an intro class and requires a lot of work. There is a lot of material. She gives an outline for the exams which helps, but they are still very hard.
The class is worth the work.  Professor Mundy is the best professor I've had at Fordham.

Would recommend to everyone. She brings the text to life and shares her expansive knowledge of art history with her class. Must take good notes in class if you don't want to read the text but expect pop quizzes (don't count for much in grade). Final video project was time consuming, make sure to meet w her before hand to get your thesis approved
Dr. Mundy is super-awesome! Because her class was only 1-credit, reading wasn't too top-heavy. Her lectures are interesting and creative, and she effectively engages student opinions throughout.

For an intro class, this is horribly overwhelming.  Professor Mundy isn't too bad, actually pretty nice. BUT, the tests are extremely demanding (memorizing dateslocationscultures of over 50 pieces) and the assignments are difficult (5 min video final, harder than it sounds) and not graded easily at all. Would avoid, definitely a GPA killer.
Made me hate art and art history before I had the chance to get to know it.

She is a weirdo and just doesn't get it... She picks on some students and will call you out. Try and kiss her ass by participating; it'll help you in the long run because her tests are hard enough. You have to read a lot for this class. Let her know your dedication because that will help when she is grading your papers. Overall, I would avoid her.

Lots of surprise quizzes. "Warm-up" essays at the beginning of class. Long lectures. Dense reading material. Presentations. A video presentation. Getting picked on for answers if you don't have your hand raised. It's an intro class but you're working as if it's your destiny. Not a good experience if you're not already knowledgeable about art.

This woman is unfriendly. Whenever an International student asks a questions, she outfights ignores them and seems to do everything in her power to avoid dealing with them or communicating with them. If you're working with an international student, she will not talk to you even if you're the only one raising a hand. AVOID HER!

I want to tear my hair out in this class. If you disagree with her, be prepared to be graded harder and do worse in class. Lectures are boring, she clearly has a distaste for dealing with international students, and gives no indication of how to pass. If you cite something, using Chicago, which she said is fine, you won't get credit. Only MLA.

Has pretty specific expectations for each paper, but does not express them in class. Go to her during office hours and she'll give hints as to what she really wants in assignments. Other than that, she's fine.

I had this professor many years ago as an undergrad for Intro to AH.  She was very knowledgable but unfriendly & opinionated.  She doesn't understand sophisticated writing (in English) from students. I know this because I'm a writer and she had trouble reading my papers & asked me to get "help" writing, which was absurd.  Hopefully she's improved.

Not the easiest professor- you definitely have to work for your grade! Definitely study for all quizzes/exams because they require a lot of memorization. However, she is very knowledgeable and I found the class very interesting and worth my time. If you're willing to do the readings, actually study, and participate in class you'll do well!

Definitely avoid her. Quizzes and tests are ridiculously hard. She expects you to remember so many minute details. If she picks you as her favorite you'll do well, if not then you have no hope. All you'll be able to take from this class is a few pointless details of about 50 works of art. She doesn't teach anything of importance. Take someone else!

LOVED HER. I went in the class thinking she'd be horribly tough, and I found the class very manageable. She stays super organized so if you go to class, you always know where you are. Just attend class, and pay attention the the works she talks about, because those are the ones she tests.

Not going to lie. Her class is hard. She's very demanding and a hard grader too. You really have to follow along with what she's teaching or you'll just be completely lost. If you need help, though, she's always open to help and is really knowledgeable about what she's teaching. Good teacher but just a little difficult.

OMG this woman is amazing. She's amazingly smart and easy to talk to, though she is definitely a difficult grader. Quickly get on her good side and participate a lot, and be prepared to actually have to work for a decent grade.

I have had Mundy for two semesters in a row now, for both Modern Latin American Art and Native American Art. She is very knowledgeable about what she teaches, and I enjoyed her classes a lot, but she is an EXTREMELY demanding grader. If all you are looking for is an easy A, don't take her.

Come on ppl, Mundy is not easy and she tells that shes gonna be demanding the very first day of class. She is very knowledgeable and knows her subject, if you come to office hours to ask for help with paper or anything she will help! Kinda Hot too! :)

THIS LADY IS SWEET AS PIE WHEN SHE WANTS TO BE (DONT GET ME WRONG) BUT SHE IS THE HARDEST GRADER I HAVE HAD IN MY LIFE. SHE EXPECTS EVERYONE TO KNOW EXACTLY WHAT SHE IS TALKING ABOUT AND SHE CHOOSES HER FAVORITES EARLY IN THE CLASS. SHE EXPECTS WAY TO MUCH AND HAS READINGS THAT ARE SOMETIMES REDUNDANT AND UNNECCESSARY. THIS PART OF MY LIFE SUCKED!
HARDEST PROFESSOR I have ever seen! Looks like an angel, but actully a devil. 6 papers. Many quizes. HARD!!! drop her class before you still can drop it.never ever take her!!!!!!!!!!!!HARD!

Took this as my tierney manresa class. the art gets more interesting as she goes on. If you see her for help she basically will tell you what to write your essays about. I rarely read, but I participate alot. Tough class but doable. You can only get away without trying if you are a very good writer and engage in class. Tough B, very tough A.

Overly harsh grader and assumes you come into the class knowing "art speak" even if youve never taken an art class in your life. I was very interested is the subject and this teacher made my life so miserable that I left never wanting to look at a painting again. She decides on her favorites early on and if you arent one, watch out!!

Pretty interesting. I suggest paying attention and participating a lot in the first few classes, because she seems to pick favorites early on. The essay questions are sometimes confusing and a pain in the neck, but they're usually fairly simple to do.

Her class discussions are fun, although often very uncomfortable (she loves to talk about sex and for some reason, making people say the word ****).  However, her quizes are pretty tough and the final is mostly memorization, and a LOT of it.  The class is okay if you work REALLY hard, but if you aren't ready to devote your life to it, stay away!!
Very helpful, understands that Modern Art is very dense and absolutely loves what she does.  Always cheerful, even at 9:30 in the morning.
Just say NO. Don't do this to yourself. Extremly difficult to take notes in this class and you are never sure quite what she expects from you until its too late. JUST SAY NO!
Really knows her stuff and expects you to know yours.  Recognizes if you're trying to do well.  You have to work hard but as long as you like the subject matter it's not that bad.
mundy is the greatest, so passionate and helpful, i was intimidated at first but now i love her. one of fordhams best. TAKE HER

Dr. Mundy is one of those kind of professors that you respect because of her knowledge of the topic, her dedication to the class and her enthusiasm for helping her students. She's a tough grader but once you do well you feel satisfied because you know you deserve the grade. Definately take this class if you are interested in art history.

She is great. She knows her stuff and is passionate about art! She is tough and expects a lot of you, but she is also a great teacher and wants you to do well. Ask for help when you need it; do the reading cause she likes participation in class, and study hard for the midterm and final. Definitely recommended!

she's great! she's very animated and keeps class interesting unlike some other professors. you definitely won't be bored in her class, she's very sweet and always willing to help students. an all-around great teacher, definitely take her.
Excellent, brilliant, another one of those super Fordham profs.  She gives great feedback on papers, and takes time with students during office hours.
brilliant woman. challenging, rewarding class.  if you hate art and are bitter about having to do work and be challenged then its not for you!
i hate her soooooo much that i would rather stick pins and needles in my eyes on a friday night!
id rather die than EVER have her again. do not take the class. ull work ur butt off only to still do badly.. not worth it.

For the love of god! It's 8:30 in the morning! Stop smiling and making us talk.   Work isn't hard but it is graded harshly and is a pain in the ****. She grades on a curve, but u can never improve, cause everyone else improves with you.  You have to do better to keep ur same grade.
great teacher, great class...be prepared to work, but in the end its very very worth it.  i got a ton out of the class.

this class could be so good if she didn't choose favorites, and grade way too hard.  going to office hours is a waste of time, she'll still hate you and not give you any information that will ever actually apply to the assignments
she is not very clear in class, and assigns lots of work
This woman is responsible for my new love and understanding of modern art. She is brilliant, kind, and open-minded. However, be prepared for lots of work.

Her readings are long considering that it is an Introduction course, but the museum trips are interesting. She should narrow down the number of trips though. Quizes cover too much information. Very nice and cool woman.

Pricey book? Yes. Trips to museums in NYC? Yes. But if the first doesnt bother you, you really should go to the second anyway, its a nice easy painless trip. She makes the class very easy, and tremendously interesting.

This Class is the WORST.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.  Take music or someone else.  Makes you go to 5 museums (waste of time but crucial to grades) Quizes are impossible.  Book is really expensive ($100).  A nice lady but i wouldn't recommend her.
No Comments
Requires a lot of reading and a lot of participation, but is a fair grader, really loves the material and creating lively discussions

Dr. Mundy is VERY friendly, a bit insane of a teacher though. The amount of work is comparable to graduate work and she often teaches freshman core classes, so to many this seems unfair, however she is very knowledgeable in her field.
Definitely has her favorites so watch out if you're not one. She also expects you to have more than a basic understanding of the subject matter.
Amazing teacher. Overwhelmingly passionate about art. Lots of work, but some of it can be interesting. Enjoyable class.
she expects you to know way too much.. and she's really high on herself
very difficult class for a core, but certainly worth it if you're into the subject.  provides tons of outside opportunities to visit many NY museums ... makes you to take advantage of the city

It really is ironic that Prof. Ball teaches communications, because the communication he provided with students throughout the semester was very poor. He is a really good guy and very busy, but you can tell teaching isn't his top priority. Assignments and due dates were unclear and he was hard to access. Good guy but save yourself the headache.

An incredibly caring and effective BC professor when it comes to preparing slide decks and speeches for the consulting cup. Seems weirdly unorganized at times, but will typically respond quickly and make time for you. Grades exactly as the rubric implies, so stick to it.

For a Business Communication class that teaches how to communicate to stakeholders, Ball was surprisingly awful at communicating  contradicting information between Blackboard announcements, emails, and written notes, and had projects that required so much effort for so little grade weight. He's a great speaker, lecturer, and person, but.... yikes.

Prof Ball is a fun guy to listen to, but the structure of our class was very confusing. We had to email him nearly every week to clarify what was due and what his expectations were for the week because he released lots of conflicting information. He also made several assignments group work that would have been far simpler to complete individually.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Ball cares about his students and levels with everyone. He genuinely wants everyone to succeed and will go out of his way to help you if you explain your situation. He is a little full of himself but it is apart of his charm. Fun dude. Would definitely take again.

Ball the BEAST! He is an excellent professor and challenges you well. He has actually made me a better communicator and has helped me greatly with interview prep. I love his demeanor, he definitely breaks the mold of your typical Fordham professor. His class is an easy A as long as you do the work and don't cross him.

Clarence Ball is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He saw that we cared about our project so he gave us all his time to coach us and make us a great presenting team. Additionally, he saw that I was struggling and had a private coaching session with me, which helped me drastically improve. He is a great guy and a great teacher.

Clarence Ball was an amazing bus com professor. There are not too many speeches, and he is very clear on what he wants for each speech. He is a genuine person who really cares about all of his students. He wants all of his students to do their best and provides good feedback. He is really funny/unique and you usually get out early. Def take him!!

Clarence Ball is a BEAST. Comes of as a little intimidating at first but he is very easy to talk to after class and during coaching sessions. Presentations are challenging but he inspires you to keep on improving. Fair grader and a cool dude. Highly recommend if you want to become a MUCH better and more confident public speaker.
Decent choice for a pointless class. Show up to class, participate a little bit, and make sure you do all the required assignments. His lectures tend to go slightly off-topic at times

Had him for two classes and both were very easy. This semester he cancelled about half the classes and made the students feel unprepared for the final, which ended up being easy. Not difficult to get an A from his classes. Also gives extra credit opportunities if needed.

Hard to mess up CEIP. Ball talks a lot about himself in class, strongly encourages participation, and likes to separate into groups. Talks a lot about himself and content completely irrelevant to the course, so you feel like the lectures and the assignments are from two different classes. Show up, talk once in the class, and do the assignments  A
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This guy is awful. He is not too smart. His writing looks like he is hadnicapped and he cannot spell simple words. I question how he got hired and how he has a college degree, but if you look at his university page you can see where he got his degrees. Not impressive. Take this class with someone else that is actually educated.

Pretty lively professor. won't email back about questions on projects until the night before it was due. work load is a lot, and he is very specific for no real reason because the other bus com teachers weren't super specific and they ended up doing better in the consulting cup. Overall good teacher and passionate, but it's his way or the highway..

Prof. C. is the most stylish and fabulous professor I have had so far. He acts tough because he really wants his students to improve and do well, but I'm pretty sure he gave our whole class A's because we had worked so hard all semester. He is very helpful and gives good feedback to improve your presenting skills. Bad at answering emails though.

I took his business communication class and in the beginning, I was a very nervous and ineffective public speaker. However, with his help and feedback, I significantly improved as a public speaker. He taught me how to use gestures and tone effectively in my speeches. Easy grader too and listens to very lit Trap music, which I am into haha
I took him for Integrated Project 2. He made this dull class a bit more entertaining, and the class is so direct, there is no way to not pass. He is also very understanding and very helpful.
Great professor! I wish I had more classes with him. I would take him again.

Prof C is an awesome guy but he is so disorganized that you pretty much have to email him before every class because he is never clear on assignments. I WOULD recomend him because he is a super easy grader considering the pop up assignments. His class is an absolute joy to be in and he's super flamboyant.

Everyone should take Prof. C for Business Comm. He is the best professor I've had at Fordham. Extremely clear teaching style, funny and helpful. Will make you a great speakerpresenter. One of the friendliest professors at Fordham. You will learn so much from this class, and have a good time every day, too.

350 characters is simply not enough.  Professor Ball is the most valuable asset Fordham University has to date.  His previous ratings on this website do him no justice.  Trust me, I have no reason to boost his ratings on here, I am simply doing YOU a favor.  Just trust me, my review is the only one you need.  He is the best professor at this school

It was his first semester at Fordham. If you pay attention to the powerpoints he legit GIVES you the answers. Show up. Participate and he will love you. quizzes are the powerpoints. 3 speeches. he doesnt respond to emails super well but his memorandums were helpful. overall a nice guy who cares.

I really enjoyed this class and I would recommend it to anyone who asks! Professor Meyer truly cares for her students and did a fantastic job of keeping students engaged in the online setting. The class is A LOT of work, but I feel like my French has improved significantly and I am more prepared to move forward with the language.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: If your goal is to potentially lower your gpa, then take this class. If your not the type of person to soak in information right away, get ready for some bad grades. There is almost no room for failure.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Meyer really cares about her students. Although the class requires quite a bit of work, she is always available to help and wants you to gain something from her class. Definitely take her if you are on the fence.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This class will be absurdly challenging. Unless you are prepared to sacrifice almost all of your free time it would be better to choose another professor for this class. She is not very supportive and will make it even more difficult than it already is to get a good grade in this class. Unless you have no other option, avoid this misery of a class.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: In my experience, just take Spanish. Your GPA is important and this class specifically is too much work for a core requirement. I took another professor in my second semester and got a B in his class but now Im in my third semester with this teacher and I feel like Im gonna fail again. Just take Spanish class save yourself the stress.

Professor Meyer would bring a lot of energy to the class. She plays favorites with each class. I asked for help a few times, but she just referred me to tutors. I asked for any extra credit opportunities, she does not believe in them. I would not recommend this class if you have a life outside of French. I am still having a hard time catching up.

She is very nice when it comes to being flexible with due dates. However, there is a lot of reading and writing. Much more than I had expected from a class that is supposed to be taken as a freshman. Despite that, she is very understanding and very helpful when you need clarification on a topic. Would recommend.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: I had the displeasure of having her for two semesters. I know most students can't choose her given the nature of cohorts, but if you can avoid her, I highly recommend it. She doesn't care about the well-being of her students and made the 1.5 credit class more stressful than any of my other 3/4 credit classes. Worst professor at Fordham. DO NOT TAKE
She has made my life very hard. I am not telling anyone to search her up, but sometimes it is beneficial to search up who your professors will be. Make sure to include "sesame street".
Will cut you off just because she feels like it. Has no respect for her students and would prefer to be using substances during class. She will not teach you anything important.
She's incredibly rude to her students and has very obvious mood swings.

She cares about her students even if it seems like she is being harsh. Definitely improved my presenting skills (tho on Zoom). Very particular about certain things, but rarely mentions grades and you will definitely get an A in her class. Just make sure to choose a good group to work with!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Really teaches you how to present well and speak in front of people. Gives really good advice regarding presenting over an online environment. Although she can be very strict and too honest at times, she ultimately wants to help.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Kimberly is a caring person however she can come off in a bad tone sometimes. During this pandemic, however, I feel she could've been more mindful of her students. She tells us to decorate our background during presentations but some do not have space or resources to do so. Overall her class wasn't bad but I wouldn't take her again.
ratingTags: Clear grading criteria--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Too much unnecessary homework. She treats students as kindergarten children. Too much work for 1.5 credit class.

Professor LaMarque was very helpful! she cares about her students and wants them to improve. She gives a lot of homework but it's manageable just pay attention to the format she wants. Personally I had issues with my CCIP group and she helped us more than anyone!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Best communications professor ever. She loves her job and is what education should be like. Best prof ever.

Professor LaMarque really cares about her students and went above and beyond to help all of our CCIP groups. If you have the chance to take her and want to improve your public speaking skills, definitely do.

Professor LaMarque will improve your public speaking skills 10-fold. When you are up on stage presenting, she will pick out every slight awkward gesture, lack of eye contact, swaying, etc and make you more self-aware than ever before. After taking her class, I now love presenting. She was a phenomenal professor, do take.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Lamarque may seem like a lot of work and really nitpicky in the beginning, but you will appreciate the feedback she gives you. My whole class' public speaking skills has dramatically improved since the beginning of the semester. She will always take the time outside of class to watch my CCIP group rehearse so she can help us in any way she can.
Very helpful professor! Cares a lot about her students and wants them to do their best. Take her you will learn a lot!

Professor LaMarque is really a great professor. She constantly challenges her students and puts them in situations to grow. There were a few presentations and videos, the final was different from anything I have experienced but it was very useful for the real world of business.
Expects her students to succeed and get better and better as you go on. A lot of people have a problem with the way she can be too critical but you see yourself improve a lot.

LaMarque is pretty great for the IP. My issue with the class was a departmental issue, as the class is busy work and doesn't teach anything new. My resume is great because of the class, but the rest of the assignments weren't helpful in any way. 65% of the class is the learning reflection, which was annoying. She gives great feedback though.
ratingTags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor LaMarque is an extremely respected and successful mentor. She genuinely cares about your professionality and your future career success. All of the assignments are clearly stated and graded. She is always there for the students in order to make sure that each person is performing to the best of their abilities.

She genuinely wants the best for her students and pushes them to succeed. Professor LaMarque will transform you as a public speaker, and all of her assignments have a purpose. If you do the work and show effort you will get an A, overall a pretty easy class.

One of the best teachers I have ever had at Fordham. Kimberley is very passionate about her work and cares a lot about her students. I learned more about life in general than any other class. My public speaking skills have seriously developed thanks to her. The workload can be a bit much at times but overall, Would DEFINITELY recommend.

On one hand, she'll definitely help you become a better public speaker, but on the other, she's very intense, nitpicky, and the class is a ton of work. She really cares about this subject and will help you outside of class though. You'll hear how easy other BizComm classes are, so decide how important public speaking skills are to you.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: LaMarque is very enthusiastic in her teaching style and really cares about your development as an individual. Because of this she becomes more strict and nitpicky when giving constructive criticism.

At first, you might think that this class is useless. There is going to be a lot of work and you have to put a lot of effort, but at the end, you will realize that you really learned how to present on public. This class definitely increased my confidence.

KALO is one of the best Biz Comm professors at Gabelli. She is extremely helpful and her methods are pretty solid. She's friendly but lets you know if you're doing something right/wrong. Very willing to help you succeed in business and presentations. Love her. Call her KALO.
LaMarque is a phenomenal teacher. She's very critical, but she knows what she's talking about. Get on her good side and participate. She gives pretty east work. Do that and you'll pass.

By far one of the best professors I have had a Fordham. While she sometimes asks a lot of her students (changing presentations days before they are due) she means the absolute best, and definitely has her students best interest in mind. She had 4 out of the 6 finalists in the consulting cup this year, proves how amazing she is.

LaMarque is an incredible professor and cares about every student. She gears her classes completely towards performance on exams and university presentations. Weekly homework that takes a minute. She is brutally honest with feedback but it is extremely insightful. She is the best speaking coach in NYC. Highly recommend.

She is out of touch with the nature of college and assigns a massive amount of busywork to her students. Her syllabus is blatantly wrong about her grading and assignments and she is quite mean to many students in her class.

Kimberly LaMarque Orman (KALO) is by far one of the best professors you will ever come across. The class will seem like a lot at first, but you will gain more from her class than any other class at Fordham. She will do anything and everything to help you succeed in the cohort and in life.

Doesn't understand that BCOMM2 is a 1.5 credit class. MOUNTAINS of busy work that waste your time for a class that meets literally once a week. Makes you HARASS YOUR FRIENDS AND RELATIVES for a pointless assignment because who will really give you honest opinions and tear you down to your face? You'd be better off working for a pyramid scheme.
The actual best professor Fordham could ever have and kindest woman you will come across.
One of Fordham's absolute best. Would take again!

Professor LaMarque is great. She loves constructive criticism and values giving it out. You will without a doubt become a great public speaker after taking her class. She is always willing to help and wants to see all her students improve and succeed.

Avoid if possible, though usually not since she focuses on sophomores. Not necessarily hard but she is MEAN. You will hate going to class. She picks on students and is confrontational. Literally stood us up in front of class and told us our flaws. Also, takes herself way too seriously. Lots of work, average grader but SHE WILL DRIVE YOU INSANE

She will work you more than ANY other comm. professor but at the end of the semester she tries to give everyone a good grade. If you can endure the workload, I guarantee it that you will come out of it as a MUCH stronger speaker and presenter than you were ever before. She goes out of her way to spend extra time to help you out. Take her!

Prof. LaMarque is amazing. She will put A LOT of pressure on you and overload you with work. However, at the end of the semester she tries her best to give everyone a good grade so don't worry about your GPA. She will work you more than ANY OTHER comm. prof but I GUARANTEE it you will come out of her class as a MUCH stronger speaker and presenter.

Prof. LaMarque-Orman is the best professor I have had at Fordham. She is extremely helpful and devotes so much time to help students. Seeing the final presentations for IP sophomore project, I see such a difference between her cohorts and others. She is a phenomenal professor, and I have grown so much as a student and person, all thanks to her.
Great professor!
She is an awesome teacher and very responsible professor.  I really enjoyed her course and have learned a lot from her.  Fordham is lucky to have her.

prof may is so chill and kind. i was anxious because the class is heavily graded on participation but she makes it very easy/comfortable to talk. + she does an amazing job covering all intersections of womens history! discussion post every week, 2 shorter papers & 1 8-page paper but you have all semester to do it & you choose the topic!) take her!

So much work for a liberal arts required course. Long readings before each class that you have to read because she makes quizzes every week. Long lectures but requires participation. Not worth it at all. There are way better history professors out there.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor May nice and always happy to help. She gives 2 exams, final, and 1 paper. She reads drafts of papers and gives good feedback. Quiz once a week on the reading but it is easy if you read. Her exams are usually IDs and an essay, doable if you study review sheet that she gives before each exam. Not an easy A, need to put effort and time.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor May explains exactly what would be on exams and what she wants for papers. There is a reading quiz once a week but they are very easy if you do the reading. But Professor May was very approachable in class and out. Her classes consist of half lecture half discussion of the reading. It isn't too hard and she is the best!

Terrible, constant lectures and note-taking all class. Quizzes on readings once a week. 2 papers and a final. Expects a lot from students. All grades with her are final. Participation is also a must for your grade.

Prof May's US History class is exactly like APUSH. She assigns about 2 reading a week that you need to do. Reading quizzes are sooo easy as long as you payed any attention while reading. Lectures are easy to follow and tests are straightforward. She assigns only one paper the entire semester. She remembers names and really cares! Take her!
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Dr. Wabudas British Isles class was probably one of my favorite classes this semester. She practically gave everyone an A for the two presentations we had which was nice. Shes REALLY big on participation so always ask one question per class and youll be fine. Also had a 10-15 page paper but she graded it pretty leniently. Very funny and nice!

Easily the most condescending and rude professor I have ever had. Will publicly embarrass you if you do not speak in a very specific way. Very old school and she will fail you with little to no explanation.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: If you value your GPA, I cannot stress enough about how this class will destroy your grade. Wabuda claims "grade is only a measure and nothing more." and will not hesitate to give out C's. She assigns work meant for grade-schoolers and grades them as if you're a graduate student. She is incredibly rude and completely nonflexible. Funny lady though.

I gave Wabuda the benefit of the doubt since this class was online but her lectures were just her begging students to ask questions. Only 4 graded items and gave minimal feedback and was not helpful in clarifying how to improve. Wants her notes word for word but sometimes those don't even cover everything. Very knowledgeable but not a good teacher.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Wabuda is the sweetest professor I have had so far. She is tough and quite sarcastic at times, but she is straight-forward and always willing to help. Some of my fellow students didn't like her, but I believe it's because they weren't willing to put in the effort, but if you are, you will fall into her good graces. Take her class!!!
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Wabuda is the best history professor I've ever had. She is dedicated and brilliant when it comes to the material. She lectures every class and the weekly quizzes and midterm/final are directly from the lecture notes. Take good notes, participate often, and the class is an easy A.

Prof. Wabuda makes her expectations for the semester very clear in her syllabus (in terms of your grade components). The entire class is based on lectures, which are all very interesting (coming from someone who doesnt like history). One thing is that there are weekly quizzes, but they arent too hard. Overall, loved this class and prof. Wabuda
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Literally the funniest, craziest professor I've had. Very little actual work and she is the most lenient grader possible. She is an actual character. Loves answering questions as condescending as possible. A broad knowledge of history. Ideal professor.

Wabuda can definitely be intimidating and somewhat condescending. Although she might seem scary, she really really wants her students to do well so ask questions. She is absolutely brilliant and an interesting person. On her tests write exactly what she says in class word for word and you will do fine. Class participation is key it saved my grade.

Dr. Wabuda is such a gem! She is so entertaining and she definitely cares about her students. Make sure you pay attention in class and take good notes because most of the information on the quizzes and tests comes directly from them. Also, if you ever have any questions for her, definitely ask because she is absolutely brilliant.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Wabuda is a very particular professor but if you listen to her instructions and follow her exam guidelines very very closely, the class is an easy A. She is one of the best professors I have had at fordham! She is extremely tough but if you just listen to instructions the class is great! The textbook isn't needed, take great notes and talk in class
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: as a freshman this class is a terrible projection of my next four years. she is impossible. for freshman student who need this credit, take any other available class. her expectations are absurd. makes degrading and rude comments to students.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I did not have Wabuda for a class, but she is currently my history major advisor. She is rude, evasive, pompous, unresponsive, and incapable of performing her job as an advisor. I cannot even imagine how she is as a teacher, but I would recommend never taking a class with her. There are much more capable and considerate professors at Fordham.

If you're not a history major do not even bother taking this class, shes extremely specific if you do not take notes or write they way she wants she will fail you, very rude, shames students for asking questions she feels are unnecessary, extremely dramatic, kicks students out if they sneeze or cough once,  never uses the textbook.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: So I have only been taking the core history class for a couple weeks now, but I just wanted to share an example of what her class has been like. The fourth class of the semester and she began class with, "Is everyone house-trained here?" and reminded everyone why potty training is taught.  TBH I have never had a prof. that was so condescending.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Susan is a TOUGH woman, but a great professor. She had no patience for people who weren't willing to put in the work but she made it worth your while if you showed effort. Textbook is not necessary because she tests you word for word from her notes and lectures.

This was legitimately the worst class I have ever taken. She tests on things barely spoken about in class and is a RIDICULOUS grader. Her class messed up my GPA.... over 75% of the class got a C or below on the midterm.
DO NOT TAKE HER. don't do It. Rude to students. Unclear grader. If you sneeze in her class she flips out. Steer clear. Also if you take her don't buy the book.
Worst. Teacher. At. Fordham. Unless you're a historical genius, please do yourself a favor and avoid this professor. I still have horrific flashbacks to this class.

Very odd teacher, but in a good way, typical of a historian.  Yes sometimes she can seem rude, however its just due to the generation gap and a cultural gap (she considers herself British).  Her papers are very easy, she gives you a packet that basically holds your hand through the paper.  Her feedback is very helpful and constructive.
very strange teacher, but funny at times. she is extremely nit-picky and her teaching methods are weird. can be rude to her students, even blatantly mean. would not recommend this class.

I thought her class was interesting. She gives quizzes once a week which are based off the lecture. You must be a good note taker and participate at least once a week. She teaches by reading from her notes and writing jey words on the board.

She is absolutely lovely. Her class is hard because she gives tests every week, and it's SO hard to pay attention but she is genuinely a loving person and loves the topic. She's also very understanding. The best thing you can do in her class is TAKE NOTES. AND GOOD ONES.
Dr Wabuda is awesome. My favorite teacher at fordham this far. She is crazy but in a good way. i got an A- and never even bought the book!

Wabuda is the most amazing professor ever!! Her European Women class was very interesting and she always kept everyone's attention. She is the funniest and most eccentric professor at Fordham. Take her if you can! She is truly amazing!!

Overall, she is not bad.  Like a few posts below me I received a B+ without ever opening the text, but I took notes that were almost verbatim from the lectures.  I am not thrilled with my grade, but you reap what you sow.  If you can take another professor, I recommend that.  But if you have to take Wabuda, don't sweat.

amazing professor. she knows what she is talking about and is extremely insightful. a little eccentric, but it makes her class fun. everything comes from the notes- she dictates the notes and writes some things on the board. 3 readings required, but she explains them well enough to skip them. midterm/final are collection of essays. not too hard.

She's a really nice lady, and she enjoys what she is doing. You must take good notes! Her weekly quizzes,midterm&final are all from the notes! I got a B+ in the class and I never opened the textbook, just studied notes. But you need to memorize them.

I have to admit, Wabuda is a bit of an eccentric, but if you look beyond that you can really learn a lot from her. Just show up to class and take good notes and you will be fine. And participate since it's 25% of your grade. She's really willing to help you out if you show her you care and are willing to put the effort in.
a good teacher in class, makes topic somewhat interesting, but an absolutely insane grader. i wouldn't take it unless you are already really good with history.
One of the most brilliant professors at Fordham, she is very eccentric - but a really nice lady. I truly enjoyed her class (but maybe not my grade)

She is by far one of the best professors at fordham. As long as you pay attention and participate in class (care about what she's teaching) then you'll walk out of the class with AT LEAST a B+. She's very helpful with regard to her office hours and works with her students to improve their papers. I walked out of the class with an A- & loved it.

I'm gunna disagree with mostly everyone here. The key to her class is taking notes. The quizzes on Fridays come right out of your notes from the previous class. If you're a good note-taker, shouldn't be a problem. She is very knowledgeable, loves what she teaches, and made the material much more comprehensible. I would recommend her if you take not

She really loves history and she's a generally nice professor. But she expects you to read a ton of stuff! Great if you're interested in history, but bad for the rest of us, especially since we don't go over most of it in class. If you get her, make sure you highlight EVERYTHING she writes on the board, 'cuz those terms ARE the midterm and final.
take her if u hate life. ur opinion wont change.

She's great - very knowledgable and funny! she is very into comments and questions and is very helpful when you go to see her. it's true - she's a hard grader and no one will get over an A- but it's worth it.

STAY AWAY! she only likes you if you partcipate but even then she still grades unfairly. very little homework expect for the 2 papers midterm and final. the midterm/final she tells you to memorize everything you have ever learned in the class and write that back down on the paper. i worked my ass off and still only got a B-

Your grade consists of two essays and the midterm and final...she doesn't take attendance so going to class is not mandatory, but she expects you to write your essays based on the lectures. Overall, not a good teacher, stay away if possible.

smart lady, but thinks she better than history itself.. her papers are complicated and she tells you to use the book and then when she grades she tells you that the book is wrong... tough grader all around.. would not recommend to anyone

She's weird. Brilliant at what she does, and never let us forget it. Bit rude at moments with her pointedness. Be prepared to ask questions- she  lives off them! Feedback on paper is chicken scratch and she grades them very harshly. Couldn't get higher than C+ on them, though passed with a B.

I couldn't stand Prof. Wabuda at first. I dreaded coming to class and have her drone on about how smart she was and about all the things we werent doing right and yell. But as class went on she grew on me. Classes are pretty much just her lecturing and little participation is necessary.. except have questions ready she LOVES questions...

she's so smart and interesting. her class pretty much runs on the classes questions which really keeps things entertaining. she may see a little harsh at first, but she's really a nice lady who really wants her students to realize what they're capable of achieving.

One of the most eccentric professors I have had. Class is very interesting; she has lots of different stories and is very vocal about her views on the world (Christian/liberal) Very hard grader, but she gives you every opportunity to get better. Only midterm/final for tests, so you really have to work on papers. Overall, very good.

took her for early modern life seminar.  she expected us to read hundreds of pages for each class... be prepared to either do them or prepare to **** like you did read them.  20 page paper instead of a final... hard grader but fair if you can actually write a decent paper

She's really funny and I know she must be brilliant, but she was so easily sidetracked, class rarely went anywhere! Don't expect any feedback on graded material. Just random purple circles and question marks. She'll getflustered if you try and make an appointment to see her, because apparently she's one of the busiest people in the world.

Dr. Wabuda is a very, very smart lady. However, she thinks her life is insanely busy, so much in fact, that she's too busy to grade fairly. Great lectures and fascinating, but she needs to grade more universally. For upper level history majors, I'd recommend it. Otherwise, No No No No No.

Very tough grader. Kooky, but nice and very intelligent. Loves questions and participation, which is sometimes difficult, because of the extent of her lecturing. I like her and would take her again if I got the chance. But I can see why people get frustrated with her tough grading and her general weirdness.
AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. horrible grader, not helpful at all..most boring class I've vever taken at Fordham.

The rest of the reviews here are way off. Unfortunately, she teaches REQUIRED classes, so the brunt of the bad reviews here reflect those who are A)are not interested in the material, and B) expect to be pampered to while doing the minimal amount of work. She expects you to be engaged, and actually do the reading. Shocking, I know. She's fanastic.

Doc Wabuda is great. Her classes are always about writing a good paper ; the reading seems to be incidental. Tests are standard:IDs and an essay. You gotta love her policy about not coming to class if you so much as sneeze...and don't forget to eat. "Do You know how hard it was to prepare food in pre-Industrial society?!!" Also what's up with her wanting "a cheerful font" and no staples on our papers? Kookie but Cool!
No Comments

DO NOT TAKE.  EVER.  Psycho-Prof.  Insane.  Delusional.  She wants YOU to provide HER answers, so she can continue a lecture, and she wants everything specifically worded-- in short, YOU NEED TO READ HER MIND.  RUN AS FAR AND AS FAST AS YOU CAN.

Kinda crazy, but EXTREMELY intelligent and accomplished. lestures, but only two papers midterm and final. take good notes. Participate and she will love you. SHE LOVES QUESTIONS, but if they are stupid or you are stupid she will let you know.

Great prof. She's a Democrat and you'll learn that quick--still fair though. Good person to talk to about ANYTHING. Personal problem, talk to her. She's always helpful. Her papers are clear cut, straight from the notes. No attendence policy. Midterm & final. Eat breakfast (oatmeal preffered, you'll understand why) and participate: she'll love you.

The way she grades doesn't really follow any kind of pattern whatsoever.  She was also very condescending and liked to talk about herself and the fact that she could speak several languages (badly)and that she's published books on podiums.  The only thing you can do is kiss her ass.  Reading & office hours don't help, so don't waste your time

I could listen to Wabuda talk all day.  Very interesting woman with loads of knowledge.  She takes a strong interest in her students and wants them to achieve their very best.  She is a somewhat hard grader, however, she does it for the reason of wanting students to do top notch work.  If you want a solid understanding of history, take her!

avoid her if possible but it's not the end of the world if you get stuck with her. two words--OFFICE HOURS: go as much as possible even if you have nothing to say. if you kiss her ass your grade will be boosted beyond belief. pretty hard grader but lets you do rewrites and offers helpful criticism.

Worst prof at Fordham.  Completely arbitrary grading and crazy, opinionated, condescending nut.  I totally lost all interest in history as a result of this lady.  I would rather take five extra, hard classes than take her again.
hahah this woman is CRAZY. Shes a hard grader... but she's fair. She likes to teach barefoot and is an "America" hater.... thats ok tho because she's amusing.

she immediately looks down on her students and does not give credit to her student's ideas if they disagree with hers. She is intelligent but feels the need to mention it as much as she can (along with her book) her class has no structure and she mixes the history of all europe together
it sucks, she sucks don't take this course
Not an easy class to get an A in.  Shes somewhat crazy, but she is amazing at history.  She really loves the subject.  Challenging class.

She's a little crazy but she's fun. Just take good notes and keep up with the current events. Just 2 papers, one midterm and a final. The people whining before me must be freshmen cause that's the best i've had so far at Fordham. She's the best!!! TAKE HER!!!! TAKE GOOD NOTES!!!!

To pass this class all you have to do is be nice to her, do your 2 papers, and pay attention in class. You don't have to read the tkbk. You do need to study a bit for your 2 exams, but if you take good notes and study that, you'll do better than fine.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.  SHE IS THE WORST TEACHER EVER.  IT'S SO HARD TO FOLLOW HER IN CLASS AND HARD TO TAKE NOTES BECAUSE SHE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE.  SHE GRADES SOOO HARD ON THE PAPERS AND THE TESTS AND DOESN'T EVEN GIVE YOU FEEDBACK.  DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER

She is the best; makes her classes fun and interesting and makes herself available to students for help... awesome teacher who is really smart; plus her exams are easy and she gives a lot of help with the papers
She's really intelligent.  Only 2 papers a midterm and a final.  I didnt read the textbook once and i got a B on my midterm.  She grades papers hard, but if you follow her model, you will be fine!

Wabuda is awesome. She is crazy- not really that hard although a tough grader. With only two tests and essays, just study and write thoroughly and you will be fine. Participation is very important. She looks beyond history and sees potential in her students...something no other teachers have done.
DO NOR TAKE THIS CLASS< SHE IS THE WORST PERSON ON THE FACE OF THE PLANET>
No Comments
Bizaar, a bit of a shrew but altogether a good teacher and a good woman.  Kind of what you expect from a grad professor, lol.
Insanely knowledgable in history, yet a bit crazy. Lectures are pretty boring but she doesn't take attendance. Somewhat condescending and quite a harsh grader.
No Comments

If you dont mind reading books and long chapters than take her but otherwise avoid her. She is extremely boring in class and she was not helpful during her office hours. Eventhough she does not give many written assignments just beware it can hurt you.
Boring class and lectures very randomly.  Is a very tough grader on tests an papers.
SHE IS INSANE get out while you can...Horrible class, horrible teacher just plain HORRIBLE.  She has no idea what she is talking about and is very random with her lectures.
Not only is she a hard grader, but she is also very condescending and rude to her students.  Avoid her if you can.
Realy hard grader on papers and tests...but doesn't care about attendance or give Homework...can be annoying if you are: late, sneeze, and don't eat before class. Why? i don't know.

you never have to go to class. her tests are probably the easiest you'll find for this course. its easy to do well. no homework really except for reading. a little nutty but very nice and understanding. if you ask for help she's really generous.
boring as hell, hard grader, do not take
She's crazy and talks down to students, but knows a lot. If you're interested in the subject, she's good and accessible, but otherwise stay away unless you really, really have to take the class.

She LOVES history and cares about the students. She is very very helpful, all you have to do is ask. You learn so much in this class, the lectures are always interesting. She can be a little condescending at the beginning but the workload is light.
No Comments
She's a decent lecturer but kinda nuts. I learned a little bit but too hard of a grader. I guess you can take her if you are up for a challenge.
Although incoherent at times, you do learn a lot in her class. Very helpful outside of class, and genuine care for her students. Moderately challenging work load.
she is pretty crazy, she is not helpful either and she is NOT hot
No Comments

Bit of a tough grader and makes you write papers according to a ridiculous formula -- but if you question it she'll help and make sure it turns out OK.  She definitely has some interesting and worthwhile things to say, and some good recommendations.
Please, listen to what I'm saying.  Do not ever take one of this woman's classes.  She is seriously crazy(psycho).  Don't put yourself through it.  You will remember me telling you this.
She was perhaps one of the craziest professors I ever had. She is a horrible person and thinks that the world revolves around her. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!!
This woman is insane.  A radical neo-luddite that limits her students to readings of her choosing and punishes further research.  Take her if you enjoy being brainwashed.
This Lady is sooo hot
No Comments
fairly easy grader with good extra credit assignments
No Comments

Professor Boulfroy is so sweet! Her class isn't easy but she gives you everything you need to succeed, and will make sure everyone is participating so you have to be careful not to zone out. As long as you put in the work and are prepared for class, everything goes very well.

She was absolutely ridiculously hard and gave next to no feedback or help. Grades were lower than you deserved and you were tested on things you didn't learn. Also had about 6-8 hours of homework a week. Don't take her class she won't help you at all.

Heidi is one of the best professors I've taken at Fordham. She is very caring of her students, makes class very enjoyable, and I would definitely recommend taking her classes. One of the most enjoyable classes I've had was her transnational Asian media class. Weekly logs for the movies that we watch and 3 papers where you get to choose the topics

A great teacher for a class like Screenwriting 1. Assigns a textbook, but you don't really need to read it since she explains the key points in lectures. Really cares about ppl enjoying her class, and understands that not everyone who takes it is a natural-born screenwriter. Gives helpful writing tips for beginners.

Prof. B is the best! I've taken her before and she is just as great in this new class as she was in the last. She gives great advice and really knows her stuff. Would absolutely take her again and again!

Professor Bordogna is such a sweet woman. She loves hearing students' opinions about the films we watch and adds a lot of interesting perspective to everyone's points. Gives really kind and helpful feedback on essays. I would absolutely take her again!

I loved Professor Mowlabocus's class. Class discussions are always super engaging and interesting. Def the my favorite class and professor throughout online school. There are 3 big assignments that determine most of your grade, but they are all interesting and you have alot of freedom to decide your topics to make it most interesting for you! 10/10
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. So funny and nice. Very interesting lectures and class material.

The way the professor teaches history is super engaging and fun. The only thing is that there is no specific agenda/themes. Otherwise, the instructions and grading for midterms and papers are straightforward. Would recommend if you like history.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I loved this class! Professor is very knowledgeable and his feedback is very clear and helpful! Although there is a lot of readings for class, its manageable and interesting!

I don't think the ratings do this man justice. I took American History because another class filled up and I loved it so much more than I ever expected. He gives GREAT feedback on papers and never "drills" anyone for answers. There a decent amount of reading but just be able to pick out a few points and you'll be fine. Overall, one of my fav profs!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: this guy is a jerk, don't take his class. he is really disorganized and doesn't have any respect for his students. he would single students out for mistakes and kinda embarrass them in front of the whole class. he didn't even read most of my 12 pg final which i put a ton of work into. his comments made it evident that he didn't care. power trip.

He knows his stuff, but putting them into notes is kinda hard. He's very fair and takes time to help you find material for your final paper. I didn't read a lot of the assigned readings but I managed to get by fine. Tl;dr nice knowledgeable person but assigns a lot and unclear lectures.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I agree with what the other people who left ratings are saying. He is a nice professor and makes it accessible for you to reach him but I think his teaching style is sometimes unclear. He also assigns long readings and expects a lot. He is a good teacher though and is very knowledgable on the subject. I would recommend him if you're ready to work.
ratingTags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Clearly knows material but didn't streamline info well for note taking. Very long readings that few people fully read, sort of flipped classroom if no one learned at home. He was last minute replacement for a different teacher, which was probably a factor. Short oral on primary source, midterm, 12pg research paper, 8min prez on paper, 5pg final.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Overall this professor was very lecture based in class. He often went off tangents easily, was unclear, and was somewhat unorganized. However, during office hours he's easy to speak with about your grade or the class, but was just too unorganized for a professor. He expects the class to do a lot of reading and very long essays.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Easily one of my favorite profs at Fordham. So nice, and the books we read were actually interesting. Class itself was engaging and had good discussions. I took him over zoom but it still felt like the class got to know each other.

Pr. Clark is extremely friendly + is quite moderate with the work load. His feedback is sometimes questionable and can seem subjective, but he really cares about his students and puts a lot of thought and analysis into his grading. Lectures can be a bit dry, but I had him online, and idk anybody who finds online lectures exciting.

I LOVE Dr. Clark. He changes his curriculum depending on the students and really tries to tailor to their interests. He's a pretty hard grader, but will always make time to help and meet. He has really improved my writing, and my essays and papers are so much more clear and concise. 100% recommend if you love English.

A genuinely sweet man who really seems to care about his students. A wealth of knowledge- so if you're looking to learn a lot/improve your writing skills take his class. A fair amount of work but most writings are on interesting topics. Only complaint is he's pretty disorganized and takes forever to give grades back/doesn't follow the syllabus.
I loved his class! Definitely my favorite class from my freshman year. As long as you do the weekly readings and put effort into your writing assignments, you will do well.

His grading was absolutely subjective- he would grade essays based on whether he agreed with your argument, not on whether you were writing well. Required meetings with him outside of class times due to his own poor planning and time management. Constantly going off on tangents/making pointless jokes instead of continuing the lecture.
ratingTags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Don't take this class. Professor Clark takes forever to grade assignments, is a harsh grader, usually disorganized, and his class is way too much work and time for a core class. His lectures can be interesting but are usually dull. He expects participation. By no means an easy A. If you put in as much work as he expects you'll probably get a B.
Prof Clark is nice enough and teaches pretty well. A lot of homework that doesn't get graded fast. Good feedback, but worked hard for my mediocre grade.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: LOVE THIS GUY. He's so funny and gives great feedback. Be ready to participate and do weekly readings. He's an entertaining human being and knows that students have a lot on their plate. Take him!
There's quite a bit of reading and writing for homework but as long as you know what you're talking about and participate in class, he'll love you.
no midterm or final. tough grader but if you try, you'll get an A. very nonconventional but the class was fun and hes easy to talk to

If you want to become a better writer, Dr. Clark is the person to go to. He will show you tough love, but is very fair with his grading and will push you to do better. You have weekly assignments that are manageable, and 3 large assignments as well. You can also revise most assignments. If you work hard, you will do well.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Clark will make you work extremely hard for your grades, but he will absolutely make you a better writer. He has many short writing assignments and readings  with only 3 major paper. He gives a ridiculous amount of feedback on every assignment, which specifically shows where you can improve and if you work hard you'll do well.

Prof. Clark's class involved mostly reading, class participation, and online submissions. Not a fantastic class or a fantastic professor, but my academic writing improved exponentially. He teaches rhetoric, which will help you in every other class at Fordham. You'll do well if you do the work and listen to his feedback.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Clark's class required a LOT of paper-writing, so be prepared for that. Every time you went to class, you were given another assignment, usually a paper to write accompanied with some reading. Lots of work to do, but he believes in improvement through practice, so if that's your thing, I'd recommend him. Not super-strict with deadlines.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Prof McDermott is excellent. I had her for intro to politics and she was great! She truly cares for her students and is willing to help. She makes class interesting and heavily encourages student participation and is open to all opinions. She is a fantastic political science professor and I would recommend taking her!
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: So amazing I can't recommend her enough. We had a hybrid class so half online half in person - each week there is a module with a video lecture as well as reading & the synchronous section is engaged debate. She does a really good job of explaining material and making her class interesting. She also does office hours for papers!

Bad prof who grades arbitrarily. Would write useless comments on papers (ex. "Huh? What?"). Didn't provide any help whatsoever during office hrs and appears to hate her job and takes it out on hapless students. I requested a grade appeal where due process was not followed.
Great professor. .have taken her twice and have very much enjoyed both of her classes. Very reasonable workload. She is funny and makes class interesting

Monika is the best professor I have ever had at Fordham. She is funny, genuinely cares about her students, but still manages to keep her political preferences to herself (its fun to guess what she thinks during discussions). You are wasting your POSC degree if you don't take her. Classes are SO interesting, tests aren't super hard. 1 paper! Take!!

I love professor McDermott. She is funny, informational, and clear about what she wants from her students. I hope to take one of her classes again soon but unfortunately, she is only teaching intro to posc next semester - so if you are a freshman reading this just please do yourself a favor and take her class.

Prof McDermott is the best Political Science professor at Fordham. She keeps her political stand point to herself and give non-bias information. Her lectures are amazing and she makes you enjoy and want to go to the class. Her midterm and final really make you think but they are doable. I highly recommend Prof McDermott!

I love political science, but didn't find this class all too interesting. With that said, it is a very easy class. Barely any homework besides readings that you can honestly just skim. Midterm and final are pretty easy as long as you study. Would recommend.
Exceptional professor. She makes class interesting and brings current events and real world experience to her lectures. Highly recommended

Prof. McDermott is an incredibly intelligent woman who makes the subject interesting and funny with her sarcastic comments and jokes. You don't have to go to class, but your grade is basically based completely off your midterm and final, so going to class is definitely to your advantage. Tests can be confusing but are for the most part very fair.

I'm a POSC major and all I have to say is nope. Take Aleman instead, and actually walk away 1) having learned something 2) with valuable feedback. There's a difference between being tough to help students learn and being tough for kicks. "She's a nice person" isn't worth the debt.
Excellent professor. Passionate about the topic, which make her classes highly entertaining.
10/10 would recommend to a friend.

Pros: Funny, up to date. Cons: Do not take her if you value your GPA. I took her junior year and came in with a 3.8 GPA. She gave me a B-. Don't know what others are raving about - the class was fine but not worth the GPA hit. Avoid her tests for sure. Vague and unclear.
She is one of my favorite professors at Fordham. She is extremely knowledgeable about the field, and lectures in a sarcastic, funny, and overall entertaining way. I couldn't rave about her enough!

Pros: doesn't take attendance, is mildly entertaining in class, covers material. Cons: grades are based entirely on tests, which are difficult. knowing facts will get you a B. you have to also read her mind a bit to know what she means by the question.

She is so great! She is funny and sassy. She knows a lot about her field and talks about current events. She is always clear in her lectures and willing to answer any questions. Her tests are a little tricky, but she is definitely willing to help you before the test if you ask her what the questions will be like. Had a great experience with her!
Not a good teacher. Yes, you don't have to go to class, but that's not worth her ridiculously hard tests.

No idea why she's considered an "easy" teacher. I had her last semester. She literally held a class about why all of *us* sucked so badly on her trick-question midterm.  If the average is a D, law of numbers says the problem isn't with the students...

grade is 40% midterm 50% final 10% participation. She's a good teacher, but her tests come out of left field.  She asks essay questions and requires one-sentence answers. She also likes trick questions. Since exams count for so much I'd say it's not worth the risk, unless you're very confident in your answers.

this is what college teaching is all about. she is absolutely wonderful! an overall great teacher, knows what she?s talking about, explains things easily, and really cares about her students. couldn?t say enough good about her. easy to get an A while still learning and comprehending. can?t wait to take another class of hers. take her!!
