LOVE HER. Professor McDermott holds your attention, she is simple and clear, and she really knows her stuff. She does not take attendance, and she puts the power-points online. Your grade consists of the midterm, final, large paper, and small paper assignments now and then. Very helpful and enthusiastic. Overall, great professor.

Great professor.  Extremely intelligent, approachable, and passionate.  Also refreshing to have a professor with real world application experience (she's done work as a poll analyst for major news companies).  Recommended for anyone interested in learning about politics.
She's absolutely great. Shes knowledgable and her class is easy to do well in with very little work. She also manages to keep things from getting boring in class (which is optional anyway)

She's awesome! Really knows what she's talking about and makes everything really interesting! We always talked about current events and how they related to the material. She's a contributor to the New York Times, so she obviously knows what she's doing! Take her!

She's great, and clearly knows her area. I had her for Intro to Politics since I'm a Poli Sci major, but I found the class pointless. I too took AP Government in high school and did not need to take this class. I never picked up the book or studied for a test or quiz and still easily got an A. Her test questions are a bit unfair and poorly worded.

She's a terrific person and really knows her stuff, but she wasn't too passionate about the Intro class.  I took AP Gov in High School, but that's not allowed to replace Intro which is dumb. She was clearly as bored with the class as I was.  I'll definitely take her for something else though.

I feel for her bc I'm sure it's difficult to have your first real class be on zoom, but that doesn't mean this class wasn't awful for us. Her expectations are incredibly unclear on projects and she assigned a 20 page final paper with little helpful guidance. Seems confused when students ask questions/doesn't give straight answers. Definitely avoid
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Absolutely the worst political science class I have taken and, by extension, the worst professor I have had. Prof. Best was rude, condescending, and unclear about grading. She assigned us, without any instruction, to write a massive research paper. She moved our deadline up a day for whatever reason. Horrible prof. Do not take. Class was also bad.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Professor Bromberg is the best he really cares I definitely recommend taking his class.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Seriously. So passionate and knowledgable about what he teaches, encourages a lot of student discussion, and was extremely understanding during the pandemic. Take him if you can. Uses the textbook thoroughly, all assignments are writing based, gives great feedback & is always willing to talk to students !!!

Can't say enough good things about Prof. Bromberg! He's one of the most caring, genuine professors I've had. We had mental health check-ins throughout the semester and it was evident that he knew we had other classes and lives outside of his class. You'll learn a lot without feeling overwhelmed - he is a must-take!

Bromberg is definitely my favorite professor. He makes it clear what he expects from you, is super organized, won't deviate too much from the syllabus. The content is really interesting and he likes to get everyone engaged. He seriously cares about his students; we had mental health check ins throughout the semester. Great prof for online learning!

Prof. Bromberg has no doubt been my favorite professor I've taken at Fordham. He makes class fun and interesting especially at times when the content may be dull. Not to mention he is the most considerate professor I've had and genuinely cares about each student's well being. Cannot recommend him enough!
I love prof Heersink I've taken all three classes that he offers at Fordham. He is super interesting and not too difficult if you are willing to study a bit. Definitely highly recommend him!

Professor Heersink was a wonderful person to learn under. His lectures are very clear and the slides are very detailed  theyre very helpful when its time to study. He is a very reasonable grader and available for help if you need it. Take him!

Professor Heersink is very knowledgable and his lectures are very engaging. 2 big tests (multiple choice and one essay question) and the final plus a paper. He's a very fair grader. He posts all of the slides after class. Would take again.

Professor Heersink is very nice and very knowledgeable on the subject matter. That said, he didn't mention that our in class midterm would be graded relative to how everyone else did (so even if you didn't get anything wrong you could still do poorly because others wrote more). 1 midterm, 1 final paper (take home) and one research paper
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Heersink is really funny and is an engaging teacher! I really enjoyed taking his class - he posts all of the powerpoints on Blackboard, so if you miss a class, you can make up the notes easily, and he only assigned one paper in addition to the midterm and final.

Professor Heersink was wonderful! He was so caring toward individual students and he made himself easy to approach. He was a very sweet guy and although his lecturing could get a bit boring, the powerpoints he made were very helpful in studying and he posted them to Blackboard. Easy tests and a take home final. Great professor!

Prof. Heersink is a wonderful professor and person. He is super funny and clearly very caring. He makes himself available for office hours often and although the lectures can get a bit dull, he keeps them entertaining with this funny power points and jokes. The midterms were a bit difficult but the final is take home.

He is one of the best teachers at Fordham. He is funny and keeps the class going. He is a genius in his field of American Politics and Campaigns and Elections. He is a must take, but make sure you put in the work. He is a fair grader.
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Smart guy. Have great sense of humor. His course is clear and well-organized. Grading is tough but fair. Take him.

Professor Heersink is one of the best I've had a Fordham! TAKE HIM! His lectures are very rich, and he makes things very clear. Grade is on a midterm, a 8-10 research paper of your choice, and a take home final. Very do-able.

One of my favorite professors at Fordham. His Campaigns and Elections class composed of his interesting commentary on topics that he made easy to understand. There's a Midterm, 10-page paper and a take-home final. Also a really respectful and smart guy. Would absolutely take him again.

Not sure why the reviews here are so harsh. Pr. Gruber easily articulates about philosophy on many different topics + provides a lot of connections that better your understanding of topics that are often difficult. Papers are a bit tough, but for the midterm/final he gives you the Qs ahead of time and is willing to go through them all with you.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Gruber is a good professor, he is just a really hard grader. He makes it known that he does not give out A's. You really need to work hard to do well in his class and if you slack in any way you will probably get a C or a D. This is probably one of if not the most difficult core class I have had to take
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Somebody throw this man a bone! All of the other reviews are too harsh. Prof. Gruber is very clearly a philosophy wiz whose genius doesn't always translate well in a classroom setting. If you're confused, he is very personable 1 on 1. And guys come on he's not creepy. He has some fun jokes here and there people need to lighten up. Put in effort.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: WORST PROFFESOR EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DON'T TAKE IF YOU WANT TO SEE YOUR GPA SINK :(((
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far the worst professor I have had at Fordham. Ruined students GPAs, including students in the honors program. Two papers, a midterm, and a final with an essay-but don't bother going to him for help with these, he won't give you a straightforward answer and goes back on what he says all the time. Not to mention the cruel and creepy jokes...
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: SIMPLY AWFUL!!!!!! For a core class he grades extremely harsh. I did A work and ended with a B+ simply because he doesn't like to give A's . Arrogant much :( Do not take him.
Difficult to say the least. Boring. 8:30. Take this class if you want your GPA to drop. HAHAHAHA

He's a good enough teacher, especially for a subject like philosophy. 1 short paper, 1 long paper, midterm, final, & short reflections are the only things that are graded. He's a bit of a harsh grader. Says he hardly gives A's because it would imply "excellence". attempts to make too many jokes that no one laughs at & gets annoyed when no one does
ratingTags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very nice, very awkward. His class consists of babbling about the reading and making comical remarks to himself. Prepare yourself for that 8:30 AM. Although he is nice, he doesn't explain the material well (I often googled) and he's pretty harsh on students if they don't understand. Not the worst professor but I wouldn't take him again personally.

Professor Gruber was one of the better professors I had this semester. I had him for 50 minutes three times a week and honestly I enjoyed going to his class, other than the fact that it was at 8:30 in the morning. If you pay attention in class and participate, then you will survive. Homework was fair as well as tests.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He does his best to make this not such a stressful class. The writing assignments are short, easy, and graded on completion apart from two essays. He gives you the midterm/final questions beforehand then picks from a few of them. However, the class it just so slow. If you're into philosophy, you'll probably love it, but it's just so boring.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Gruber enables you to be good at philosophy, even if you hate it. He understands that this is a mandatory course and so he is clear and down to business. There are weekly responses that are a piece of cake and will take you 10 mins. He gives you outlines for both the midterm and final. Easy A.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This was his 1st semester teaching, and his class was an easy A. He's an easy grader (its impossible to read his comments) 2 papers that he grades easily, gives the questions for midterm/final, and half a page reflection on class discussion is due every other class. Be prepared to print all the readings besides the 3 books you buy.

Prof. Gruber is one of the best and generous professors i ever met in Fordham. Although he pushes students to write responses for every class, once you do, you will get full credit. However, he does not provide any note during class, but once you catch up, everything goes well. NO QUIZ.

This man is so incredibly boring and awkward. He is very nice, but his class is soul-sucking. He has no notes and you can never hear what he says. If you get him as a professor, its not worth it to really change out, just prepare yourself to really engage and try hard to pay attention because its really easy to dose off.

Prof Groner was a true pleasure! I had him for both python classes at Fordham and he taught me so much about programming. He is so accessible outside of the classes and wants all his students to succeed. Gives lots of feedback on how to improve code. Highly recommended him for any IS class!
ratingTags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: He is a great professor! He really wants his students to learn python and is very accessible outside of class. He has lots of great resources to try's to make coding as easy as possible. He has created asynchronous content and also wrote a textbook for the course. oOverall a great class learned a lot.
ratingTags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved him! Great guy and an awesome professor, really learned a lot

such a sweet nice man. I have learned so much. he genuinely cares about his students and is really passionate about python. favorite professor at Fordham, please take his class and asks lots of questions, it makes him happy :)

Took his class for Analytics IP. Everything is easy except Tableau which is a large portion of the class. Make sure to understand Tableau from the beginning or you will find the final group project extremely hard.
Take his class you won't regret it. Tableau is awesome and really helpful for the real world.

Doesn't grade fairly. I think he skims through assignments when grading even though they are worth 35% of grade. You have to handwrite out code on tests which is obnoxious, and he doesn't make the problems easier. Unless your a wiz at coding its going to be TOUGH

Nice person... He will answer your emails at any day or time. I emailed him once on a Friday night at 10 pm because I forgot to turn in an assignment, and he responded 3 mins later. In this regard, he's a solid teacher. BUT his lectures a BORING like mind-bogglingly boring and his powerpoints are useless. In general hes is a hardo. Dont take him

He seems to have a lot of experience and passion for python/programming. Unfortunately, his enthusiasm is short-lived and you will find that his class is incredibly boring, and his lecture notes are essentially useless. If you actually do the assignments you will be fine, the exams are fair. Overall I just think there are better professors.

He is a super nice guy. I had prior exp in c++ and python is insanely easy to learn. I believe he goes over the fundamentals of programming and python itself extremely well, since he is very knowledgable. Theres a program due every week and 2 quizzes 1st half of the semester. I found exams to be straight forward. Group project is meh20% of grade.

On the positive side, he is a nice guy and would cut you some slack, oftentimes too much slack. Kids did not respect his class in the slightest and that has to be factored in. This being said, almost nothing of value was taken away from this course. Boring, outdated, and so slow that anyone with any interest in material would be annoyed at the pace

This class was so unbelievably boring, it was a chore to come to. Unfortunately, Groner is a really nice guy, and makes himself readily available to students, but his class is simply average. I wouldn't recommend. The midterm and final material doesn't match the majority of the lectures. The only thing I learned about was Amazon.
Love him. Took his Python Course. Very professional with industry experience. Very considerate and kind to students.

He could get a little boring and night class for almost 3 hours is rough, but overall he is very fair. His quizzes are easy and his slides are actually helpful. His tests are a little more difficult if you don't know how to code that well, but overall he is always there to help you and responds to your emails as soon as you need help.

Prof Hekkala is a wonderful professor. She's caring, empathetic, and is not a difficult grader. We had two exams, a final exam, and two 3-page papers. Relative to other Bio classes, this was the smoothest and easiest one to take.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Hekkala is adorable! She really knows/loves ecology and is super helpful. Her tests are easy, she makes lecture fascinating, and she doesn't grade too harshly on the papers. She can be a little disorganized but its not really a big deal. Skim the text, come to class, and you will get a B+ minimum.

I don't think this professor realizes we are in the middle of a pandemic. His exams are unfair and he will do whatever he can to keep your class at a low B level. His class required more time than all of my other classes combined.... and it's literally an ecology class..... Exams are unfair. Do not take him unless you want to stress 24/7.
ratingTags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Dr. Franks for evolutionary biology, a subject that I was originally not super interested in, and I became fascinated by it. He was a super good lecturer and funny at times, and he was always super clear in his explanations. The exams are pretty much exactly what you'd expect, and he is always super clear about what will be on them.
ratingTags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ecology professor - 26 chapter cumulative exam that was way harder than necessary. Avoid.

Took this man for Ecology. He turned one of the easiest biology classes into one of the hardest ones I've taken at Fordham. The exams were harder than my Biochemistry and Virology exams.   If you have the chance to avoid this guy, do it. Take the other ecology classes/professors where the averages are in the 90s. This guy sucks.
ratingTags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Participation matters heavily, so you want to say something every class and excel in the speaking exercises he has you go through in class. Clearly passionate about the material, but his conveying that to us was mediocre. Awkward to talk to outside class, but his assessments aren't the most difficult things in the world so long as you study.
ratingTags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Definitely a research-first academic. Great, knowledgeable guy, but just not a great teacher.
extremely helpful and nice.  helped me not only with class and research but also with post-graduate things, always there for his students.  Thank you Dr. Franks

Ecology was easy. Just study and you should do fine. His exams aren't hard if you actually study and listen and focus in class. People will do worse than expected in ecology cause they come in with an attitude that it will be miserable and boring. Well no wonder you got a B+ then. Lab is easy (no exams).

The class itself is not the easiest class I've ever had, but it certainly isn't as bad as say, physio or molecular bio (and the lab is MUCH easier than intro bio lab) Dr. Franks is a good guy. There were maybe 2 or 3 difficult/trick multiple choice questions in the whole course, the rest were very fair. He is helpful and knows the material well.

I don't know what the first post is talking about this class is very easy, fun and enjoyable.  He is really nice and his exams and grades are really fair including the final. The labs are kind of silly and involve many field trips.  Overall nice, fun, easy bio course and a nice break from the more difficult science classes.

he's very nice... The material is easy but somehow its not too simple to get an A on each test... so study and don't make the mistake of thinking its all common sense and you dont need to study.  Still, he is so nice and helpful. Lab is really interesting and the labs are good. The lessons the course teaches you are good ones that stick with you.

Taking him for ecology I thought it was going to be a VERY easy class-I WAS WRONG! His expectations are unclear and his grading is hard.Going to see him doesn't do anything and my experience with this class was anything but easy, fun or enjoyable.Beware-the final is ridiculous and unfair
